loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth S. is a single parent with one child. She has been schooled through junior high school. Since 2007, Elizabeth has sold cooked yams and stew in Abura. Elizabeth uses her income to pay bills. Elizabeth will use the loan to expand her business by buying fresh yams and other ingredients for the food she prepares and sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to re-invest.

loans.use: To buy yams and other ingredients

loans.name: Emmanuel's Group

texts.en:
M. Emmanuel is a businessman with a bar that he has owned for 8 years. He is a person who has worked hard for his family and business to the extent that he would like to see his bar grow much farther. At the moment, Emmanuel is able to make weekly profits worth 40,000/=, and his main challenge is that at times he gets threats of robbery. He is becoming conscious of buying his stock during the day and avoiding late nights.

Emmanuel needs a loan to be able to restock his bar with more beers, spirits and wines so that he will be able to make more profit. He is a married man with 4 children as he cares for 1 orphan plus paying their school fees and general upkeep.

loans.use: Restocking his bar with more drinks

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita G. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 57 years old. Nenita is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a business selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Nenita has been in business for over 39 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Nenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seafood products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nenita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seafood for resale

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid R. has worked for many years in the difficult business of raising cattle. After purchasing his cattle, he provides them with all the right conditions for their growth: taking care of their food and protection and making sure they don’t get lost. Once they’re fully mature, he sells them in his area and also provides their milk for sale.

Currently, Khalid needs to purchase cattle to raise and for this reason he is turning to AqroInvest to obtain a loan of 2,000 USD. He thanks Kiva for the support that it presents to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Liliam

texts.es:
Lilian es una socia activa y colaboradora, tiene 48 años D. edad, es madre D. tres hijos, dos mayores y uno menor D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. medicinas (tiene una botica)y también  tiene una pequeña fuente D. soda que funciona en su domicilio, ella trabaja junto a su esposo en ambos negocios. Es integrante del Banco Comunal “Las Gemas II” desD. hace dos años, en donD. se caracteriza por su puntualidad. Empezó con un préstamo D. 300 soles, que invirtió en gaseosas.  
Con este préstamo D. 1000 soles, comprará productos D. medicina. La meta D. Lilian es ampliar su fuente D. soda para poder vender también comidas típicas D. la región.
texts.en:
Lilian is an active and collaborative member. She is 48, and she has three children. Two are grown, and one is a minor. She sells medicine (she has a pharmacy), and she also has a small soda fountain in her home. She works with her husband in both businesses. She has been a member of the Las Gemas II Communal Bank for two years. In the bank she is known for her punctuality. She started with a loan for 300 PEN, which she used to buy soft drinks. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy medicinal products. Liliana’s goal is to expand her soda fountain to be able to also sell food that is typical to the region.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medicinal products

loans.name: Martin Ismael

texts.es: Martin Ismael S. tiene 32 años, el tiene 3 hijos a su cargo y todos asisten a clases con el duro esfuerzo que realiza. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, hace mas de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio a él siempre le ha gustado ganarse el pan de cada día de una manera muy humilde. El dio inicio a este negocio hace 2 años, empezó vendiendo recargas telefónicas, y más tarde decidió establecer golosinas. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra granos básicos, jabón, detergentes, gaseosas y ciertos productos de limpieza. Su deseo es tener prosperidad en su vida y en su trabajo.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sabita M. lives in the village of Dolchoki. Dolchoki is one of the least developed villages of Lalitpur. Dolchoki is located in a hilly region. Almost all the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. M. is engaged in goat farming. She sells goats to dealers. She started goat farming work more than five years ago. She is satisfied with her income. She is requesting a loan of 5000 NPR to buy baby goats for her business. She started this business to become independent and to help her husband in fulfilling household expenses.

loans.use: To buy baby goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
G. Myagmarsuren is 29 years old and lives with his wife and 2-year-old son in Uvurkhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His wife is currently employed as a cook at a café. Myagmarsuren operates a taxi service in his town. He started his business in 2007 and has had success in his first two years of operation. Today he is well established among the many taxi drivers and has a good reputation as a driver. Myagmarsuren's business is important to him and he works hard to support his family. He says, "I want my brother to be able to finish college. I will do my best to support him." Myagmarsuren is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase machinery parts for his car and to assist in paying his brother's tuition fees.

About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva's 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

loans.use: Purchase machinery parts for his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita A. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 59 years old. Anita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a business making & selling specialty food products in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Anita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Anita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem S., age 42, is married and lives with her six children in Kompongchnang Province, Cambodia. S. raises ducks and sells their eggs. She is able to earn an income of USD $7.00 per day to help cover the family's expenses. She has been in this business since 2008. 

Her husband is a skilled fisherman who earns an income of USD $2.00 per day to help their family. S. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses and to reduct their daily expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s field partner. She wants to use the loan to buy duck food. This is her fifth loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy duck food

loans.name: Nueva Luz Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal NUEVA LUZ está formado por 10 clientes, pertenecen a la Zona D. San Antonio, Villa Copacabana, que están ubicados alrededor del hospital Escobar Uria las socias se dedican a la venta D. perfumes, aretes, collares, ollas, servilletas, reposteria, venta D. juguetes, Durante su permanencia en Emprender, que son 6 ciclos se reestructuro en un 10% D. las socias, manteniéndose conformada por  todas las socias fundadoras del banco.

La Sra. Rosse Es la líder, presidenta y una D. las fundadoras del banco, este es su 6to ciclo y asume el cargo D. presidenta del banco, la señora es vendedora desD. muy joven, se dedica a la venta D. bisutería, como también cosméticos y otros, Tiene tres hijas, D. las cuales la del medio le ayuda en las ventas, como también tiene su esposo quien no genera muchos ingresos económicos, es por esa razón que tiene que seguir trabajando para el sustento D. su familia y así poder ayudar a su esposo para que no falte nada en el hogar y poder brindarles el apoyos en el estudio D. sus hijos y en el futuro sus hijos tengan una mejor situación económica con su profesión, su participación como socia fue gracias a sus compañeras que le invitaron a participar en el grupo. 
Los créditos obtenidos fueron para invertir en su capital como también para viajar a vender, a ferias en otros departamentos como Santa cruz y Cochabamba

La Sra. Patricia es una D. las organizadoras y fundadoras del banco D. emprendimiento que dio origen al banco Nueva Luz, trabaja con nuestra institución durante 3 años, Desempeña el cargo D. tesorera en el banco, es una D. las socias bastante dinámica en el grupo, exigente con sus compañeras durante el tiempo D. permanencia en el grupo.

La Sra Patricia se dedica a la venta D. variedad D. productos D. bisutería con su carrito , D. manera ambulante ofrece sus productos en ferias, mercados, al igual que su esposo trabajan juntos, tiene tres hijas su hija mayor tiene 12 años la menor 8 y una D. 3 años, el crédito obtenido le ayudo bastante para poder mejorar su estado económico en su familia y darle una mejor vida para sus hijos y generar mayores ingresos económicos y aumentar el capital D. trabajo.

La Sra. Patricia el crédito lo invertirá en la compra D. una tienda o un puesto D. venta en uno D. las ferias, su deseo es poder tener una casa propia y una tienda en el futuro deseando que sus sueños se hagan realidad.

La Sra. Cristina Es una D. las fundadoras del Banco actualmente se dedica al comercio ambulante con su carrito donD. ofrece productos entre ellos cosméticos, calcetines, anillos billeteras, etc.
La señora Cristina tiene dos hijas es una mujer sola emprendedora quien mantiene a sus dos hijas, Llego a conocer la institución Financiera Emprender gracias sus compañeras que le invitaron a formar el grupo, con el que accedió a un crédito, que le ayudo a aumentar su  mercadería, el crédito le ayudo mucho, gracias al crédito pudo pagar sus estudios D. su hija que estudia.
Como también doña cristina es sus tiempos libre hace costura a mano como edredones, sabanas, etc.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.

OJO. En la foto se encuentran mas integrantes porque una D. las socias vino con sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nueva Luz" (New Light) is maD. up of 10 members who are from the San Antonio neighborhood of Villa Copacabana, near the hospital Escobar Uria. The members sell perfume, earrings, necklaces, pots, napkins, pastries and toys. During their time with Emprender they have participated in 6 loan cycles; the founding members of the bank have remained, and they have expanded their membership by 10 percent. Senora Rosse Es is the leader, president, and one of the founding members of the bank. This is her 6th loan cycle, and she is taking on the position of bank president. She has been a merchant since she was very young; she sells jewelry and other miscellaneous items, including cosmetics. She has 3 daughters; the middle daughter helps her with the sales. Her husband does not generate much income, and for this reason she must continue to work to support her family so that she can help her husband so that the family lacks for nothing in the home, and so that she can proviD. support for the education of her children so that in the future they can have a profession and a better economic situation. Her participation in the group came about thanks to her companions who invited her to join the group. The loans they obtained were invested in their capital and were also used to allow the members to travel to sell in markets in other regions of the country such as Santa Cruz and Cochabamba. Patricia is one of the organizers and founders of a group that evolved into the communal bank Nueva Luz; she has worked with Emprender for 3 years. She is the treasurer of the bank, and is one of the most dynamic members of the group; she has been very demanding of the other members during the time she has been with the group. Patricia sells a variety of products (jewelry and other consumer goods) with her cart. She travels with her products to markets and fairs to sell her goods. She works with her husband in this business. She has 3 daughters; her oldest daughter is 12, and the younger ones are 8 and 3 years old. The loan she obtained helped her substantially in being able to improve the economic status of her family, and to proviD. a better life for her children, as she was able to generate an increased income by increasing her working capital. Patricia will use this loan to invest in the purchase of a store or sales post in one of the markets. Her wish is to be able to have her own home and a store. She hopes that these dreams will become reality in the future. Cristina Es, one of the founders of the bank, currently sells cosmetics, socks, rings, wallets and other items from a cart. Cristina is an enterprising woman who supports her 2 daughters on her own. She came to know the financial institution Emprender thanks to her companions, who invited her to become part of the group. In this way she was able to access a loan, which helped her to increase her merchandise. This was a great help to her, as thanks to the loan, she was able to pay for the education of her daughter who is in school. In addition, Cristina makes quilts and bed sheets by hand in her free time. All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have provided in granting this loan. Note: In the photograph you see more members because one of the members came with her three children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario B. is from the city of Guinsiliban in Camiguin Province. He is 33 years old. Mario is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mario buys and sells bananas in the local community. Mario has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Mario joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mario is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to expand his business. This will be Mario's first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Dalin

texts.en:
Mrs. Dalin N. is 33 years old and is a villager who lives in Chheu Teal Phluoh village in Takeo province. She is farmer who own a 2.5-hectare (6.25-acre) field on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Vanna Re, is a duck breeder who is able to earn a small income to support his family. He is shown on the right in the photo.

Aside from farming, Mrs. Dalin N. also raises pigs. She is now requesting 2,000,000 Riels from AMK to buy ten piglets to raise and the rest of the loan she will use to buy pesticide to support her farm crop.

This couple has two children, one of whom is attending in the public school while the youngest one is 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy ten piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Misioneras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Misioneras lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, humildes y perseverantes; una de ellas es la señora Luz Marina Martínez C. quien desde hace dos años instalo una pequeña venta en su casa y empezó a comercializar CD, DVD y videos. 

Esta señora de 34 años junto a su compañero de vida laboran arduamente en sus negocios para poder impulsar a sus tres hijos de 15, 14 y 12 años respectivamente. Ella invertirá el crédito en surtir ambos negocios con mayor cantidad y variedad de productos.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Fedelina Alejandra C. la cual comercializa repostería, frescos naturales y gaseosas y Lisseth Antonia R. quien desde hace cuatro años empezó a distribuir productos de la Zermat, marca reconocida por sus ventas vía catalogo.  Ambas con el préstamo desean mejorar y ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Missionaries group is made up of three hard-working women who are humble and perservering. Two years ago Mrs. Luz Marina M. C. started to sell products like CD and DVD players and videos out of her house. She is 34 years old and lives with her partner both of whom work arduously on their businesses to boost the lives of their three children, aged 15, 14, and 12 respectively. Her partners are Fedelina Alejandra C., who sells desserts, fresh juices, and sodas, and Lisseth Antonia R., who four years ago started to sell Zermat products, which is recognized brand that sells through catalogs. With the loan they hope to improve and grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains and meats

loans.name: Eustina

texts.en:
Eustina is a married mother of three boys and one girl, all of whom attend school.  She owns her home, which does not have water or electricity.  She cites her greatest monthly expenses as food, medical costs and school fees.

Eustina’s husband sells juice, and she sells coconuts and brooms.  She has been in this business for 10 years and sells wholesale and retail, at the market, door-to-door and from her home. Her customers are mainly hotel owners, food vendors and individuals.  The dry season is particularly challenging to her business as there are no coconuts. For additional income, Eustina has a shamba (farm) for after the coconuts have been harvested. 

With her 20,000 KES loan, Eustina wants to invest in the cultivation of coconuts and help pay her children's school fees.  Her goal is to start another project, perhaps a water business.

loans.use: Coconuts

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: Bl Sr. ELIAS nacido el once de Diciembre de 1987, en Villa Barrientos a 5 km de Santa Rita, ahora vive en la localidad de Pacay de la Ciudad de Santa Cruz tiene su propia parcela en la cual trabaja en la agricultura sembrando distintos productos, el es soltero siembra maiz, yuca, mani, frijol y Papa. Tambien el estudia solo los dias sabado de 8:00am a 18:00pm tiene sus padres que le apoyan con su trabajo. con el dinero del credito comprara mas semillas para la siembra de Papa ya que es temporada de siembra, despues de cosecharlo lo comercializa en el mercado de la zona y asi poder incrementar su capital de trabajo, uno de sus deseos es el de terminar sus estudios y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida, es un joven responsable y trabajador con ganas de superacion, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la Confianza Brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Elias, born on 11 December 1987, in Villa Barrientos, 5 kilometers from Santa Rita, now lives in Pacay neighborhood of the city of Santa Cruz. He owns his own farm plot where he grows various products like corn, manioc, peanut, bean and potato. He’s single and goes to school Saturdays from 8am to 6pm. His parents help him do his work. He will use the funds to buy potato seed because planting season is now; once harvested he will sell in the area market to increase his working capital. One of his dreams is to complete his studies in order to improve his quality of life. He’s a responsible, hard-working young man who very much wants to succeed. He is grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato seed.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: In Trapaing Chhrey village in Kandal province lives a person known as Mrs. Pheap C.. She is 32 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Toem Leang Se, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Although they try to work hard, they can't earn enough income. So to improve their family living conditions, Mrs. Pheap C. is seeking a loan to start a new business by building a store to sell desserts in the local village. She is the mother of four children. Two of the children attend the local public school, and the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To build a store to sell desserts

loans.name: Melva Azucena

texts.es: Melva Azucena tiene 41 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ella dio inicio por medio de una amiga que le había dado la idea de iniciar este medio de vida como una fuente de ingresos para su familia, con la ayuda de los financiamientos es que ha logrado mejorar cada día, su ubicación de es de manera ambulante por lo que tiene que salir todos los días y caminar bajo el intenso sol para ofrecer sus productos. Actualmente solicita este crédito para la compra de pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios, sombras, estuches, cremas y colonias. Melva sueña con mejorar la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Melva is 41 years old and sells cosmetics. She has been doing this for the past seven years and began after talking to a friend who gave her the idea. With the help of financing, she has been able to improve her business. She must go out every day and walk under the blazing sun to sell her products. She is asking for this loan in order to buy nail polish, lipsticks, shadow, cosmetic bags, creams, and colognes. Melva dreams of improving her family’s economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Hermencia

texts.es:
Hermencia B. A. vive en el Municipio de Soledad departamento del Atlántico,  cuenta  ella que llegó con su esposo  y sus 3  hermosas hijas, procedente de la ciudad de Cali, ubicado en el departamento de Valle del Cauca y aunque inició su negocio en Bucaramanga, encontró en esta zona del caribe, mejores oportunidades productivas, por eso es en este lugar donde montó  su microempresa, que ofrece servicios de diseño grafico de los accesorios de lujos que usan los vehículos como motos, carros y hasta bicicletas. Este es un negocio familiar en el que trabajan  Hermencia, su esposo y dos ayudantes,  allí en una maquina plotter hacen impresiones digitales de gran formato que estampan y convierten en lujosos accesorios para vehículos; así es como elaboran la publicidad, que aplican a cascos, retrovisores, chalecos que adornan cualquier vehiculo o accesorio que utilice su conductor. Herminia  también comercializa, cascos, chalecos, a los que aplica sus lujosos diseños a la medida del cliente, siempre que este lo solicite. Ella está aplicando a su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por un valor de $2.000.000 COP, que invertirá en materias primas, tales como reflectivos, letras,  agujas de plotter y en la compra  cascos y chalecos  para la venta.

Su máximo sueño compartido con su esposo Israel, es lograr el crecimiento de su negocio para poder brindarles a sus hijas  una educación de calidad  en el futuro. Siempre ha estado rodeada de desafíos pues ha tenido que cambiar 2 veces de ciudad y adaptarse a las costumbres de cada región, pero hace tres años encontró estabilidad con este negocio en la Costa Caribe Colombiana.
texts.en:
Hermencia B. A. lives in the town of Soledad, Atlántico department. She relates that she came with her husband and 3 beautiful daughters from the city of Cali, located in the Valle del Cauca department. Although she began her business in Bucaramanga, she found better opprtunities in this area of the Carribbean and that is why she set up her micro-business here. She offers graphic design for luxury accessories used in vehicles such as motorcycles, cars and even bicycles. This is a family business in which Hermencia, her husband, and two assistants work. In a plotter machine they make digital impressions in a grand format which with they stamp and make luxury accessories for vehicles. They make logos in this way that can be applied to helmets, rearview mirrors, and vests that adorn any vehicle or accessory used by a driver. Hermencia also sells helmets, and vests to which she applies her luxury designes to the clients order. She is applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in the amount of $2.000.000 COP. She will invest in raw materials such as reflectors, letters and plotter needles and in buying helmets and vests to sell. Her greatest dream, shared by her husband Israel, is to grow their business to be able to offer their daughters a quality education in the future. She has always been surrounded by challenges. She had to change cities twice and adapt to the customs of each region. Three years ago, she found stability with this business in the Carribean coast of Colombia.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw materials, such as reflectors, letters and plotter needles and to purchase helmets and vests to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella G. is currently in the business of selling beer and local brew at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Stella is 50 years old and is married. She has nine children and two of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Magali Del Rosario

texts.es: Magali del Rosario tiene 45 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que están bajo su cargo. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para el buen funcionamiento de su negocio. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, inicio hace mas de 12 años con muy pocos productos, debido a que no poseía mucho capital de trabajo, por lo que poco a poco es que ha ido mejorando su actividad ya que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar cada día más. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, juegos, pan y galletas. Por lo que sueña con incrementar su capital de trabajo pues le gustaría mantener siempre esta actividad económica.
texts.en:
Magali del Rosario, 45, has two children under her care. This isn’t the first time she has sought funding for the good functioning of her business. She has a small grocery store that she started with just a few items 12 years ago because she didn’t have much capital. Gradually she has been improving her store and she is always looking for ways to improve daily. The reason for this financing is to buy stock items for her store like: basic grains, sweets, natural beverages, juices, bread and cookies. Her dream is to increase her working capital because she’d like to keep this economic activity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Yaoska Mercedes

texts.es: Yaoska Mercedes es madre luchadora y soltera, tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo. La señora es dueña de un ciber, en donde trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, pues siempre está buscando la forma de salir adelante con su hijo.  Ella ya tiene 2 años con este negocio a pesar de los difíciles problemas que han enfrentado ya que ha tenido que dar a componer varios equipos. Ella está muy feliz con el trabajo que realiza pues sin él no tendría lo necesario para  comer todos los días. El financiamiento es para la compra de nuevas computadoras y ciertos productos necesarios.
texts.en:
Yaoska Mercedes is a struggling single mother with one young son who depends on her. She owns a cybercafé where she works every day from 7:00 AM to 9:00 PM. She is constantly looking for new ways to get ahead with her son and has had this business for two years, despite the difficulties she’s faced with having to repair some equipment. She is very happy with the work she does, because if it wasn’t for it, she would not be able afford to eat every day. She will use the money from this loan to buy new computers and other needed products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es casada y tiene 10 hijos D. los cuales 3 estudian, Esther viaja a las ferias D. la región en donD. venD. verduras, frutas y condimentos, D. las ferias compra queso que luego venD. en los mercados y las tiendas, actividad que realiza 3 días por semana. 

Esther es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas y solicita un préstamo D. 1000 soles para la compra D. verduras y frutas.

Los sueños D. Esther son educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio surtiendo con mas productos.
texts.en:
Esther is married and has 10 children, 3 of which are students. Esther travels to regional fairs and sells vegetables, fruits, and condiments. She buys cheese at the fair and then sells it to markets and stores three days a week. Esther is a member of Lilies Communal Bank and is requesting a 1000 Peruvian Soles loan to buy vegetables and fruits. Esther's dreams are to educate her children so they can become professionals and expand her business by offering more products.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina es socia del Banco comunal “Dulce Amanecer” desD. hace nueve años atrás, pertenece al distrito, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 62 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, grado D. instrucción primaria incompleta, y tiene dos hijos independientes.
Se dedica a la venta D. artesanía D. todo tipo ya sea bordados en bayeta y telares, tejidos a mano, croché, macramé entre otros, ella tiene un puesto D. artesanías en la ciudad D. Puno. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, para comprar productos artesanales.
Su visión es crecer y tener un puesto fijo en un mercado artesanal. Lo que más le gusta D. su Banquito Comunal son las Charlas educativas y compartir con las socias.
texts.en:
Agustina has been a member of the Communal Bank “Dulce Amanecer” (Sweet Dawn) for nine years. This Communal Bank is located in the district, province, and department of Puno. Agustina is 62 years old, married, and has two adult children who are independent. She was not able to finish elementary school.

Agustina makes her living selling handicrafts of all types. These incluD. embroidered cloth and fabrics, hand woven items, crochet, macramé, and other products. She has a craft stand in the city of Puno. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos, which was in the amount of 300 PEN, she was able to increase her capital.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 PEN to buy more handcrafted products. Her vision is to grow and have an established stand at the artisan market. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the educational seminars and sharing with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handcrafted products

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie R., from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental, is 30 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ronie owns and operates a specialized retail store buying and selling seafood products, including fish, in the local community. Engaged in his business for over three years, he earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ronie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional fish to sell, he is now requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Ronie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: La señora Yolanda H. González desea terminar la construcción de un cuarto que por falta de capital no lo ha hecho, solo puso los cimientos y una parte de las paredes. Ella solicita de su apoyo para poder realizar su proyecto y así ofrecer a su familia mayor confort.  Yolanda es madre de tres pequeños a los cuales quiere ofrecer un mejor patrimonio, para esto ella vende ropa usada para apoyar a su esposo que trabaja en maquiladora.
texts.en: Ms. Yolanda H. G. wants to finish the construction of a room in her house, but because of lack of capital has only been able to lay the concrete for the floor and some of the walls. She is asking for a loan to be able to finish her project so that she can offer her family a more comfortable home. Yolanda is the mother of 3 small children to whom she would like to offer better family assets. To accomplish this, she sells used clothes to help her husband who works in an assembly plant.

loans.use: finish construction

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda R. is a married woman who lives in Purok Mahogany, Brgy. Jonobjonob, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by growing vegetables.  Her husband, Reniboy, who is 44 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have nine children who are 6 to 22 years old. Luzminda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Luzminda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000, which she intends to use to purchase fertilizers for her eggplant garden so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Luzminda R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

Luzminda is shown in the accompanying photo with large sacks of her vegetables all packed up and ready to be taken to the market.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her eggplant garden

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
Fernanda forma parte del banco comunal “Pueblo de Indios Emprende” perteneciente a la comuna de San Vicente de Tagua Tagua. Ella vende artesanías en greda, las cuales compra en Pomaire y flores plásticas, las que  compra en Santiago (capital de Chile). Vende sus productos hace 6 años de manera ambulante, en la vereda del frente de un cementerio. 
Con este préstamo comprará mercadería, es decir, flores plásticas y artesanías en greda. Tiene 5 familiares participando en Fondo Esperanza, entre ellos su hija, quien vende flores naturales. Tiene 2 hijos, mayores de edad y una nieta de 2 años, quien, al igual que su hija, vive con ella. 
Su sueño es tener un local establecido, para de esta forma, trabajar más tranquila y protegida del calor y la lluvia. Gracias a Fondo Esperanza, Fernanda ha logrado aumentar las cantidades de su mercadería.
 San Vicente de Tagua Tagua es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, perteneciente a la región del Libertador General Bernardo O’higgins, emplazada a orillas del río Estero Zamorano. Su principal fuente económica se basa en la producción de limones, naranjas y paltas.
texts.en:
Fernanda is a member of the “Pueblo de Indios Emprende” community bank which is located in the district of San Vicente de Tagua Tagua.  She sells handicrafts made from clay which she buys in Pomaire and artificial flowers which she buys in Santiago (the capital of Chile).  She has been selling her products in an itinerant manner for 6 years on the sidewalk outside a cemetery.

With this loan she will buy goods, that is to say artificial flowers and clay handicrafts.  She has 5 family members who are participating in Fondo Esperanza, including her daughter who sells live flowers.  She has two children who are grown up and a 2 year-old granddaughter as well as her daughter who lives with her.

Her dream is to have established premises so that she can work more peacefully, protected from the heat and the rain.  Thanks to Fondo Esperanza, Fernanda has managed to increase the quantity of her goods.

San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a district in the central area of Chile in the Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins region on the banks of the river Estero Zamorano.  The area's main source of income is the production of lemons, oranges and avocados.

loans.use: Clay decorations and plastic flowers

loans.name: Cristal 1 Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “CRISTAL I” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, es un grupo nuevo que se ha agrupado para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes.  Los negocios que ellas desempeñan son variados: tejido de mantas y chompas, trenzado de mantas, venta en kiosco de refrescos y otros, artesanìas tienda de barrio, venta de láminas – periódicos – letreros, venta de láminas de plancha (láminas metálicas. 
La señora Juana presidenta de la banca comunal indica que forma parte del B.C. “Cristal I” gracias a la invitación de los promotores de Pro Mujer, quienes fueron a su zona para dar a conocer de los servicios de crédito, capacitación y salud.  La señora Juana tiene como negocio la elaboración de “bouquet de novia”, inició este negocio hace 10 años siguiendo el consejo de su cuñada, también piensa en ampliar sus ingresos con la venta de edredones y productos de belleza para las fiestas de fin de año. El negocio de elaboración y venta de “bouquet de novia” es a pedido, de acuerdo a la demanda que hacen las tiendas especializadas en venta de vestidos y accesorios para novias; cuando es necesario sus hijos de 18 y 17 años le ayudan en el armado de los los “bouquet de novia”.
Cuando se le consultó que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que es el ahorro, la capacitación y la atención en salud en el consultorio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Cristal 1” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. It is a new group that formed in order to receive credit services, training, and health care. The group consists of eight members. The businesses in which the members work are varied: weaving blankets and sweaters, managing a refreshment kiosk, operating a neighborhood craft store, selling paper goods (including individual sheets, newspapers, and posters), and selling sheets of metal.

Sra. Juana is the president of the Communal Bank. She says she joined the Cristal 1 Communal Bank after being invited by the promoters of Pro Mujer who came to her area to raise awareness about the credit, training, and health services. Sra. Juana has a business making bridal bouquets. She started this business ten years ago based on the advice of her sister-in-law. Juana also plans to increase her earnings by selling bedspreads and beauty products during the year-end holidays. Her business of making and selling bridal bouquets is conducted based on orders she receives from specialty stores that sell formalwear and accessories to brides. When necessary, her children (ages 18 and 17) help with the assembly of the bridal bouquets.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Julia replied that she enjoys the savings, the training, and the health services she receives at the clinic.

loans.use: Purchase bedspreads & beauty products to sell during the holidays

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia, de 42 años, convive con Isaías, de 38 años. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 5 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Sanchirio del Palomar (selva central peruana). Está empeñosa mujer, tiene 8 años dedicándose a la agricultura, donde su principal sembrío consta de café, palta y plátano. Pero según menciona, el café es el principal soporte económico que tiene. Sus 4 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, le producen buen grano de café, por ello busca otro mercados donde le puedan pagar más cantidad de dinero por su producción; ahora viaja una vez al mes a la ciudad de Tarma, donde comercializa a la señora Gladys, que es una comerciante mayorista. Razón por la cual necesita ir a la capital para comercializar su producción, donde espera recibir mejores propuestas de venta, y de esa manera ampliar sus terrenos agrícolas. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, y está segura que con la ayuda de su banco comunal, podrá lograr los objetivos planteados. De adquirir el crédito solicitado tiene pensado comprar 6 sacos de abono orgánico para sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en: Teodosia, 42, lives with Isaias, 38.  They have 6 children, 5 of whom still live with them, in the house they own in the town of Sanchirio del Palomar (in a forested region of central Peru).  This hard-working woman has operated a farming business for 8 years.  She grows avocados and platanos, but her coffee crop is her main source of income.  She has 4 hectares of land that produce a good grade of coffee bean and she wants to find other markets where she can get mO. money for her crop.  She now goes to the city of Tarma once a month where she sells to a wholesaler, Sra. Gladys.  She wants to sell her crop in the capital in the future because she thinks she can get a better price there and, in turn, expand her business.  This is Teodosia's first MFP loan and she is sure that--with help from her community bank--she can meet the goals she has for the farm.  She will use the loan to buy 6 sacks of organic manure for her coffee crop.

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON  DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Marcos; el tiene 43 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el negocio que tiene el socio es un taller de mecánica  el cual se encuentra ubicado en su casa, la ocupación del socio es mecánico automotriz el socio es una persona muy entusiaste y de esta forma el socio saca a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para los estudios de su hija y para la implementación de su negocio, el socio comprara aceite de autos,pintura para carros entre   otros.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marcos, 43, is a member of the “PATRON DE SANTIAGO” communal bank located in Cusco district which is part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

He has a live-in partner and two children.  His business is a machine shop located in his house.  He is an auto mechanic.  He is a very enthusiastic person and this is how he supports his family.

He is asking for a loan for his daughter’s educational expenses and for his business.  He will buy oil and paint for autos, among other things.

He is happy because of the loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: For his daughter's school expenses and to buy supplies for his auto shop.

loans.name: Maurita

texts.es:
Maurita es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisun, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos de 16, 13, 10 y 6 años de edad. Maurita es feriante, viaja de viernes a domingo a la selva de Santa Rosa y sus anexos lleva: verduras surtidas, pescado, gallinas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en comprar: verduras surtidas, pescado, gallinas. A Maurita le gusta Finca porque le dan créditos, puede ahorrar, aprendió a ser responsable a llevar mejor su negocio, a mejorar en su familia.
Su sueño es poder abrir  su negocio en su casa, que sus hijos sigan estudiando, ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
Maurita is a member of the Ccatarisun communal bank.  She is 36, married, and has 4 children, ages 16, 13, 10 and 6.  Maurita works at markets.  She travels from Fridays to Sundays to the Santa Rosa jungle and nearby markets where she takes: assorted vegetables, fish, and chickens.  She will use the loan to buy the different vegetables, fish and chickens.  Maurita likes Finca because it extends loans, she can save, and she has learned how to  be responsible in improving her business and helping her family.

Her dream is to open her own business in her home, for her children to continue studying, and to enlarge her house.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fish and chickens

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa tiene 52 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo en uno D. los caseríos que conforma el distrito D. Las Lomas, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la región Piura y que se encuentra situada a más D. tres horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización D. combustible entre los pobladores D. la zona, asimismo cuenta con un grupo D. animales menores, los cuales cría en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio para luego venderlos al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donD. residen. Estas actividades son bastante importantes para la economía D. su familia ya que depenD. D. ellas para ayudar a su esposo a sustentarlos.

María desea ampliar su negocio D. crianza y venta D. animales con la compra D. más animales y alimento, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas y percibir un mayor número D. ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Teresa is 52 years old, married, and lives with her husband in one of the villages that make up the District of Las Lomas, an agricultural area tha is part of the region of Piura. This community is located more than three and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

María Teresa sells fuel to the local villagers. She also has a herd of small animals that she raises in pens located near her home. María sells the animals to the general public and to merchants who frequently visit the area where she lives. These activities are important for her family’s finances since she depends on them to help her husband support themselves.

María wants to expand her business of raising and selling animals by purchasing more of them as well as feed. She hopes to increase her sales and generate more income. To accomplish this goal, she is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase animals and feed

loans.name: Alimaa

texts.en:
Alimaa, 56, lives with her son and daughter-in-law and two grandchildren in their own apartment in Darhan, the second biggest city in Mongolia. Her husband passed away 8 years ago. She started her meat trading business in a local market with the working capital of 250,000 MNT in 1996. In the past 12 years, she has managed to increase her money 12 times over. Her business has expanded even a little more now so she is able to buy a certain amount of meat and sell it in her stall in the local market. 

Even though she has a hearing impairment, she has been trying hard to operate a successful business and has managed so far. She is a good-tempered, hard-working woman. Alimaa says, "My dream is to help my son to build up a source of regular income so that he can live without stress all his life." She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy and keep more meat that she to sell during Tsagaan Sar, Mongolian traditional New Year.

loans.use: To buy and display more meat for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothing

loans.name: Las Gardenias Group

texts.es: Matilde es una nueva socia de la Alcancía Comunal “Las Gardenias” tiene 58 años de edad  y nueve hijos, de los cuales 2 aun dependen de ella, su hija de 23 años de edad estudia economía en la Universidad Mayor de San Marcos y su hijo de 16 años aun está en la secundaria. Matilde se encarga de cubrir todos los gastos de sus hijos y los gastos de la casa ya que su esposo se encuentra desaparecido hace muchos años, es una madre ejemplar ya que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo pudo criar a sus hijos y aun sigue trabajando, ella se dedica a la ventas de verduras y cereales frescos  y algunos tubérculos, Matilde se encarga personalmente de traerlos de la chacra (sierra central). Ella solicitó el préstamo para comprar papa, queso, choclo, olluco, arvejas y carne.  Matilde sueña con tener una bodega en su casa y de esta manera asegurar su futuro. En la fotografía podemos apreciar a 9 socios del grupo en el momento de su respectivo desembolso y una de las socias acompañada de su niña.  El señor V. P. Edgardo Humberto no pudo asistir al desembolso por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en: Matilde, 58, is a new member of the Las Gardenias community bank.  She has nine children, two of whom still depend on her: a daughter, 23, who is a student of economics at the Universidad Mayor de San Marcos and a son, 16, who is still in high school.  Matilde is responsible for supporting the children and paying the family's other expenses because her husband abandoned the family several years ago.  She is an amazing mother who has managed to raise her children while working hard to support them.  Matilde operates a business selling fresh vegetables and grains, along with other produce.  She buys the products herself from a farm in the country and brings them to her town for sale.  She is applying for a loan so that she can buy potatoes, cheese, beans and meat that she will resell.  Matilde would like to open a store in her house one day, a step that would ensure her future.  There are 9 members of the community bank in the photograph, one of whom brought her little daughter.  Sr. V. P. Edgardo Humberto wasn't able to attend the session, taken when she funds were distributed, because he had to work.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 8 children, five of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in a home that she rents, where she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Hadjah has been selling plantains for six years, and she works 7 days a week. She sells her products at the market. She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna V. is from the village of Spring Kibawe, Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Lorna is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, candies, detergents, sugar,  shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & detergents. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & detergents.

loans.name: Nehemia

texts.en:
Nehemia C., age 44, owns and operates a general store, where she sells both food and daily-use products to members of the local community. Nehemia has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have two school-aged children. She is from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela. 

In 2008, Nehemia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Nehemia has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Nehemia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Nehemia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ra'eqa

texts.en:
Ra’eqa A. K., who has creative and artistic ideas, decided to learn from her husband’s previous experience in carpet weaving and spinning, and combine it with her creative skill to start their own business five years ago.

Ra’eqa started to create beautiful carpet designs and work with her husband in turning those designs into actual carpets in many sizes and sell them. Their carpets now are known in their city Zarqa, 

Ra’eqa has applied for this loan to be able to open their own shop since they are now working at their house. In the future their ambition is to open other branches so they can reach all Jordanian cities.

loans.use: To open their own shop for carpet-weaving and spinning.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita works hard to support her family. Rosita is married and has a carinderia/eatery business in the Philippines.

Rosita requested a PHP 29,500.00 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  Rosita has been in this business for 2 years now.  In the future, Rosita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 47 years old and lives with her husband and son in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  Her husband is a driver who owns his transportation business and her son works in a private company.  She manages an intestine trading business at a rented stall in a local market.  She started her business in 2000.  Her working capital is 1,000,000 MNT with daily earnings of 150,000-200,000 MNT. 

Narantsetseg requests a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more intestines for trade and construction materials for her house.  She plans to continue her work and expand her business in the future. She is a polite and friendly woman who says, "I want to do construction work on my house."

loans.use: to buy more intestines for trade and materials for home construction

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, a 25-year-old, is married and blessed with a six-year-old child who is in school. To earn a living, she grows vegetables. Besides this, she also works as a casual laborer to generate additional income.  

Cecilia joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that she would have access to financial resources easily because the members of the group guarantee each others loans.  She has also managed to grow her business through Faulu Kenya, hence improving her living standards. She has requested for 20,000 Kes to buy seedlings.

loans.use: to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is married, with 7 children. He has been farming in the Philippines for 34 years. Samuel is asking for a loan to acquire corn seed to be planted on his farm and fertilizers such as manure.  At present, Samuel earns only PHP 40,000 for each crop. He uses his earnings from the yield to pay his obligations to the merchants. Samuel hopes that this loan will expand his operations. He hopes for additional earnings from the yield to provide for his family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed and fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis, a 34-year-old single man, has been growing rice for five years, earning about PHP30000 per cropping.  Because of insufficient capital, he is requesting a loan of PHP27000 to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides. Dennis is confident that this loan will enable him to increase his  income and improve both his business and his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Manuela Petita

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal 4 De Noviembre.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Manuela, tiene 43 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 17, 12 y 11 años los mismos que estudian en colegio. El marido es controlador de buses.
 
Ella para ganarse la vida y poder ayudar a su esposo y a sus hijos se dedica a la venta artículos para el hogar (licuadoras, planchas, tostadoras, entre otras cosas), nos cuenta que ella en las mañanas se dedica a recorrer por toda la localidad ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra cada fin de semana, pero en las tardes ella instala una mesa en las afueras de su casa y allí vende las deliciosas empanadas de verde, mochines de yuca, corviches  y gaseosas. Trabaja todos los días y lleva realizando esta actividad dos años y nos cuenta que le está yendo muy bien, ella empezó su negocio con uno de los créditos que recibió de la institución.

Este crédito es para comprar planchas, licuadoras y víveres para elaborar los bocadillos. Lleva diez años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado para poder comenzar en sus negocios.
 
Su sueño es ver realizados a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the November 4th Communal Bank meet every 15 days in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as the Panama hats that are famous within and outside of the country.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Manuela. She is 43 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 17, 12, and 11) who are in school. Her husband is a bus traffic controller.

In order to earn a living and help her husband and children, Manuela sells household appliances (blenders, irons, toasters, and other items). She says that she goes out in the mornings to offer her products in every part of town. Manuela sells her products on credit and collects payment every weekend. In the afternoons, she has a table set up in front of her house where she sells delicious vegetable empanadas, cassava fritters, fish fritters, and sodas. Manuela works every day and has been in business for two years. She says that she has done very well. Manuela started her business with one of the loans she received from Fundación ESPOIR.

This loan will be used to buy irons, blenders, and ingredients for making her snacks. Manuela has been with the Communal Bank for 10 years and enjoys being a member because the assistance she has received helped her to start her businesses. Her dream is to see her children develop.

loans.use: to purchase irons, blenders, and ingredients for making her snacks.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ingredients for her food vending business.

Fely has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Fely has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 24-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with one sibling and one cousin. One year ago, he opened a small shop where he started to sell mobile phones and watches. This young man has newly started his business and needs so much support to move forward. So today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his store’s inventory. He notes that the loan will help him fulfill his objectives and will positively impact his business growth and development.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana de 53 años de edad vive en la zona central de Barranquilla, con su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 18 a 31 años. Allí tiene un negocio donde vende mercancía variada y una refresquería, negocios a los que la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ha vendido apoyando con financiamiento hace 4 años y ella gracias a esta organización ha logrado poco a poco el crecimiento de su ingreso. Esta es su segunda financiación mediante la línea credikiva y Ana agradece a su financiadores, el apoyo y la confianza depositada en ella, pues con la inversión, logró aumentar su capital de trabajo y con sus utilidades comprar una nueva nevera para refrigerar jugos, y ofrecerle a su clientela la posibilidad de refrescarse y tener más espacio en su congelador para la disposición de hielos y otros refrescos en mayor volumen. Con el apoyo de la Fundación, Ana no solo ha conseguido fortalecer su negocio, sino que con las utilidades producidas también  mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales, comprar electrodomésticos y otros beneficios para su hogar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará mercancía para responder a encargos, como calzado sabanas y toallas que se encuentran en descuento y logrará mayores utilidades y una mejor respuesta a sus clientes. Actualmente en su negocio, Ana maneja una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 30 días, una liquidez de 2  y una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 33%.
texts.en: Ana, age 53, lives in the central zone of Barranquilla with her husband and three children between the ages of 18 and 31. There she has a business where she sells varied merchandise, as well as a drink store. The Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo has supported both of these business through loans for four years. Thanks to this organization she has seen her income increase bit by bit. This is her second loan through Kiva, and Ana thanks her lenders for the support and confidence they will give her. With this investment she will be able to increase her working capital and use her profits to buy a new fridge for her juice. This will offer her customers refreshment, and free up space in her freezer for ice cream and a higher volume of other drinks. With the Fundacion's support, Ana has been able not only to strengthen her business, but also to use her income to improve her living conditions, and to purchase home electronics and other items for her home. She is currently requesting a new Kiva loan, with which she will purchase merchandise to respond to orders, such as shoes, sheets and towels. These items are currently on sale and she will make a better income and get a good response from her customers. Currently, Ana manages a turnover of receivables of 30 days, a 2-day liquidity and profitability of sales of no less than 33%.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as shoes, sheets and towels in order to respond to orders; these are currently on sale.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a forty-three-year-old married man with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been taking care of the family with the help of his wife, and their dream is to set up sustainable income generating activities for the family. 

He has been in the poultry business for four years and in the transport business for ten years. His hardship is high fuel prices, and his vision is to have about three taxis plus 3,000 birds in the next three years. Johnson needs the loan to repair his taxi.

loans.use: To repair his taxi.

loans.name: Santos Bernardino

texts.es:
El señor Santos Bernardino es casado, tiene 39 años de edad, estudió  la educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales estudian, se dedica a la carpintería a la fabricación de todo tipo de muebles, iniciando este negocio como operario y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a la confección de tejidos.

Solicita un crédito que lo utilizara para ampliar su capital de trabajo en la compra de madera para la fabricación de telares, espera alcanzar su objetivo y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Santos Bernardino is 39 years old, married, and has an elementary school education. He has three children, two of whom are in school. Santos is a carpenter who makes all types of furniture. He started this business as an operator, but now he has five years of experience. Santos has the support of his wife, who makes hand-woven articles.

He is requesting a loan to use to increase his operating capital so that he can buy wood for making looms. Santos hopes to accomplish his goal and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is from the province of Isabela. She is 40 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She has been engaged in a direct selling business for over six years now.

Her business serves as a source of income for her family and helps her provide their daily needs. Now she is requesting a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional stock of items for her direct selling business such as apparels, clothing and some cosmetics. She wanted to develop her business to earn a higher income and save some of it for any future emergencies for her family security.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of items for her direct selling business such as apparels, clothing and some cosmetics.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 49 years-old and married with three children.  To earn a living, she provides veterinary services.  She has employed eight people to assist her in the business.  She also does dairy farming to earn extra income.  Since she joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save her money.  
Mary hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future.  She has requested a loan of 100, 000 Kenya shillings in order to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is 30 years old. She is married and has three children.

Annabel is engaged in food peddling. She cooks snack food like the "banana cue" and goes from house to house to sell her product. She has had this business for three years.

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional ingredients for her "banana cue" like cooking oil, sugar and bananas.

Annabel joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients used in making native snack food like "banana cue," which is intended for sale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is 44 years old and lives in West Point. She stopped her education in 12th grade, married, and has nine children between 10 and 27 years old. For the past twenty years she has been selling oil and dry meat in the local market. She likes the way people respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil and dry meat for her business. Her plans are to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more oil and dry meat for her business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El sr. Francisco, tiene 57 años de edad, es casado, viven en la comunidad de Callapani del municipio de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba.
Trabaja en la agricultura, produce papa, cebolla y frejol y los vende en el mismo lugar.
Francisco es una persona responsable en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y la educación de sus hijos.  
El crédito que ha solicitado los va invertir en la compra de más semillas e insumos, aumentar más superficies de cultivo e incrementar su producción y de esta forma tener más ingresos y mejorar la condición de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Francisco, 57, is married and lives in the community of Callapani in Mizque Municipality, Cochabamba Department.  He’s a farmer growing potatoes, onions and broad beans that he sells in the same place.  Francisco is a responsible person in his community because of the dedication he puts into his work and into his children’s education.  The loan he’s asked for is to buy seeds and supplies, to increase the surface area under cultivation and to increase production to earn higher income and improve his entire family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Munyofwe B Group

texts.en:
Albert is the facilitator of the Munyofwe B group. Albert and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Albert takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Albert had a very good maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Albert was only able to harvest 4½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Albert and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Albert will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Munyofwe B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Albert is pictured with his group members. The person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Virab

texts.en:
Virab is a farmer who raises cattle and keeps a greenhouse. He lives with his wife, two children, and parents. The family's daily costs have increased over the past few years, so Virab needs additional income to make ends meet. 

Virab plans to develop his farm. He has requested a loan to purchase a cow, forage, and seeds to cultivate his land. Virab will use any additional profits to improve his family's living conditions and ensure a better future for them.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, forage, and seeds.

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inhambane, tem 43 anos, tem 7ªclasse. Vive marritalmente e ee pai de 12 filhos.
Pratica o  negocio de vende de roupa usada na feira informal, nas quarta e sabados a mais de 12 anos.Nao tem empregados mas conta com ajuda da sua sobrinha que vive com ele,. Tem um rendimento mensal de 3000mt que aplica nas despesas da casa e na obra de reabilitacao da sua casa.
Este é o quinto emprestimo na hluvuku no valor de  de 15.000,mt para aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria os  quatro anteriores todos de 10.000,mt foram para mesma actividade. Futuramente pretende adiquirir mais emprestimos para comprar uma viatura para melhor gerir o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Luis was born in Inhambane. He is 43 years old and finished the seventh grade. He lives with his partner and has 12 children.
He's been selling secondhand clothing in the local market on Fridays and Saturdays for more than 12 years. He doesn't have any employees, but his niece, who lives with him, helps him with the business. He earns about 3,500 meticals a month, which he uses to cover household expenses and for renovating his home.
This is his fifth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to increase his stock. His four previous loans, all for 10,000 meticals, were used for the same purpose. In the future, he plans to request further loans to buy a vehicle that will help him run his business better.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a widowed woman. She has seven children. Luvuno operates a charcoal-selling business and sells her goods at the market. She's worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are the general public. Luvuno's other source of income includes income from the children. 

She describes her greatest business challenge to be high transport charges, and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. 

Luvuno will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. Luvuno aspires to expand the business in the future. She joined Yehu to access cheap funds.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Auntie

texts.en: Auntie operates a provisions store and also sells clothing in Adum Banso, near Takoradi. She has been in this business for the past eight years. Auntie is married and has five children.
