Her husband is a contractor at the local palm oil plantation. Auntie is responsible for paying her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more goods for her store. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her store.

loans.name: Mukisa Busega Group

texts.en:
Zulaika is a 45-year-old single mother of three children ages 19, 15 and 10, and she also looks after her sister’s children since her sister's passing three years ago.

Zulaika is a market vendor. She sells vegetables in Busega market and her customers are people who regularly visit the market. Zulaika works hard every day in order to look after her children by providing for their quality education and basic needs. Zulaika is recommended by her customers for having the best customer care services.

She needs a loan to buy more stock of vegetables to enable her to better compete with the rest of the market vendors.

She has hopes of improving her business and reconstructing her home.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, tomatoes and fruits to sell

loans.name: Juan Gerardo

texts.en:
Seven years ago Gerardo started his business with the grocery and meat sales, he lost his job from where he was working and that proved a very difficult time for him. He was working in a slaughter and that was the reason to start a new business. He thinks about life, that it would have to be honest and lovely, so, he is looking for a worthy life and thinks about his family all the time.

He is married and is 36 years old, he is very hard-working and has two children. His wife divides her time assisting the home and her children, as well as she supports him in the business.

Some months ago he began other small business of groceries, sometimes his niece takes care of the business. This is the reason he gave her a job because in the afternoon he takes care of the business and is motivated to gain more working capital. For this reason he requires a loan of $925 USD to purchase merchandise for his business, in order to be able to cover his demand of clients. He requests a term to pay back in 6-12 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Hace siete años Don Gerardo inició su negocio de venta de abarrotes y carnes, debido a que se quedo sin empleo al ser despedido de donde trabajaba, él trabajaba en una carnicería eso lo motivo a establecerse por su propia cuenta a fin de poder salir adelante y tener una manera digna de vivir, además de poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Él esta casado, tiene 36 años de edad, es muy trabajador y tiene dos hijos, su esposa divide su tiempo atendiendo el hogar y a sus hijos, así como también le apoya en el negocio atendiéndolo.

Hace unos meses inició otro pequeño negocio de abarrotes, el cual a ratos atiende su sobrina, a quien le ha dado trabajo, y por la tarde el lo atiende, Lo anterior motivo a que se quedara corto de capital de trabajo, es por eso que requiere de un préstamo por $ 925 USD para poder comprar mercancías y resurtir su negocio, a fin de poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Solicita un plazo para pagar de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Kenedy

texts.en:
M. started his business in 1996 with capital of $800 from other sources. His business is situated in a busy market in Kibuye Kisumu. He is married and has 6 children who are going to school.

He has undergone training by Rafode in business management and loan use, and he buys the clothes to stock his market stall in Nairobi and Kampala, Uganda.

After receiving the loan, he wants to stock a greater variety of clothes to attract more clients.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Roth

texts.en: Roth P. is 49 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  P. runs a small grocery store in her village, which usually generates about $25 per day in revenue.  Her husband is a tailor and can make about $8 per day.  The couple has four children, who are still in school.  They hope to use this loan to purchase more grocery products in order to expand P.'s business.  In the future, the couple would like to build a house which they could use for a rental income.  Eventually, they hope that they will be able to send their children to a university.

loans.use: To buy more groceries in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Mrs. Seang S. N. is 42 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a merchant who purchases fertilizer in bulk from the wholesalers and resells it to the people in her area. Her husband  is a workman and can only make a meager sum for his household. In order to maximize her income, Mrs. S. N. is requesting a loan to purchase more fertilizer for her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer in bulk for her inventory

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mr. C. Sophal was married in 1982 and has only 1 daughter. He learned to repair many types of machines during on the job training from his friend in 1980. He started his own business after he got married in 1982. His wife does the house work and looks after her daughter. Villagers who use machines for their business always come to have their machines repaired by him.

He has borrowed money from MAXIMA for five times already. Now he is requesting a loan of $400. He will use this loan to purchase some spare machine parts for his stock.

loans.use: Purchasing some spare machine parts  for his stock

loans.name: Saxo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Saxo A., 55, is married and mother of three children. She also cares for her brother's two children. She lives with her husband who is a mason. They reside in Akoin (Alinka) where she has a vegetable garden. She manages to help support her family thanks to her earnings from selling her vegetables.

Although she is illiterate, Mrs. A. is very intelligent and very good at managing her business. She is asking for a loan of US$ 300 so that she can buy chemical fertilizers to increase her vegetable plot's productivity.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Saxo âgée de 55 ans est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants et à sa charge deux (02) autres enfants de son frère. Elle vie avec son mari maçon. Elle réside à Akoin (Alinka), où elle exerce comme activité les cultures maraîchères. Elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins de la famille grâce à la vente des légumes. Bien qu’analphabète, elle est douée d’une intelligence remarquable et a une bonne gestion de ses activités. Elle sollicite un crédit de $300 pour l’achat des produits chimique pour améliorer sa productivité.

loans.use:
Purchase of chemical fertilizers

Achat de produits chimiques

loans.name: Asimawu

texts.en:
Asimawu was attending secretarial professional school, but withdrew from the school when she had her first child in order to provide care and support. Now she sells handbags and cloth to shops in the Accra market. She also hawks (selling by walking with her products) her products when she has the time.

With her profits, Asimawu hopes to provide the highest education possible for her two children. She is currently single and lives with her parents. Her mother helps her take care of her children. Her father is too old to support the family, so they are all trying to earn enough money to take care of each other.

Asimawu is a member of the lending group, Vision. The group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To purchase handbags and cloth

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz is 28 years old and immediately after finishing her high school she started working to contribute with the household expenses and help support her younger brothers. Three years ago she started selling underskirts and vests.

Thanks to her dedication and persistence her sales have increased. She buys her merchandise in the city of Juliaca and brings it to Cuzco, where she has most of her clients. She is asking for this loan in order to increase the amount and variety of merchandise she takes to sell to Cuzco and this way she will increase her income; offering her parents and smaller brothers a better life style. Luz is seeking for your support to help improve her financial situation.

Translated from Spanish to English by Mayra Villegas, Kiva Volunteer

Luz es una joven de 28 años de edad. Inmediatamente después de concluir sus estudios secundarios se puso a trabajar desempeñando diferentes actividades con el fin de apoyar a sus padres en la solvencia económica de su familia. Actualmente se dedica a la comercialización de enaguas y chalecos, negocio en el que ya ha cumplido tres años dedicación y con el que gracias a su diligencia y empeño va teniendo mucho auge y popularidad.Ella adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Juliaca, luego las lleva para comercializarlos al Cuzco y el deseo de esta empeñosa joven es incrementar la cantidad y variedad de sus productos con el fin de obtener mayores ingresos económicos para brindarles comodidad y bienestar a sus queridos padres y hermanos menores.Luz confía que con tu apoyo desinteresado su situación económica mejorará.

loans.use: Increase the quantity and variety of merchandise

loans.name: María Olga

texts.es:
Maria Olga has been selling cosmetics by catalog for 4 years she began this because one of her 3 children is studying at the university and she wants to pay for his studies so that he can finish school. To be able to pay for her studies, Maria needs more merchandise. It is for this that Maria is requesting a loan of $700 that is arranged to be paid in one term of 6 months and with this money she will purchase merchandise so that she will have a better variety of products and thus have more clients to be able to pay for the education of her children and especially her oldest son.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

María Olga tiene 4 años vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo esto lo comenzó puesto que uno de sus 3 hijos está estudiando la universidad y ella desea poder pagarle la carrera para que pueda terminar de estudiar.

Para poder pagarle los estudios María necesita más mercancía. Es por eso que María está solicitando un crédito de US $700 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar más mercancía para poder tener variedad en sus productos y así tener más clientes para poder pagarles la educación a sus hijos en especial del hijo mayor.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en: Vasif R. has a business reselling cars. He buys used cars from Germany, brings them to Baku, rebuilds, and sells them. Most of the cars need some repair. He would like a loan of $1000 to purchase new and used spare parts to rebuild two of his cars. Most of his cars are sold on a web page in Azerbaijan (www.garaj.az) that his friend created. They started out printing photos with descriptions of cars and posting them on walls on the street. Now they've upgraded their business to a modern website that saves more money and is more professional. Vusal got married 1 year ago and has a 1-month-old child. He loves his family and has always loved fixing cars. Vasif is happy to earn a living doing something he really enjoys.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his garage business

loans.name: Francisca's Group

texts.en:
Carmen, Lidia, and Francisca have been part of the Sun Communal Bank for 3, 4, and 3 years

Carmen is 24 years old and with her brother has a photocopy shop at a school. She also helps her father in his café that is located at the same school. With the loan that she will receive, she will open a book store.

Lidia is 58 years old and separated with 9 children, 3 of which live with her. She travels to the fairs 2 times a week where she sells fruit. Also at the fairs she buys cheeses, and grains that she sells in the market the 12 of April.

Francisca is 48 years old and a single mother of 3. She is a baker and makes traditional breads from her area and sells them on foot in the Santa Clara market.

These three women need loans of 600 soles, 1000 soles, and 1500 soles. This money will be invested in the purchase of book store supplies like note books and binding machines, grains, and corn.

They hope to get more photo copiers, finish their studies, open a bakery with all the necessary equiptment, and help their children achieve in life

Translated by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Carmen, Lidia y Francisca pertenecen al Banco Comunal El sol hace 3, 4, 3 años respectivamente.

Carmen es soltera y tiene 24 años, Carmen junto a su hermano tienen una fotocopiadora en un colegio. Además Carmen ayuda a su papa en su cafetín que esta ubicado en el mismo colegio, Carmen con el préstamo que obtendrá implementará una pequeña librería.

Por otro lado Lidia es separada, tiene 58 años y 9 hijos D. los cuales 3 viven con ella, Lidia viaja a las ferias 2 veces por semana donD. venD. frutas y D. las ferias compra quesos, cereales, que venD. en el mercado 12 D. abril.

Mientras que Francisca es madre soltera, tiene 48 años y 3 hijos, Francisca es panificadora, elabora panes típicos D. la zona y lo venD. ambulatoriamente en el mercado Santa Clara.

Carmen, Lidia y Francisca necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 1000 soles, 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. lapiceros, cuadernos, máquina para anillados, cebada, trigo, maíz y para la inicial D. una mezcladora D. masa.

Los sueños D. Carmen, Lidia y Francisca son tener más fotocopiadoras, concluir sus estudios, implementar su panadería con toda las máquinas necesarias y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: These three women need loans of 600 soles, 1000 soles, and 1500 soles.  This money will be invested in the purchase of book store supplies like note books and binding machines, grains, and corn.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Uyên is 35 years old. She is in her 6th year with TYM fund. She is married and has 2 children who attend school. She owns a small shop selling sunglasses and locks. She has been in this business for 5 years. Her shop attracts a lot of customers because the prices are low and she is a good saleswoman. Her family income is 200 USD a month. Her husband also works with her, tending the shop and supportive of her. The business is stable and sales are good. This time she is seeking a loan of 950 USD to stock up her inventory.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Uyên, 35 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 6 của Quỹ Tình thương. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 người con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Nghề nghiệp chính của chị hiện nay là bán kính mắt và ổ khóa. Chị làm công việc này được gần 5 năm. Nhờ có duyên bán hàng và hàng bán giá cả phải chăng nên luôn có đông khách đến mua. Thu nhập bình quân 1 tháng của gia đình là 200USD. Chồng chị cũng tham gia kinh doanh và luôn hỗ trợ mỗi khi chị tham gia sinh hoạt cụm. Công việc kinh doanh thuận lợi, vòng vốn này chị Uyên làm đơn xin vay 950USD để mua thêm hàng.

loans.use: Buy glasses, locks

loans.name: Brisas Cienaga Grande Group

texts.es:
The women of this communal bank come from the community of Cienega Grande. This community is located in a rural area within the Department of Sololá. The most common crops grown in the community are corn and potatoes. The residents are indigenous and the vast majority of them wear traditional clothing. The women can be seen walking around the town wearing short or long skirts and huipiles—traditional blouses made of handmade fabric—or embroidered blouses. Many of the men wear Western clothing, though some of them still wear traditional clothing.

Most of the members of the bank sell traditional clothing for a living. Selling traditional clothing in the rural areas is a lucrative business because there is much demand for it, especially among women.

Some of the women in the group are going to invest their loans in other types of businesses, including a shoe store, a furniture store, a tortilla shop, and a shop that sells poultry. The Brisas de Cienega Grande group includes a variety of non-traditional businesses. This can be a factor that helps the women’s business development in the communal bank, since all of them share their experiences with their various businesses.

Most of the women said that things were going well with their respective businesses. When asked about competition, they said that it was present, but that it did not prevent their businesses from being successful. The women who sell traditional clothing mentioned that all of their products are sold within the community.

The members of the Brisas Cienega Grande group say that they enjoy working in a communal bank, mainly because they would not have been able to obtain a loan otherwise. They also enjoy working together because they know each other well and know that they all have excellent credit records.

Another factor that makes this group unique is that all of the women are able to support their children’s education, and all of them send their children to school. While it might seem like this should be the rule, this is unfortunately not the case in Guatemala, where the illiteracy rate is very high. These women are thus helping their country to develop not just economically, but also socially.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Las mujeres de este banco comunal provienen de la comunidad Cienega Grande. Esta comunidad está ubicada en un área rural dentro del departamento de Sololá. En esta comunidad la siembra de maíz y papa es lo más común . Los habitantes de esta comunidad son indígenas y la gran mayoría utilizan trajes tradicionales. Las mujeres caminan con cortes, faldas largas, y huipiles, blusas tejidas a mano, o blusas bordadas alrededor del pueblo. Muchos hombres utilizan ropa occidental, sin embargo se encuentran un grupo que todavía preservan su vestimenta tradicional.

La mayoría de clientas trabajan con ropa típica. La venta de ropa típica en las áreas rurales es un buen negocio porque hay mucha demanda por ella, especialmente el sector femenino de la población.

En el grupo también se puede encontrar mujeres que van a invertir su crédito en una zapatería, mueblería, tortillería y venta de pollos. En Brisas de Cienaga Grande se puede encontrar una variedad de negocios atípica. Esto puede ser un factor que ayude al desarrollo de las empresarias dentro del banco comunal porque todas intercambian experiencias de sus distintos negocios.

La mayoría de señoras comentaban que les iba bien con sus respectivos negocios. Cuando se les preguntó sobre la competencia, ellas dijeron que si estaba presente pero no era un gran inconveniente para el éxito de sus negocios. Las señoras que venden ropa típica comentaron que todos sus productos se venden dentro de su comunidad.

Las Brisas Cienega Grande dicen que les gusta trabajar en un banco comunal, principalmente porque de otra manera ellas no hubieran podido sacar un préstamo. También les gusta trabajar en conjunto porque todas se conocen bien y saben que todas tienen un record crediticio excelente.

Otro factor que hace a este grupo único es que todas las señoras realmente apoyan a la educación de sus hijos. Todas mandan a sus hijos al colegio. Aunque al parecer esta debería de ser la regla, no es la realidad de Guatemala. Los índices de analfabetismo son altísimos. Es por eso que estas mujeres no solo ayudan al desarrollo económico del país, sino al social también.

loans.use: Purchasing traditional clothing to sell; purchasing supplies for a tortilla shop, a furniture store, a shoe store, and a shop that sells poultry

loans.name: Dildar

texts.en:
Dildar A. is a 48-year-old woman who sells milk and yogurt in the small village of Saatli. She has had this business since 1987. Dildar is married and has three children.

She and her husband are unemployed and selling milk and yogurt is the only source of income for their family. She is applying for a loan to purchase one dairy cow for $600 and purchase fodder with the balance of the loan amount.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and fodder

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
The Las Mercedes committee was formed more than two years ago and is in it's 7th cycle. The group operates in the Paraguayan town of San Lorenzo. The women who run general stores have their businesses in their houses; the others sell clothing, medicines and food, some working from home and others going door to door.

Because Las Mercedes is a committee, they have a history of repaying their loans on time to both the Fundacion Paraguay and within the group. They now have savings of GS.1,500,000 on deposit at a local Cooperative. Moreover, they sponsor activities such as raffles and food sales to support a Caja D. Auxilio (savings fund) account set asiD. to help members who are ill or to repay the Fundacion for loans to the group.

For this cycle, it's important to note the commitment of these women to improving their lives. The support of the group has been a fundamental reason for the growth of their businesses and, with it, their self-esteem which has developed as they've taken control of their lives. The strengthening of Paraguayan families is an important consequence.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El comité LAS mercedes se formó hace ya más D. dos año, son un grupo que esta en 7mo Ciclo. Pertenecen a la zona D. Laurelty San LORENZO. Las señoras se dedican las que tienen su negocio en su casa a la Despensa, las demás hacen venta D. ropas, remedios y comidas, algunas en su casa y otras recorren D. puerta en puerta.

Como grupo es un comité que estable pagar con puntualidad sus cuotas en la Fundación y dentro del grupo también, poseen un Ahorro D. GS.1.500.000, que lo depositan en una Cooperativa D. la zona. Ademas realizan actividades en conjunto como rifas y venta D. comidas tipicas para lograr un fondo D. Caja D. Auxilio para los casos que alguien se enferme , o poder adelantar sus pagos como grupo en la Fundación.

En este ciclo se nota la dedicaciòn D. las señoras por salir adelante y el apoyo D. su grupo ha sido fundamental para hacerlas crecer en su actividades económicas y también en su autoestima que se ha desarrollado por la forma en que ellas son protagonistas e importantes con su trabajo en el grupo.Y un punto muy importante el fortalecimiento D. los hogares paraguayos.

loans.use:
For those operating general stores, the purchase of meat, cheese, vegetables and cleaning products.  For those selling clothing, the purchase of clothing for adults and children.  For those women selling food, investments in other businesses such as cosmetics.  Some of those selling beverages would also like to sell ice cream and cold drinks.  The women who 
work as seamstresses will buy material and the other supplies they need to provide their services.

loans.name: Haem

texts.en:
This is the second time Mrs. Haem H. is asking for a loan to improve her living conditions. She is a farmer in Taing Klai Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. On her plantation, she usually gets only a meager revenue because she owns a small piece of land. Thus, Mrs. Haem H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy another piece of land in order to expand her rice revenue. 

Mrs. Haem H. hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Heng Nak, owns a small kiln where he can make charcoal to sell in order to support their family. Mrs. Haem H. is 22 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Haem H. obtained a loan to buy household equipment (plates, spoons, baskets, etc.) She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: to buy another piece of land to farm

loans.name: Mwanaisha's Jitahidi Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is 30 years old. She is married with 3 children, ages 10, 8, and 1. She has been a clothing and home utensil seller since March 2008. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

In the past, Mwanaisha has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Mwanaisha is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes and home utensil products for the expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Amina, who has a business selling clothes and juice.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and home utensil products for re-sale in order to exapand her business

loans.name: Ismah

texts.en:
Ismah O., 45, is a member of the Bugolo group with a business of buying ‘mukene,’ small silvery fish, from the fishermen in Kikondo and Busaana, using his bicycle as transport, for 10 years. He is married with 7 children of whom some are older and the others are still in school; also he takes care of 1 orphan.

Ismah O. is very proud of the trend that his business is taking after he joined his lending group whereby he now buys about 50 to 100 basins of fish, each at 7000 shillings; he sells them at Mbale district market once a week.

He is seeking a loan to be able to buy more basins of fish so that he can include Tororo district on his list of markets, hence selling to Mbale on Monday and Tororo on Friday. He is a businessman who has grown over the three years since he joined his lending group, taking loans from US$ 185, $610, $925, and he now needs a loan of US$ 1200 for his business expansion.

loans.use: for buying more basins of fish for business expansion

loans.name: Damaris Margarita

texts.es: Doña Damaris tiene 40 años de edad, casada y con un hijo de 15 años de edad,  su esposo labora como ejecutivo de ventas, habita en un barrio que se llama Enrique Bermúdez en la capital de Managua. La Sra. Damaris tiene una pulpería desde hace un año lo cual comenzó con ahorro que su esposo le dio, por las noche hace venta de fritanga, refrescos  para tener mas ingresos, con este préstamo que esta haciendo en Afodenic espera obtener mejores beneficios por que desea comprar mercadería varias  como ropa, cosméticos para aprovechar la temporada de diciembre, poder sastifacer a su clientela. Y darle a su hijo los estudios.
texts.en:
Ms. Damaris Bermúdez is 40 years old, married, and has a 15-year-old son. Her husband works as a sales executive. She lives in a neighborhood called Enrique Bermúdez, in the capital city of Managua. Ms. Bermúdez has had her own general store, which she started with money that her husband gave her, for a year. In the evening, she sells fried snacks and soft drinks in order to earn extra income. With this loan that Afodenic is giving her, she hopes to have more benefits because she wishes to purchase assorted merchandise, such as clothing and cosmetics, in order to take advantage of the holiday season, satisfy her customers, and provide her son with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Candelaria Group

texts.es: El grupo "Candelaria" esta representado por el señor Reynaldo, en general los socios (as) se dedican al comercio de productos como ropa deportiva, abarrotes, juguetes, pollo, pan, comida, dulces y al transporte público. la competencia en le mercado es fuerte pero ellas saben como salir adelante por la experiencia y la calidad humana que cada uno de los socios (as) tiene. El destino del crédito financiado por la fundación Agrocapital es para la compra de insumos y productos para estocar sus puestos de venta para la época navideña que es cuando mayor venta de productos hay, alguno de los socios destinara sus fondos a la reparación y mejora de sus puestos de trabajo. Es la primera vez que trabajan con la fundación agrocapital pero ya tienen experiencia con grupos solidarios por lo que saben administrar bien los fondos que se les otorga para el beneficio de sus familias.
texts.en:
The group, Candelaria **, is represented by Mr. Reynaldo. In general the group members sell products such as athletic clothing, groceries, toys, chicken, bread, food, and sweets, as well as provide public transport. The competition in the market is strong, but the group members know how to rise above it because of their experience and personal qualities. This loan, financed through Kiva partner Fundacion Agrocapital, will be used for the purchase of items and products to stake out the members' places of business for the Christmas season, which is when the most sales take place. Some of the group members will use their funds to repair and improve their workplaces. This is the first time that the group has worked with Kiva partner Fundacion Agrocapital, but the members already have experience working in these types of groups, so they know how to use their funds well to benefit their families. ** Translator's note: "Candelaria" is the name of a religious festival held on February 2 in honor of the Virgen Mary. It is celebrated with candle processions in the churches.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating expenses

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena A. is 52 years old. She is married and the mother of four kids. Currently, the kids are all in school. She has been sewing for thirty years now. In addition to that she also bakes pastries.

Helena is a specialist in female wears. Her skills and designs have class. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look. She sews children's school uniform, church attire, kaba and slit, wedding dress, funeral clothes, and more.

She wants to use this loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials, like linen, threads, and thimbles, to increase her output and efficiency. Through her dedication and hard work Helena has two apprentices whom she is training in sewing as their future sources of livelihood. Helena believes in education and she hopes that the loan would improve her business enough to increase her savings and provide her children with quality education. She would be grateful for your contribution to making her dreams come through.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing material, like linen, threads, and thimbles.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es:
María de la Concepción P. Díaz tiene la edad de 59 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña María tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 15 años cursa el 3 año de secundaria y su hijo menor de 7 años cursa el 3 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora por cuenta propia, sus propósitos son de mantener a su clientela ya que ellos representan su principal fuente de ingresos ya que sin ellos su establecimiento no podría funcionar, sus sueños son de que su negocio siempre se encuentre activo por lo que se le presento una enfermedad y esto conllevo a que su negocio decayera por lo que ahora esta luchando por recuperarlo ya que su interés es de trabajar humildemente, sus deseos son de darle mejoras a su vivienda ya que a sus edad es muy difícil volver a trabajar por lo cual  tiene que ahorrar lo suficiente para su vejes ya que tiene que pensar en su fututo.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa usada y cosméticos, la ubicación de su negocio en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante ya que tiene que visitar a sus clientes, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 8 años, Doña María da inicio a su negocio con el objetivo de ayudar a la familia a generar mas ingresos y por cuenta propia decide empezar a vender este tipo de ropa ya que al comienzo no sabia en que podía trabajar ya que anteriormente se dedicaba al destace de cerdo y además poseía una pequeña pulpería pero debido a que no podía mantener ambos negocio ya que se enfermo y no pudo seguir manteniendo ambos negocio por lo que su enfermedad la mantenía en cama pero sabia que tenia que proporcionarle a sus hijos lo necesario por lo que hizo el sacrificio de buscar otro negocio y fue con la venta de ropa usada como: camisas y pantalones ella ofrecía sus productos a los caballeros ya que llegaban en busca de pantalones  por lo que además de ofrecerlos en su casa de habitación decide recorrer ciertas calles de forma ambulante para lograr mas ganancias ya que tenia que buscar la manera de realizar sacrificios, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita invertir en mas mercadería para su negocio para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria de la Concepcion P. D. is 59 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her eldest son is 15 years old and is in his third year of high school. Her youngest son is 7 years old and is in the third grade of elementary school. Her husband works for himself now because he has come down with an illness but they still need to retain the customers that provide the family with their main source of income. Now, he is fighting to recover and it is difficult to return to work. Still, he is thinking about the future and hopes to save enough money for retirement and to better provide for his household. Dona Maria has been running a business selling second-hand clothing and cosmetics out of their home for 8 years, and also traveling to visit customers. She first started the business to help generate more income for the family. She specifically decided to sell second-hand clothing since she did not know what type of work she could do after she was previously a pork butcher. They previously owned a small store, but they could not continue running the store while his illness required him to stay in bed. Since she knew they still had to provide for the children, she began searching for other work. She decided to sell second-hand clothing such as shirts and pants. Since men started coming to the house to purchase pants, she decided to expand the business by traveling and selling on certain streets to earn more money. The money she is requesting in the loan will be used to make necessary investments to buy additional merchandise for her business to meet the demand of the customers.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Fatou Bintou

texts.fr: Fatou Bintou S., 34 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Goudomp depuis 4 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter  et revendre des bananes. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie et la prise en charge de la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatou Bintou S., age 34, is married and has three children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Goudomp for four years. She wants to bolster her commerce to satisfy her customers. This income enables her to improve living conditions and to cover the children’s schooling costs. She’s requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell bananas

loans.name: Tikarisun De Ccachin Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco “TIKARISUN DE CCACHIN”;  son un grupo conformado por 12 miembros, este nombre significa “FLORECEREMOS”, Está comunidad campesina se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Lares de la provincia de calca del departamento del Cusco a 3 700 m.s.n.m. Los campesinos caminan diariamente 4 horas para llegar al distrito de Lares, dónde realizan sus compras en los mercados y dónde ellos también llevan sus productos para vender.

Esta comunidad es muy linda y muy típica, es una de las comunidades que aún mantienen su herencia Inca. y mantienen sus trajes típicos y sus costumbres ancestrales, su estilo de vida y sus danzas folklóricas vivas, nuestros nuevos socios, son gente muy humilde, pero llena de mucho coraje y muy cariñosa, ellos trabajan la tierra, producen diferentes variedades de papas, y variedades de maíz, (blanco, amarillo, y el maíz de muchos colores); pero sobre todo ellos son los mejores tejedores de la zona del valle de Cusco, tiene una técnica muy peculiar y elaboran chalinas, mantas, mantillas, pasillos, ponchos, gorros, y trabajos muy bellos con diseños de la naturaleza, todo eso realizados a mano y con teñidos naturales; todo lo que ellos saben lo aprendieron de sus antepasados y esto fue viajando de generación en generación; aquí podría fácilmente realizarse el turismo vivencia participativo, por que ellos son gente muy amable y desean seguir cultivando su pasado vivo.

Estos socios invertirán su préstamo en comprar semillas,  para sus nuevos cultivos, comprarán algunos ganados vacunos y lanas de alpacas y ovejas para que sus esposas sigan realizando sus tejidos; ellos también desean construir algunos cuartos para poder recibir a sus visitantes y darles hospedaje en sus casas.

Los socios están muy agradecidos con el préstamo otorgado, para estos socios esta experiencia es nueva, ya que nunca antes tuvieron la oportunidad de trabajar con créditos, ellos están ansiosos por invertir sus dineros y ver sus resultados, así mismo ellos los invitan a todos ustedes a la comunidad campesina de Ccachin en Cusco. Valorando el préstamo se comprometen a cumplir con las fechas de pagos programados.
texts.en:
There are 12 members of the "Tikarisun De Ccachin" community bank, which means "We will flourish." This country community is located in the district of Lares, in the department of Cusco, Peru. The peasants walk four hours daily to arrive in Lares, where they make their purchases at the markets and also take their products to sell.

This group is very pretty and typical of the region, and they still maintain their Incan ancestry in their traditional dresses and customs, their lifestyles and folkloric live dances. The members are very humble, but they are filled with courage and tenderness. They work on the land, producing different varieties of potatoes and maize (white, yellow, multicolored). But most of all they are the best weavers in the Cusco valley. They have a very distinct technique and make scarfs, blankets, lace, ponchos, caps and beautiful works depicting nature. All of this is done by hand and with natural dyes. All of what they know they learned from their ancestors, and this knowledge is passed on from generation to generation. It also allows them to participate in the tourism industry, and they are very friendly people who want to share and keep their traditions alive.

With the loan, the members will purchase seeds for their new crops, some heads of cattle for livestock, and alpaca and sheep fleece so their wives can continue weaving. They also want to build some rooms so they will be able to receive visitors and provide accommodations.

The members are very grateful for the granted loan. For them this is a new experience, since previously none of them have had to the opportunity to work with credit. They are anxious to invest the money and see the results. They themselves invite all of you to the country community of Ccachin. They value the loan and promise to fulfill the payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: urchase seeds for their new crops, some heads of cattle for livestock, and alpaca and sheep fleece; and build accomodations

loans.name: Saili

texts.en: Saili T. is 52 years old and married with 5 children.  She has 3 years experience in the Pancake business. She sells to the village people and general public 5 days per week. She had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Saili’s only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.The loan will be used for the business and to pay for children's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase sack of flour, sugar, cooking oil, chinese frying pan, gas oven, plastic papers for storage. Some will be used for children school fees.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a resident of San Vicente, Quirino, Isabela. She is already 55 years old and married to Nelson, a farmer. They are blessed with three children: Janet, a 30-year-old computer-science graduate who is now working as a domestic helper abroad; Jonel, a 27-year-old driver/mechanic graduate; and Joenard, a 23-year-old security guard. Lilia was glad and proud of her children because they learned to combat poverty by looking for a job. She just hopes that they will someday become successful with their chosen careers.

Lilia used to manage a sari-sari store (community-based store) in their village. But for some reason it went bankrupt and closed for a time. She is now asking for financial assistance from the lenders so she can be able to reopen her store. Her request of PHP 10,000.00 will be used to buy different groceries that she can display and offer to her customers. She is working hard to uplift their living conditions. According to her, she must be very patient in order to achieve her goals in life.

She is thankful that her children also help them with their needs. Despite this, she still wants to have her own business and not depend too much on her children since they also have their own families. She was very excited to have her store back that used to be her partner in sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy different groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell food items

loans.name: Emigdio

texts.en:
Mr. Emigdio P. is 59 years old and has been married to his wife Eusebia for more than 20 years. Together they have six children, all of older ages.

Mr. P. worked for 10 years as an assistant bricklayer, where he learned the profession. Now he is an official building worker. About five years ago he also began selling bedspreads on the street. His clients order the products and then Mr. P. brings the handicrafts to the San Lorenzo district to sell. His wife makes the bedspreads and is in charge of their distribution in order to make a living, and to be able to contribute to the family income. Thanks to her help and sacrifice, they have been able to gather enough resources to start building a modest home.

Mr. P. applies for the loan to buy things to sell, such as hammocks, comforters and sheets.

loans.use: The purchase of goods to sell, such as hammocks, sheets, and blankets.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary E. sells local herbal medicines in Sekondi. Mary did not receive any form of formal education. She is married and has four dependants. Her husband is a fisherman who earns a little for a living. Mary has been selling herbal medicines since 2007. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying housekeeping and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more medicines to sell. She hopes to reinvest her profits into the business.

loans.use: To buy herbal medicines

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
V. Nguyễn Thị (1047061261) is a 30 year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, V. owns & operates a business raising ducks for sale. V. has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, V. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. V. is requesting a new loan of 13,000,000 VND to be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 6th loan taken out by V. from TYM Fund.  V. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: Carlos José M. Juárez tiene 49 años. Vive con su pareja y madre de sus 4 hijos. Desde muy Joven Carlos tuvo que trabajar para sacar a su familia adelante. Por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de materiales de ferretería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que inicio con fondos propios para salir adelante con este humilde negocio. Es destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de lámparas, cerraduras, sierras y otros productos.
texts.en:
Carlos José M. Juárez is 49 years old. He lives with his partner, who is the mother of his 4 children. Since he was very young, Carlos had to work to help his family. He sells hardware supplies. He has been doing this for 7 years, and he started the business with his own funds so that he could overcome his problems with this humble business. The loan will be used as capital to buy lamps, locks, saws and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for his business

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesus trabaja como mecánico automotriz, tiene un taller ubicado en su Domicio es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo cubre la  manutención de sus tres hermano menores que depende de él, Vive en alquiler ubicado en la Villa Adela de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la comprar una maquina scanner de movilidad para poder facilitar su trabajo y poder prestar mejor servicios a sus clientes.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarlo otro préstamo solicitado por Jesus.
texts.en:
Jesus is an auto mechanic and runs a repair shop from his home. This is his main source of income with which he supports his three younger brothers who are dependent on him. He rents his home on Villa Adela in the city of El Alto. He intends to use this loan to buy an auto engine scanner which will allow him both more ease in his tasks and to provide a better service to his clients. This is his second loan with Impro and his good repayment history qualifies him for this loan approval.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an auto engine scanner for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.en:
Arminda P., 55, has been a widow for years but lives her life to the fullest. She lives in Parola, Tondo, Manila with her 2 adult children who are already both working.

Arminda owns and manages a restaurant near the dockyards of Manila International Containers Terminal (MICT). She likes working at the restaurant hands-on because she gets to meet a lot of people. She earns a net income of P 60,000 a month. What really makes her proud about being in business is her ability to employ other people. Her restaurant has three assistants.

Since joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007, Arminda has learned the value of saving for the future. Just recently, Arminda ventured into shipping bananas from Davao which she delivers to fruit vendors in the nearby market. She has found this business to be very rewarding, considering her restaurant’s location near the seaport.

Arminda needs a loan of P 50,000 as additional capital for her new venture, shipment of bananas. She also wishes to open another restaurant in another area.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: additional capital for banana shipping (new business venture)

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es una persona dinámica y colaboradora, tiene 40 años de edad, es casada,  tiene un hijo mayor de edad; ella es profesora de nivel primario y también se dedica a confeccionar hamacas. Su local de ventas esta ubicado en el lado exterior del mercado número 1, ubicado en la ciudad de Pucallpa, donde trabaja  junto a su esposo. Ella  forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Heroínas” desde hace cinco años; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300 soles y lo invirtió en la apertura de su negocio actual. 
COn este préstamo de S/. 1,000 soles, invertirá en la compra de telas, para confeccionar hamacas y algunos otros  productos relacionados a su negocio. La meta de Carmen es tener otro local  en esta ciudad para poder ofrecer estos mismos productos  y así tener mas clientes.

loans.use: Invertirá en la compra de telas, para confeccionar hamacas y algunos otros  productos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chicken feeds and treatment

loans.name: Silva

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Durantes casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas; ahora, con su esposo, siembra granos como el maíz, trigo, cebada, quinua entre otros. Desde hace 10 años vende sus cosechas llevándolas en su propia movilidad a la ciudad más cercana a su comunidad, es así que genera los ingresos para su familia, pues todo lo que almacena de su cosecha lo va llevando cada semana a vender y con sus ganancias pudieron adquirir más extensiones de terreno. El deseo de Silvia es continuar con sus actividades e incrementar su producción agrícola. 

Esta es la primera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, siendo una persona muy optimista para realizar los trabajo en equipo de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más abono para su época de siembra.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina es soltera, vive en la zona # 7 de Nueva Guinea junto a sus padres, esta solicitando su 2do crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para comprar zinc y cambiar el que tiene en mal estado y asi mejorar las condiciones del hogar, pues a pesar que no tiene hijos pero se encarga del cuido de sus ancianitos padres,   esta joven se ha caracterizado por ser una docente  muy responsable, honesto a demostrado  buena conducta y moral crediticia,   tiene una familia muy humilde que ha luchado para seguir  adelante, actualmente  esta en el ultimo año de magisterio,   Cristina  aspira tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, tener estabilidad laboral, seguir estudiando y que sus padres cuenten siempre con buena salud.
texts.en:
Cristina is single. She lives with her parents in Zone #7 in New Guinea. She is asking for her second loan from the Afodenic institution to buy zinc and change the roof, which is in very bad shape. That way she will improve the home’s condition. She does not have children, but she is in charge of the care of her elderly parents. This young woman has been characterized as being a teacher who is very responsible and honest. She has demonstrated good and honest behavior with her loan. She has a very humble family that has fought to get ahead. She is currently in her the last year of teacher training. Cristina’s wishes are to have a home that is in better condition, to have work stability, to keep studying, and that her parents are always in good health.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: Mario José es casado, tiene 3 niños menores de edad, 2 estudian la primaria, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 3er credito a la institución de AFODENIC, para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construir una habitacion), labora en construcción de vivienda y también realiza actividades al agrícola en la colonia La Fonseca; Mario José es un hombre humilde, trabajador, responsable, con muchos deseos de seguir adelante, este cliente con los créditos que le ha brindado AFODENIC ha realizado siempre mejora en vivienda  y en esta ocasion espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA, esta agradecido con la institución por el servicio recibido, su sueño es tener una vivienda bonita y salir adelante con su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Mario José is married and the father of three minor children; two are elementary school students. He is requesting refinancing of his third AFODENIC loan to invest in his home (build a room). He works in housing construction and also does some farming activities in the La Fonseca neighborhood. Mario José is a humble, hard-working, responsible man who very much wishes to get ahead in life. With his prior financing from AFODENIC he has always improved his home and he hopes on this occasion to be a beneficiary of KIVA fund. He is grateful to the institution for the services received. His dream is to have a pretty home and to get ahead in life with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.pt:
Olímpia J. nasceu na Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da suazilândia tem 35 anos de idade, é viúva mãe de uma rapariga de 23 anos de idade já casada. Para alêm da sua filha responsabiliza se pela sua neta e pelas suas 2 sobrinhas que vivem com ela em sua casa. Consegue por mês poupar 1.000.00MT.

Olímpia J. quando perde o pai teve que emigrar para a África do Sul devido à guerra, inicia com os estudos e faz a 5ª classe. Anos depois teve que regressar a sua terra natal e recomeça de novo com os estudos e quando frequentava a 7ª classe esta fica grávida e consequentemente seu marido perde a vida e isso causa um conflito familiar devido à herança ela decide voltar para casa dos pais.  Começa a praticar pequenos negócios com o fundo da indminizaçao do seu falecido esposo vendendo tomate na esquina perto da sua casa no período da manhã e no período da tarde ia a Escola. 
Através do pequeno negócio consegue reabilitar a casa da sua mãe e constrói a sua própria casa e pequeno estabelecimento comercial no mesmo quintal onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade tais como (arroz, cebola, batata, amendoim, sapatos e chinelos) adquiridos na suazilândia gastando uma média de 5.000.00MT em cada viagem e tendo de lucro no valor de 8.000.00MT.


Este é o quarto empréstimo de Olímpia na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva. O primeiro de 5.000.00MT foi usado para concluir mínimas partes da barraca, o segundo de 10.000.00MT para manter o volume dos seus produtos, o terceiro de 15.000.00MT para aumentar o stock dos produtos e este quarto de 20.000.00MT serão usados para o mesmo fim. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para construir uma boutique para venda de sapatos e chinelos separando com os produtos comestíveis.
texts.en:
Olimpia J. was born in the village of Namaacha in the frontier with Suazailandia, she is 35 years old and is a widow, she has a daughter who is already 23 years old and is married. Besides her family, she supports her granddaughter and two nieces who live with her at home. She gets an income of 1.000MT Whem Olimpia J. lost her father she had to move to South Africa due to war, she studied until the 5th grade. Years later she had to go back to her hometown and started studying again and when she was on the 7th grade she got pregnant, soon after her husband lost his life which created a family conflict due to the inheritance, so she decided to return to her parents house. She started a small business with the indemnity money of her late husband, selling tomatoes in the corner of her house in the morning and at he school in the afternoon. Because of her small business she was able to re-built her mother's house and to build her own and a small commercial store where she sells other products of first necessity like (rice, onion, potatoes, peanuts, shoes and sandals) that she buys in Suazilandia, she spends an average of 5.000MT on each trip and is able to get an income of 8.000MT. This is her 4th loan with Hluvuku and second with Kiva. The first was for 5,000MT and it was used to finish few places in her house, the second for 10.000MT was used to keep the volume of her products, the third of 15.000MT was to increase her stock of merchandise and the 4th of 20.000MT will be use for the same. She is confident she will be able to pay before the due date and will be able to request another loan to build a boutique to sell shoes and sandals separate from the grocery products.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell sandals, rice, flour, peanuts and other grocery products

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura S. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 52 years old. Laura is married and has 11 adult-aged children. To make a living, Laura owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling vegaetables in the local community. Laura has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Laura joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laura has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Laura is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Laura from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chamila

texts.ru: Куганова Чамила проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 45 лет. Вдова, имеет 2 детей. Чамила имеет среднее образование. Она более 10 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. В ее ассортимент входит одежда. Кредит просит для закупа нового ассортимента и увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Chamila K. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 45 years old, a widow and has 2 children. Chamila has a secondary education. She has been involved in retail sales at a market for over 10 years. Her merchandise assortment includes clothing. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase new variety of merchandise and increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Ider

texts.en: Ider lives with his wife, two daughters and son in a house that he describes as "not being able to hold heat well". He decided to replace his stove with an energy-efficient one in hopes of keeping his family warmer. Additionally he hoped that the new stove would not produce as much smoke inside the house as the old did. So far, he has noticed that the stove has kept his family much warmer and he also believes that the stove, through being more efficient, will help with the city’s pollution. He has since recommended the product to his neighbors. Ider used to live in Khovd province but moved to Ulaanbaatar seven years ago to find more work as an electrician and to allow his kids to grow up and be educated in the city. About XacBank Eco Products Program Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 degrees Celsius. Sixty percent of the city's population live in tents called gers with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the ger districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. During the heating season, 60% of the pollution in the city is attributed to coal burned in the ger districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels. XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy-efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To fund an energy-efficient heating stove

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es: Maria Virginia tiene 52 años, su actividad económica es panadería ella tiene 5 hijos pero ninguno está a su cargo pues todos trabajan de manera independiente. Por lo que ha sido de mucha pues esto fue lo que hizo necesario para proporcionarle los estudios necesarios. Ella es muy reconocida en su vecindario por la calidad de sus productos y además la atención que a diario ofrece donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como harina, mantequilla, aceite, queso bolsas entre otros productos. Su deseo es que su negocio siga creciendo lo suficiente para mejorar sus condiciones la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Virginia is 52 years old, has five children, and operates a bakery. Her children work independently in order to provide for their own education. Maria is well recognized in her neighborhood for the quality of her products as well as the service that she offers on a daily basis. Her shop carries everything that a housewife needs and she attends to each customer with her charming personality.

The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase materials such as flour, butter, oil, cheese, bags, and other products. Her wish is to sufficiently keep her business growing so that she can improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies

loans.name: Evangeline Magsayo's Group

texts.en: Evangeline M. is from the village of San Roque. She is 29 years old. Evangeline is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Evangeline is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a "sari-sari” (variety) store business and sells a variety of different products in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2006, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Evangeline from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Condrado

texts.en:
Condrado N. is from the village of Kinangay Norte. He is 53 years old. Condrado is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Condrado owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Condrado has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Condrado joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Condrado has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. Condrado is requesting a new loan of 5,900 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Condrado from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Philip Kangogo

texts.en:
Philip Kangogo K. is a forty-six-year-old man who is married with five children who are all in school. He lives in Sergoit location in Eldoret. He has been in his maize farming business for eighteen years and, besides farming, he also sells milk, mostly to his neighbors. 

Philip was introduced to KADET by his friends; this will be his second loan from KADET. He plans to use all the loan proceeds on his farm to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer.

 In future, Philip would like to buy land in Eldoret Town and build rental houses so that he can increase his family income.

loans.use: To buy maize seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena B. is a 37 year-old a married woman who supports her family by engaging in a fish vending business. She lives in Canlinday Barangay, Culipapa Hinobaan, Negros Occidental, and has 3 school-aged children between 16 and 20 years old. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 16,000.

Ma. Elena is now borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she can access additional capital for her fish vending business. This will be her 7th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Elena aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital in business.

loans.name: Los Galanes Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Galanes está conformado por Ena del Carmen R. L., Raquel Nohemi Torres Gaitán  y Luis Beltrán R. Méndez  tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que se dedican al comercio de frutas y verduras.

Este grupo ha sido participe tanto de los beneficios financieros como del proceso de capacitación y formación sobre genero y desarrollo empresarial que le ha ayudado a ayudado a administrar sus negocios eficazmente. Un claro ejemplo de ello es la señora Ena del Carmen R. L., coordinadora del grupo, quien en el 2003 inicio a vender perecederos en el mercado especialmente mangos, tamarindo y  mamón.

 Ella en un comienzo comercializaba pocos productos ya que no contaba con dinero suficiente para invertir más. Actualmente R. compra mayor cantidad y variedad de cosechas con lo que su negocio ha progresado satisfactoriamente y sueña en tener un futuro no muy lejano otro tramo en el cual comercializara ropa usada.
texts.en:
Ena del Carmen R. L., Raquel Nohemi Torres Gaitá and Luis Beltrán R. Méndez are the members of the Los Galanes group. They are three hard-working, enterprising people that are fruit and vegetable merchants. This group has participated in financial benefits, training sessions, gender and business development workshops that have helped them better manage their businesses. A clear example of this is Ena del Carmen R. L., group coordinator, who started selling perishables like mangos, tamarind and mammon (a tropical Central American fruit) in 2003. At the beginning, she only sold a few products because she lacked sufficient funds to stock more. Currently, she buys a wider variety of crops in larger amounts so that her business has progressed satisfactorily and she dreams of having a space to sell second-hand clothes in the not too distant future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit crops and seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man with six children. He has been doing carpentry for 20 years, manufacturing and selling beds, dining sets, coffee tables, etc. He joined Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, with a group of entrepreneurs. With the group, he can easily access a loan from Faulu Kenya since the group members guarantee each other's loans.  

He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy timber, frames, paint, glue, nails, bolts and sand paper. He hopes to expand his business and employ more people.

loans.use: To buy timber, frames, paint, glue, nails, bolts and sand paper

loans.name: Felíz Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguarí, Bº San José, se reunieron unas mujeres con ganas de conformar un comité para acceder al préstamo, de ahí se coordinó la reunión para interiorizarse sobre el programa, quienes aceptaron pues era una oportunidad para aumentar su capital de trabajo y recibir capacitación para crecer como persona, ellas son muy trabajadoras, quienes nunca antes han recibido ningún tipo de apoyo crediticia.

Todas las integrantes son señoras muy activas, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Una de las señoras, es Doña Isabel quien actualmente es empleada doméstica, y quiere incursionar en un negocio con que puede obtener ingreso y quedarse en su casa, su idea es la de elaborar comestibles y vender a sus vecinos, preparar dulces, masas, empanadas y otros comestibles.

Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes como carne, verduras, dulce para rellenos, condimentos, y otros de manera a comenzar con su actividad.
texts.en:
Some women got together in the city of Paraguarí, Bº San José. They wanted to form a communal bank in order to access a loan. They coordinated the meeting to learn more about the program. They decided to become a communal bank because it was an opportunity to increase their working capital, receive training, and to grow as a person. They are very hard-workers who have never before had any type of help from a loan. All of the members are very active women. They invested their loans in their respective activities. Isabel is currently a domestic employee. She wants to get into a business with which she is able to get income and stay in her house. Her idea is to make food and sell it to her neighbors. She will make sweets, pastries, empanadas, and other food. She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, sweets for fillings, and condiments, to start her activity.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, vegetables, condiments, sugar, sweets for fillings, and other things

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio tiene 25 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Túcume, una zona bastante conocida por su atractivo turistico: cuenta con un complejo arqueológico conformado por 26 pirámides que datan de una civilización anterior a los Incas. Sus actividades principales son la agricultura y el comercio. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Julio se dedica a la decoración y ornamentación de locales para actividades sociales y celebraciones. El lleva trabajando dos años en esta actividad y se vale de ella para percibir ingresos, los cuales utiliza en el mantenimiento de su familia. Su trabajo consiste en realizar diversos arreglos utilizando telas en los ambientes donde se realizarán fiestas y reuniones. Esta actividad la realiza en el distrito de Túcume y también en el distrito de Illimo.

Gracias a la calidad con la que realiza su trabajo se ha vuelto conocido en la zona y siempre tiene clientes que solicitan sus servicios. El desea adquirir mas material para poder realizar su trabajo de una manera más cómoda, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de telas y sillas.	

Julio es una persona trabajadora y bastante creativa, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida esforzándose al máximo en su trabajo. En la zona donde vive el es una persona bastante conocida y respetada.
texts.en:
Julio is 25 years old, married and has one child. He lives with his family in the Túcume district, a region known as a tourist attraction. It has an archaeological site that has 26 pyramids that date back to a previous Inca civilization. His primary activities are agriculture and business. He belongs to the Lambayeque Province which is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. Julio works decorating venues used for social and celebratory activities. He has been doing this for 2 years and it has proved to be a valuable source of income, which he uses to support his family. In his work he uses different fabric arrangements in places where parties and meetings will be held. He works in the Túcume district and also in the Illimo district. Due to the quality of his work he has made a name for himself in the region and always has customers requesting his services. He wants to purchase more material for his job in the most convenient way possible and for this reason, he is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. He plans to buy fabric and chairs. Julio is quite a creative and hardworking person. His main desire is to give his family a better quality of life and for this reason, he is very driven in his work. In the region where he lives he is quite well know and respected.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Julio wants to purchase new fabrics and chairs for his decorating business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy meat and fish and stock up on beverages

loans.name: Nyaibanda Savings & Credit Group

texts.en:
Peter is a 44-year-old farmer who wants a loan to buy Irish potatoes seedlings to plant next season. He is the father of eight children and the family lives in a semi-permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda.

Peter is a farmer who has been in business for twenty years, but he faces the problem of unstable prices for agricultural products. He dreams of educating his children and building a better house for them.

Peter is a member of Nyaibanda Savings & Credit group; in his group each member guarantees the others since most of them do not have collateral security to pledge for individual loans. Each member guarantees the others based on their characters.

loans.use: To buy Irish potato seedlings to plant

loans.name: Franz

texts.es: El Sr. Franz, nacido en la provincia Cordillera en Santa Cruz 4 de octubre de 1984 casado con doña Leidy con 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, agricultor hace 10 años que compro una parcela de 19 hectareas en el Porvenir a 85 Km de la provincia cordillera municipio de Cabezas, en la cual vive y trabaja de la agricultura, Siembra Maiz, sorgo, Frijol tambien tiene su ganado vacuno, el trabaja o hace sembrar con tractor, el dinero del credito lo utilizara para el preparado de la tierra para la siembra comtratara mano de obra y alquilara el tractor, es joven y muy trbajador, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada enn la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Franz was born on October 4th, 1984, in the Cordillera province in Santa Cruz. He is married to Leidy, and they have three school age children. He has been a farmer for ten years. He bought a parcel of land that is 19 hectares. It is located in Porvenir, which is 85 kilometers from the Cordillera province in the Cabezas municipality. He lives and does his farming work there. He grows corn, sorghum, and beans. He also has cattle. He works or plants with a tractor. He will use the loan to prepare the land for planting. He will hire workers for the labor and rent the tractor. He is a very hard-working young man. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their trust by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor cost to prepare the land for planting and cost of renting a tractor

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Vilma viaja a la selva ayacuchana a donde lleva abarrotes en general, para lo cual tiene un carro que es conducido por su esposo, vende en diferentes pueblos y de la selva ayacuchana compra frutas que luego son vendidas en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble y solicita un crédito de 750 soles para la compra de galletas, golosinas.
Los sueños de Vilma son tener capital propio y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Vilma is married and has two children who are students. She travels to the Ayacucho backcountry to sell groceries. She has a car that her husband drives for this. She sells in various towns and brings back fruit from there to sell in the city’s wholesale foodstuffs market. Vilma is a member of the El Roble (The Oak) communal bank and is asking for a 750 sol loan to buy cookies and sweets. Vilma’s dream is to have her own capital and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cookies and sweets.

loans.name: Yamil Javier

texts.es:
El Señor Yamil D. tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero, es una persona que vive sola, es independiente.

Trabaja con su padre, juntos tienen un taller donde confeccionan articulos de cuero, como ser: cinturones, polainas, guantes industrias, Chalecos, Pecheras para perros. Es una persona muy trabajadora. Con su trabajo ayuda a su hermano a pagar sus estudios. 

Requiere del dinero para poder comprar en la ciudad de Cochabamba cuero curtido para poder realizar la confeccion y entregar a las empresas que le comprar sus artyiculos de cuero.
texts.en:
Sr. Yamil D., 32, is single. He lives alone and likes being independent.
