Yamil and his father have a workshop where they make all kinds of leather goods: belts, industrial gloves, jackets, etc. Yamil works hard and his earnings help to pay his brother's school fees. Yamil will use the loan to buy supplies of tanned leather at a market in Cochabamba so that he can make the products that he sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy leather for leather products business.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Soy C. is 36 years old and sells fruits in Takeo province. She has been in business for about four years and she makes US$10 every day. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver who earns, on average, US$5 a day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business as inflation is high and weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. Soy is asking for a loan of US$1000 to increase her stock of fruits to sell. She sees this investment as an opportunity to increase her daily income.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fruits.

loans.name: Irlanda Cecilia

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

Aquí encontramos a Irlanda, tiene 49 años de edad, esta separada pero de esta relación tuvo 3 hijos los cuales en la actualidad son mayores de edad, todos viven aparte y ella vive con un hermano.

Se dedica al comercio,  vende  ropa por catalogo de algunas marcas, su sistema de venta es puerta a puerta,  ofrece sus productos  y luego realiza los pedidos que se los hace mes a mes,  trabaja de lunes a jueves, cobra la mitad en la entrega y después de quince días la totalidad.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar mercadería ya que tiene mas pedidos de lo que su capital actual puede comprar. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace 9 años y le gusta la forma de trabajar en la institución.
 
Sus metas son seguir creciendo y tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Picoaza is certified as one of the Manteña culture’s aboriginal settlements.  It is located a mere ten minutes from the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí.  It is rich in history.  The María Asunción communal bank meets here every two weeks.

Irlanda, 49, is a member.  She is separated but had three children all of whom are adults currently.  They all live on their own and she lives with one of her brothers.

She is a clothing merchant selling catalogue clothes of a few brands.  Her system of sales is door-to-door.  She shows her available items and places monthly orders.  She works from Monday to Thursday.  She collects half the charge upon delivery and then the rest two weeks later.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise because she has more pending orders than her capital can cover.  She has been a member of the Communal Bank for 9 years and she likes the institution’s way of operating.

Her goals are to continue growing and to have her own store.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, dresses and clothing in general.

loans.name: Maicel

texts.en:
Maicel A. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Lapaz, Bogo City, Cebu. She earns her living by buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes and accessories. Her husband Adelino A., who is 26 years old, works as a family driver to earn his living. They have an 8-year-old child. Maicel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Maicel has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 13,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 5,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth cycle loan, she is borrowing 17,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase more stocks to sell, so that she can continue saving up for the future education of her child. Maicel is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Lirio De Los Valles Group

texts.es:
HISTORIA G.S. LIRIO DE LOS VALLES

MARIA JUANA T.. Es originaria del departamento de chimaltenango, tiene 28 años de edad, tiene dos hijos pequeños, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, desde hace un año ella tiene la profesion de secretaria oficinista pero por falta de trabajo no puede desempeñar su profesion en ninguna empresa, es por esa razon que decidio abrir su tienda de consumo diario, porque es lo que mas se vende ella necesita surtir su tienda, porque le piden productos y no ha podido surtir y es por eso que necesita el prestamo.

MIRIAM ADELA B.. Es originaria del municipio de Santa Cruz del Quiche ella se dedica a al elaboración de tejidos en choshet, elabora cubrecamas, manteles ropa de bebe individuales, etc.y ademas para la epoca que viene elabora coronas para adornar los panteones de los muertos ella necesita el credito para poder comprar materia prima y poder elaborar su producto para lograr obtener un poco de ganancia para la epoca.

MAYRA T. G.. Es originaria de Chimaltenango, tiene 27 años de edad , tiene dos hijos , se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica, su negocio es ambulante, le encargan blusas y cortes y ella los entrega en las casas tiene dos años en la actividad, y ahora necesita su preastamo para poder comprar mercaderia y poder surtir .
texts.en:
LIRIO DE LOS VALLES

MARIA JUANA T. is originally from the Guatemalan "departamento" of Chimaltenango.  She is 28 years old and has two young children.  She operates a business selling everyday commodities.  She trained as a secretary more than a year ago, but hasn't been able to find a job with a company because there's no work.  She decided to open a grocery because everyone buys groceries.  Now she needs to stock the store with products that her customers ask for, but which she hasn't been able to stock to now.  She will use the loan for this purpose.

MIRIAM ADELA B. is originally from the town of Santa Cruz del Quiche.  She operates a business making and selling crocheted products.  Among other things, she makes bed covers and baby clothes.  This time of year, she also makes funeral wreathes for memorials to the dead.  She is applying for a loan to buy the supplies she needs for her business.

MAYRA T. G. is also from Chimaltenango originally.  She is 27 years old and has two children.  She works as a street vendor selling clothing.  She buys blouses and shorts, for example, on consignment and delivers them to her customers, work that she has been doing for two years.  She needs a loan now so that she can buy merchandise and stock her business.

loans.use: Buy products and supplies for various businesses.

loans.name: Ashley

texts.en:
Ashley H. is the executive director of the Capital Area Phoenix Initiative, a non-profit start-up that addresses the overwhelming need in Baton Rouge for HIV/AIDs services. Ashley is currently employed by the Public Health Department as a Disease Intervention Specialist. Whenever a person tests positive for a disease, a specialist visits that person to follow up, conduct an interview, and refer him or her to an agency. With Baton Rouge being the city with the second highest ratio of people with HIV/AIDS in the United States, Ashley realized that the current agencies were overwhelmed. While she has been working at her current job, she is also studying for her PhD in Public Health at Waldon University, applying for funding for her non-profit, and completing the extensive application to qualify for non-profit status. As soon as she attains enough funding, Ashley plans on resigning from her current job and completely dedicating herself to starting the Capital Area Phoenix Initiative. 

Ashley decided to start this non-profit because on a daily basis, she witnesses how challenging it is to navigate the medical system, especially with an isolating condition like HIV/AIDS. This non-profit will help clients apply for Medicaid, insurance, food stamps, and find counseling and support. Furthermore, Ashley is dedicated to educating the public about the prevention of HIV/AIDS as well, which differentiates her agency from others. Once Ashley finishes her certification for Medicaid at the end of November, she will be able to start taking referrals and working with clients. 

Ashley plans on hiring six employees in the beginning to help her accomplish the tri-fold vision of her business: outreach and prevention, case management, and ultimately, a free clinic. Her goal is to open her doors on World AIDS day on Dec. 5th to offer free AIDS testing. Aside from applying for non-profit status, Ashley’s biggest challenge was finding a space for an office that would be located within a larger building so that clients could enter the building without fear of being noticed. Ashley is very proud that she found the perfect location after looking for quite a while. 

With this loan, Ashley plans on buying office equipment and signs. Ashley’s motivation is unstoppable because “I want to be a better person and be more humble about helping others. That’s my goal in life. This infection could happen to anybody at any time. It doesn’t differentiate between race, age, or gender. My goal is to prevent more people from getting this.”

loans.use: Office equipment and signs

loans.name: Segundo Angel

texts.es:
Segundo es un padre de familia de 26 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a su menor hijo en el sector Las Pampas, una zona rural del distrito de Pimentel, ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores desde hace más de cinco años, el cría aves de corral en algunos corrales situados dentro de su domicilio. Cuando estas aves han alcanzado su correcto desarrollo las ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes de la zona. Adicionalmente trabaja como maestro panadero. Con los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades el se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

El desea realizar algunas mejoras en su domicilio ya que se avecinan las temporadas de lluvia y si no realiza algunos refuerzos es posible que su vivienda sufra daños. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Segundo es un padre responsable y bastante entregado a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo y de confianza.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 26 year old father who lives with his wife and young son in the “Las Pampas” sector, a rural zone in the Pimentel district, located more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He’s been raising and selling small animals for more than five years, including corral birds, in corrals located in his home.  When these birds have reached their proper development, he offers them for sale to the general public and to merchants in the zone.  He also works as a master baker.  He moves his family ahead with the income that these businesses generate.

He wants to make some improvements to his home now that the rainy season is approaching.  If he doesn’t make repairs, his house could suffer damage.  For this reason he has seen fit to request a 1,200 PEN ($450) loan through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Home repair

loans.name: Hernestina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hernestina; ella es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de verdura y fruta  ella vende en su stand en la calle monjaspata por el centro de la ciudad, siendo este el unico sustento para sacar a su hijo adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the community bank "Patron de Santiago".  The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the Cusco province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Hernestina, she is single and has one son.  The member divides her time between her daily chores and running a business of purchase and resale of vegetables and fruit.  She sells at her stand on the Monjaspata street at the center of the city.  This is the only source of income that she has for getting her son ahead.

She is requesting the loan to purchase merchandise for her business.

The member is very happy to get the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: The associate is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es: El Sr. Raymundo R.  es una persona muy honrada y respetuosa el tiene un negocio de abarrotes, el cual el desea ampliar un poco mas para así poder ofrecer mas variedad a su clientela el vive con su esposa y una hija, el Sr. Raymundo necesita el préstamo para así poder invertir mas en su tienda, su esposa no trabaja se mantienen de la tienda de abarrotes  por eso el quiere brindar mas y mejor servicio y variedad a la vez.
texts.en: Raymundo R. is a very honest and respectful person.  He owns a grocery store which he would like to expand a little so that he can offer more variety to his customers.  Raymundo lives with his wife and daughter.  He needs this loan so that he can invest more in his store.  His wife doesn't work and it is the grocery store that supports his family.  This is why he would like to be able to offer a better service with more products and variety.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin M. is from the village of Esperanza West. He is 46 years old. Benjamin is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Benjamin owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Benjamin has been engaged in his business for over 18 years and earns approximately 25000 during harvest season.

In 2010, Benjamin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benjamin is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Benjamin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena R. is a farmer and owns a small parcel of land in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She also grows chickens and pigs in her backyard. It is her dream to grow her business so that she can provide for the needs of her family.

She would like to apply for a loan at Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy fertilizers and rice seeds.

The reason for choosing CEVI as her MFI was that she likes the Micro Insurance package of CEVI.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Mary Annan Ama

texts.en: Mary Annan Ama E. is married to a farmer and has 6 children. The family lives in Dompoase, near Elmina, Cape Coast. Mary Annan has been selling loaves of bread and other food products for six years. She walks to neighboring villages, usually an hour’s walk or more, balancing the basin (shown in the picture) on her head. Her earnings go towards her children’s school fees and some household expenses. Mary Annan hopes to develop her business and will use the loan to invest in more ingredients and food products to generate higher sales.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and food products

loans.name: Nanci Sulma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy Sulma ; la socia tiene 24 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica a la agricultura ella siembra verduras como zanahoria, lechuga, tomate entre otros, la socia a la vez compra y vende fruta y otras verduras que no produce, la socia lleva su mercadería a vender a las distintas ferias que se encuentran en el Valle Sagrado y en el mercado de Huancaro de Cusco,a la vez la socia también compra otro tipo de verduras y frutas que no tiene para tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes ,la socia es una persona bien emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia .

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas para su chacra y para comprar otros productos para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nancy Sulma belongs to the Los Angeles Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.  Nancy Sulma is 24 years old, married, and has two children.

Nancy devotes herself to farming.  She grows vegetables like carrots, lettuce, and tomatoes, among others.  At the same time she buys and sells fruit and other vegetable that she does not produce.  She takes her merchandise to sell at different fairs in the Valle Sagrado and to the Huancaro Market in Cusco.  She also buys other types of vegetables and fruits that she does not have in order to have a better variety of products to offer her customers.

She is a very enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead for her family’s sake.  She is requesting the loan to buy seeds for her farm and to buy other products for her business.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds for her farm and to buy other products for her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Jane has a business doing tailoring. She has been in this business for 18 years, and she works six days a week. Jane sells her clothes by retail. Jane has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of cloth.   

The main business challenge for Jane is seasonality. Her goals are to eventually buy a plot of land. Jane lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and to piped water.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and threads

loans.name: Chrispin

texts.en:
Chrispin O. O. is twenty four years old. He is single and does not have any children yet. He owns a transport services business located at Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya known for production of fish. It harbours Lake Victoria and commonly known as the lake basin. 

Chrispin has been in the transport business for two years now and has not managed to employ people yet since he owns only one motorcycle. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is theft. Thugs pretend to be customers and on their way to the destination they rob him.

However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. Due to this Chrispin has plans to diversify his business by starting a barber shop and that is why he has taken this loan amounting to 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). Even when he is venturing to a different business, he plans to grow his transport business. He describes himself as having good customer relations.

loans.use: to start a barber shop

loans.name: Socorro Del Pilar

texts.es:
Socorro es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el caserío Tejedores Bajo que se ubica a 12 km del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, ella recorre el caserío y zonas aledañas, ella ofrece estos productos tanto al crédito como al contado y los ofrece principalmente entre sus vecinos y conocidos, realiza cobranzas semanales y quincenales. Esta actividad es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia y gracias a ella ayuda a su esposo con el mantenimiento de la economía diaria.

Socorro desea adquirir más mercadería para ampliar su negocio y aumentar su nivel de ventas y ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante hogareña y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Socorro is a mother who is 44 years old and lives with her husband and son in the Tejedores Bajo rural area which is 12 km from the Tambogrande agricultural district in the Piura Region.  It is over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque.

She sells clothing throughout the rural area and villages for a living.  Her neighbors and acquaintances are her main customers.  She sells either on credit or for cash and collects payment weekly or biweekly.  The business has been of great economic help to her family and has allowed her to help her husband cover daily household expenses.

Socorro wants to purchase more merchandise to expand her business and increase sales and earning.  She thought it would be a good idea to request a loan for 1,700 PEN through Edpyme Alternative to help her reach her goal.

She is a home-loving woman and very intent on getting ahead.  People who know her say she is very responsible and dependable.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van I., 39, resides in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. I. and her husband are employed at the factory, earning an income of $5 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend $90 USD on food and $35 USD on other necessary expenses. I. is requesting a loan of $500 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get a shop instead of working from a cart.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for 16 years and sells all his farm produce to the local market. He earns additional income from his hotel business in the same location. Joseph is 46 years old and married with seven children aged between two and 21. Five of the children are currently attending school.

He has made a loan request of 62,400 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help boost his family's living standards. Unpredictable weather conditions, high cost of animal feed and diseases have been his major setbacks. He hopes to own at least six quality dairy cows in the next five years to help improve his production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is a 56-year-old widow who now resides in the province of Siem Reap. She has been living with her five married children, most of whom are employed in various work. Ly grows a few crops on a plot of her fertile land. This rice-growing season she wants to plant a rice crop but she doesn’t have sufficient capital to do this. Ly needs a loan from Kiva in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer to make her crops grow well.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Normal Isabel

texts.es:
Norma de 38 años,  es una mujer trabajadora que tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Empezó con la tienda ya que por el sector donde vive no había otros negocios de venta de víveres. 

Poco a poco fue incrementando la mercadería y víveres para que sus clientes hasta ahora que sigue con su pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Vende arroz, aceite, azúcar etc. su esposo también trabaja es maestro albañil. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, bloques. 

En el futuro quiere ampliar la tienda.
texts.en:
Norma is 38 years old, she is a hardworking woman who has a small store in the front part of her home. She started her store in an area where there weren’t any other grocery store businesses.

Little by little, she began to increase her merchandize and supplies for her customers that go to her small store in the front of her home. Norma sells rice, oil, sugar, etc. her husband also works as a master mason. Norma has many hopes for her business which is why she needs the loan to be able to buy construction materials like cement, sand, and concrete blocks.

In the future Norma would like to expand her store.

loans.use: buy cement, concrete blocks, and sand.

loans.name: Vivigyn

texts.en: Vivigyn is married and a mother of three school-age dependents. She is 45 years old and lives in Aurora Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Vivigyn is a farmer. She plants and harvests corn to earn a living. She sells corn at the local market for food and feed for the animals. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns PHP 25,000 every quarter from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers and to pay labor cost at harvesting. Vivigyn has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Vivigyn hopes to purchase equipment to use in her production.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and to pay the labor cost at harvesting.

loans.name: Laura Mónica

texts.es:
La Señora. Laura es socia del banco comunal Sentimiento, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, por un sector muy visitado gracias a su buena gastronomía, su hermosa arquitectura, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, su mayor característica es la de ser personas muy cálidas y amables.

Doña Laura tiene 40 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos  de 21, 18 y 13 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y  le ayuda económicamente, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de helados, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Laura se dedica a la venta de helados, esta actividad la desempeña hace 14 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo y su producto lo vende recorriendo la ciudad.
  
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de azúcar, leche, frutas y saborizantes para elaborar sus helados.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Laura is a member of the community bank 'Sentimiento' and lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca in an area which is often visited for its excellent cooking, its beautiful architecture and its people who raise animals and work in commerce and agriculture. They are best known for being very warm and friendly. 

Laura is 40 years old, married and has three children who are 21, 18 and 13 years old. Her eldest son works and supports her financially, while her two youngest children study at a secondary school in the city. Her husband works selling ice cream. They don't have a home of their own so they are currently renting.  
 
Laura has worked selling ice cream for the last 14 years. She works seven days a week with no fixed schedule, selling ice cream all over the city. 
  
This is the first loan that Laura has taken out with the community bank and she will use it to purchase sugar, milk, fruit and flavouring to make ice cream.
 
Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, fruit and flavouring to make ice cream

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a farmer working in the Philippines. He has been doing this work for almost 33 years. He is a 49-year-old father who has three school-aged children.
Roberto is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to be used to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to sustain rice production. He hopes to yield a plentiful harvest in order to increase his income to finance the education of his children in college and to meet his family's basic daily needs. Currently, he earns 8,500 PHP each month in this field of work. He is thankful to Kiva lenders who offer financial assistance to sustain his crop production. He believes that someday he will start another kind of business for his wife to manage.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for rice production.

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetables selling business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 14 years.  She also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Vilma is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell in her business.   She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

Vilma dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Ivet

texts.es: Ivet es una confeccionista de 47 años de edad que vive en el municipio de Malambo con su cónyuge y su hijo de 14 años de edad. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la confección de ropa en las líneas femeninas masculinas e infantiles, a una clientela principalmente de mujeres adultas y jóvenes y también,  prestas el servicio de maquila en talleres de confección que así lo soliciten ubicados en el municipio de Malambo. Su infraestructura técnica le ha permitido independizarse gradualmente y desde hace muchos años no le falta trabajo, hasta ha tenido que prestar maquinas-fileteadoras para responder al acabado perfecto que sus clientes merecen. Su esposo es comerciante independiente y distribuye productos de consumo en tiendas del sector. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la línea de credikiva, con el que planea comprar una fileteadora con el fin de mejorar la calidad de sus productos y disminuir el tiempo de producción. Su sueño más adelante es mejorar y completar toda su infraestructura técnica, con tal de fomentar el empleo desde su taller y generar mayores ingresos que apoyen el bienestar de su familia, aunque su mayor desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo ante su creciente clientela y este es el propósito por el cual acude a su primer apalancamiento financiero
texts.en: Ivet is a 47-year-old garment manufacturer who lives in the Malambo municipality with her partner and 14-year-old child. She has made men's, women's, and children's clothing for 12 years. Her clientele are mainly adult and young women. She also provides services to clothing workshops in the Malambo municipality. Her technical infrastructure has allowed her to gradually become independent and she has not lacked for work for several years. She has had to borrow overlock sewing machines in order to do the work that her customers deserve. Her husband is an independent merchant and distributes consumer products to the local stores. She is currently applying for her first loan with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, through Kiva. With it she plans to buy an overlock sewing machine with the goal of improving her products and decreasing production time. Her dream for the future is to improve and complete all of her technical infrastructure, in order to generate a better income to support her family's well-being. Her greatest challenge is having insufficient working capital faced with a growing customer base. This is why she has turned to her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine with the goal of improving the quality of her products and decreasing production time.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 44 years old. He is married to Lucy who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children aged 10 and 6 years-old respectively. He has been operating a public service vehicle for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 30,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. John will use the loan to buy another public service vehicle which will increase his income. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand his wife’s farming business. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children up to university level and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy another public service vehicle which will increase his income.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia tiene 53 años y es socia del Banco Comunal "Nuestra Señora de la Paz“ del distrito Tarapoto del departamento San Martín. Tiene dos hijos mayores que viven fuera de casa y una hija de 12 años que vive con ella.

Rosalia es una de las primeras socias del Banco Comunal, lleva ya 12 años con Manuela Ramos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, visita a sus clientes en sus casas para sacar pedidos. Tiene además un puesto donde exhibe sus productos, además aprovecha para vender bebidas y de vez en cuando comida.  
El nuevo préstamo de S/.3,000.00 lo invertirá en la compra de nuevos productos cósmeticos como perfume y nuevas bebidas.

Lo que le gusta con Manuela Ramos es que ha aprendido a ahorrar y cómo generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosalia is 53 years old and is a member of the communal bank “Nuestra Señora de la Paz” (Our Lady of Peace) in the district of Tarapoto in the department of San Martín. She has two grown children who live on their own and a 12 year old daughter who lives with her. 

Rosalia is one of the first members of the communal bank, already having 12 years with Manuela Ramos. She sells beauty products through a catalogue, and she visits clients in their homes to take orders. She also has a stall where she shows her products, and she also takes the opportunity to sell drinks and, from time to time, food. 

She will invest the new loan of S/.3,000.00 in the purchase of new cosmetic products like perfume and new drinks. What she likes about Manuela Ramos is that she has learned to save and how to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetics in general and drinks

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur is 46 years old and lives with his children and wife in a house in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife sews clothes and plants vegetables. His daughters are college and high school students. 

Gantumur has been working as a truck driver at the grain field since 1999. He also provides a land-removal service to people and organizations. His wife makes deels -- traditional Mongolian coats -- at home and is well recognized in the local area. His family plants several types of vegetables and sells them. Gantumur is a hard-working and open-minded man who says "I want to expand my business and have new equipment." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy spare parts for his tractor.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a flexible person. Aside from raising hogs, she is also a food vendor. She cooks and sells food products such as glutinous rice desserts. She offers it house-to-house to the people in the village where they live. She has been doing it for almost three years. She earns approximately P2,000 each month.

She is now requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy ingredients such as sugar, milk and flour for her food selling business. In the future, she wants to establish a food stall so that she will no longer offer her products house-to-house.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar, milk and flour for her food selling business.

loans.name: Zunilda Ester

texts.es:
La señora Zunilda es soltera, tiene 28 años de edad, vive en la Ciudad de Curuguaty. Es comerciante, cuenta con un Kiosco,  que está ubicado dentro del Salón de la Terminal de Ómnibus de Curuguaty. Dice que tiene  2 años de antigüedad y experiencia en el ramo.
Ella comenta que se levanta a muy tempranas horas del día para abrir su kiosko, ya que en la terminal siempre hay gente circulando. Dice que le va muy bien en las ventas y que le gustaría poder seguir con su negocio, es por ello que  solicita el crédito para la compra de un congelador, que le será de mucha ayuda en su negocio, pues necesita mantener frías las bebidas que vende. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad de progreso que le está dando, pues esto le serás de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sra. Zunilda is 28 years old, single, and lives in the city of Curuguaty. She is a merchant who manages a kiosk inside the hall of the bus terminal in Curuguaty. Zunilda says that she has been in business for two years and has experience in this type of work.

She says that she wakes up very early in order to open her kiosk since there are always people walking around the bus terminal. Zunilda indicates that she has done very well with her sales and would like to continue with her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy a freezer because it will be a great help in her business since she needs to chill the beverages that she sells. Zunilda is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for giving her this opportunity to make progress, which will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for chilling beverages.

loans.name: Palmira

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, Provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 2 filhos todos frenquentam a Escola. Fez a 10ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais.  Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 3 irmãs e uma sobrinha que vivem com ela. 

É educadora ha mais de 3 anos num Centro Infantil na Matola e tem um salário de 4.500.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt,com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (barrotes, cimento, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende construir um recinto e abrir uma Escolinha Infantil pessoal, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Palmira was born in the city of Matola, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has two children who both go to school. Palmira finished tenth grade but did not continue because her parents did not have the money for it. She lives in her own house with her family and also supports three sisters and a niece who live with her.

For more than three years Palmira has been a teacher at a preschool in Matola. She has a salary of 4,500 meticais which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank account.

She has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Palmira's first Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 20,000 meticais to buy materials (beams, cement, sand, stone, iron and other items) to continue construction on her house.

Palmira promises to make her payments on time, and one day she intends to build a place and start her own school. To do it she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her house (beams, cement, sand, stone, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Bety

texts.es: Bety, de 29 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy responsable. Vive con su pareja con quien tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales dos son mayores e independientes mientras que dos son menores y de 18 y 10 años quienes estudian y aun dependen de ella. Juntos habitan en una casa propia en donde comparten sus días a lado de su conviviente quien se esfuerza mucho al igual que ella para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. EL trabajo de Bety consiste en la venta de abarrotes, ella se encarga de comprar al por mayor que es cuando le dan los precios más cómodos y los vende al menudeo agregándole un porcentaje a sus precios, además de éste trabajo, ella se dedica al alquiler de mototaxi de los cuales uno maneja su hijo y a otro lo alquila obteniendo así ganancias por cada uno. Lleva trabajando con este negocio ya por cuatro años y lo hace sola, pues su conviviente se dedica a otras actividades. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer y manejar su tiempo como a ella mejor le parece, cuenta que no fue fácil al momento de emprender este negocio ya que las dudas y los temores le embargaban, pero poco a poco fue tomando más fuerza y ahora es muy buena en lo que hace,. Ella se propuso un objetivo, que es ampliar su negocio y brindar mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes. Este será el préstamo numero 15 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su negocio, Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado 1600 soles, comprará productos para su tienda, además mandará a arreglar sus dos vehículos para que estén en mejores condiciones ya que se deterioraron por el mal estado de la calles de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Bety, 29, is a good, friendly and very responsible woman. She lives with her partner with whom she has four children, two of whom are adults and independent, while two are still minors and, at 18 and 10 years of age, are still in school and dependent on her. Together they live in their own house where she shares her days with her partner, who works as hard as she does to provide the family with a better quality of life.

Bety’s work is selling groceries; she buys wholesale when she gets the best prices and then sells retail, adding a percentage to her prices. In addition to this, she also rents out motor taxis, one to her son and the other to someone else and receives an income from each one. She has had her businesses for four years and she runs them alone, since her partner works elsewhere.  What she likes about her work is that it permits her to manage and dispose of her time the way she wants. She states that it was not easy to start her businesses for she was overwhelmed by doubts and fears; nevertheless, little by little she worked harder and now she is very good at what she does.  

Her goal is to expand her grocery store and provide her customers with a greater number of products. This will be her 15th loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support since she will feel more assured of progressing in her business. She is again committed to making her payments on time. With the sum requested, 1,600 soles, she will buy products for her store and will also send her two vehicles for repair so they will be in better shape since they had deteriorated due to the bad state of the streets in her city.

loans.use: to buy a larger number of products.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. Pedro de 73 años es casado; hace treinta años el tenia 2 prioridades en su vida, la primera era dejarles a sus hijos, la mejor herencia seria terminar su Educación Escolar y la otra era que cuando el y su esposa llegaran a la vejez tuvieran un lugar digno donde pasar sus últimos días y ambas prioridades fueron realizadas, para él  su hogar es muy  cálido y la  comodidad con la que hoy vive es el esfuerzo de muchos  años de trabajo, es una casa pequeña que tiene lo necesario para ser felices y puedan recibir a sus hijos y nietos   en épocas importantes. Solo que el tiene un problema en el techo de su casa y se trasmina el agua; este cae justo donde se encuentra el foco de la sala, por lo que no puede prender el foco en épocas de lluvia porque le puede generar un corto circuito, el anhela que para navidad el techo de su casa ya este reconstruido y evitar este problema de la gotera justo en el foco porque de otra manera seria este año 2011 en el que él no pudiera recibir a sus hijos en Navidad en su casa y tenían que irse a la casa de alguno de sus hijos. La mayor satisfacción que él tiene es ver reunida a toda su familia en su hogar.
texts.en:
Pedro is 73 years old and married.  Thirty years ago he had two priorities in life, one was to make sure his children finished their educations and the other was to be sure that he and his wife had a place to spend stay in their later years.  He met both of those goals.  His home is warm and the fruit of all the effort he put forth through many years of working.  It’s a small house, but has all the necessities for them to be happy and have their children and grandchildren visit during important seasons.

The only problem he’s having is with the roof leaking and the water is entering into the living room near the light.  He is unable to use the lights during the rainy season because of short circuits.  He would like to have the roof replaced befor Christmas, otherwise he won’t be able to host his children for Christmas this year, and they will have to go to one of their homes.  His main satisfaction will come from having all of his family in his home.

loans.use: to replace his roof.

loans.name: Kuwirirana Group

texts.en:
Magrety is 47 years old, widowed, and has 9 children aged 30, 29, 27, 21, 18, 15, 13, 8 and 6. Only 4 attend school, and she has two brothers who are also her dependents. 

She rears chickens and sells clothes and blankets. The family helps out in the business. She buys her products from nearby towns and from South Africa. She operates her business at her home in the Mucheke district of Masvingo.  She has been in business for 5 years and has no employees.  She receives her husband's pension as another source of income.


Magrety faces the challenge of debtors who fail to pay and chicks that die prematurely due to heat. She would like to own a poultry shop in town and a boutique. She will use the money to buy chicks, stockfeeds, blankets, and clothes.  This loan will help her take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy chicks, stockfeeds, blankets, and clothes

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, age 28 years, is married to Cosmus and they are blessed with two children, age 12 and 4 years.

She does quarrying and has been doing it for eight years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 20,000.

This is her first loan with KADET Ltd. She will use the loan to buy quarrying tools and pay wages. Margaret hopes to have modern, sophisticated quarrying machines in the future.

loans.use: To buy tools for quarrying and to pay wages.

loans.name: Laura Emilia

texts.es:
Laura Emilia tiene 29 años es casada vive con el esposo y con los  hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas en el Reciento Campo Alegre.

Esta ventanilla SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, cerca de la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Laura Emilia se dedica a la agricultura siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace 7 años, herencia de los padres,  las compras las realizan en comercial Jiménez de la ciudad de ventanas y las vende en la misma ciudad.

El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos para el cuidado de los cultivos, además le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos de la familia. Sueño es tener una casa.

Le gusta arreglar la casa y descansar.
texts.en:
Laura Emilia is 29 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the neighborhood of Campo Alegre in the canton of Ventanas.

The San Jacinto Communal Bank is located in the neighborhood of Campo Alegre, which is near the parish of Guare in the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Laura Emilia is a farmer who has been growing corn and rice for seven years. She learned this trade from her parents. Her purchases are made at the Jiménez Commericial Center in the city of Ventanas and she sells her products in the same city. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers, and composts for taking care of her crops. This will also help increase her family’s income. Her dream is to have a house.

Laura enjoys remodeling her house and relaxing.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and composts.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 49-year-old married woman. She has two children 12 and 16 years old. She describes herself as customer-friendly. She operates a general store where she sells sugar, salt, flour, sodas, bread, sweets, razor blades, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy residential area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more sugar, salt, flour, etc. Grace's  business goal is to run a fully stocked shop within five years.

loans.use: To  buy sugar, salt, flour, etc.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Goefrey is a 33-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 4 to 14 years. He describes himself to be independent. He operates a retail store where he sells slippers. He has been involved in this business for 16 years. His business is located within a busy town and his primary customers are local residents, tourists, and businesspeople. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather changes, especially during sunny days as it discolours the slippers, which customers then shun away from buying. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy slippers. His business goal is to build a permanent business store within five years. He hopes that in the future he will expand his business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy slippers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will spend the loan money to purchase a dairy goat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise at whole-sale prices

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs N. is an active woman. She is socially very involved in her community. Currently she is the leader of the women group in her village. She's also a member of the committee of a charity organization. Mrs N. also takes good care of her household. In her yard, she's raising 6 pigs, a few dozen of hens, 2 oxes. She's also tending her 1 acre of rice field, 5 acres of bananas trees. Her husband, Lương Văn Đạt, is also working very hard to help her out in spite of his health problem. They're also brewing wine for the villagers. Their 2 children are grown up and live on their own so they are not a burden for their parents. At the age of 47, healthy and hard working in her nature, Mrs N. is seeking a loan to expand her pig raising family business and better exploit her land. She requests 575 USD to buy more pigs, hens and food.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer.

Là một phụ nữ năng động, chị N. tham gia hầu như mọi công tác xã hội tại địa phương. Hiện tại chị đang kiêm nhiệm nhiều chức vụ: chi hội trưởng phụ nữ thôn, ban chấp hành xã, cán bộ cụm của Quỹ Tình thương. Không chỉ giỏi việc nước chị N. còn đảm việc nhà. Chị hiện đang nuôi 6 con lợn, vài chục con gà, 2 con bò. Bên cạnh đó diện tích đất canh tác của gia đình bao gồm 1 mẫu ruộng, 5 mẫu đất trồng chuối. Chồng chị, Anh Lương Văn Đạt, mặc dù sức khỏe không được tốt cũng rất tích cực giúp vợ trong công việc gia đình. Ngoài ra anh chị còn nấu rượu để cung cấp cho người làng. Hai con của anh chị đã trưởng thành ra ở riêng nên gánh nặng kinh tế với gia đình hầu như không có. Nhưng ở độ tuổi 47, vẫn còn sức khỏe cộng với tính cần cù chịu khó của người phụ nữ Việt Nam chị vẫn tích cực chăn nuôi sản xuất phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Chị N. đang làm đơn xin vay 575 USD để có thêm vốn mua thức ăn, phát triển đàn lợn, gà của gia đình.

loans.use: Buy food for pigs, chickens

loans.name: Than Chun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thun Chun L., 36, lives with her husband, 42, and her 2 children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. She currently earns US$ 2 a day selling fish to people in her community, whilst her husband earns $5 a day operating a passenger cart drawn by a horse. The couple also grow some crops which they keep for their own consumption.

They would now like to increase their income by purchasing a pump. Mrs. Thun Chun L. feels this is a useful investment because she will use the pump herself so that she can irrigate her own land, but she will also make income renting it out to her neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase a pump to use in cultivating her own crops and to rent out to her community

loans.name: Seidou

texts.fr:
Séidou S., age 44, was born in Lomé and resides in Togblé. He has been a truck driver for 15 years. Married and the father of six, he also has three other dependents to care for. During his free time, he takes care of his livestock (cows, chickens). His vehicle's current condition prevents him from earning a good living; to do so, he is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy a new one in order to improve living conditions for him and his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur S. Séidou, âgé de 44 ans est né à Lomé et réside à Togblé. Il est conducteur d’engin lourd depuis 15 ans, marié et père de six (06) enfants et trois (03) autres personnes à charge. Pendant ses heures libres il s’occupe de son élevage (bovins, poules). L’état actuel de son véhicule ne lui permet pas de bien faire son travail. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour acheter une nouvelle afin d’améliore sa condition de vie et celle de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a vehicle

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en: Aminah is 42 years old and the mother of a 7-year-old daughter. Together with her husband, S., she sells snacks and day-to-day necessities in her small shop . She usually earns $10 per day. She is hoping to receive this loan to buy some goods to fill her shop and expand her business. She depends on this business because it's the only source of income they have. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods to fill her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for the upcoming beach season

loans.name: Lidia's Group

texts.en:
Lidia, Delia, and Yesica are part of the Cielo community bank. Lidia has been a member for one year while Delia and Yesica joined four months ago. In the community bank they have learned to be responsible, punctual, and to save. They have also learned how to avoid sickness, avoid domestic violence, and how to use contraceptives. They mentioned that they really like their bank organizer, who is dynamic and happy.

Lidia is 25 years old. She lives with her partner and three year old daughter. Lidia has been raising cattle for two years. She raises her cattle in the town of Sacsmarca in the district of Huascahura. In addition, during the week, Lidia travels to different markets buying fruits, vegetables and grains and then selling them in the city of Ayacuho.

Delia is 27 years old. She lives with her partner and two young children. By profession she is a teacher but currently is running a business selling cosmetics. She has been selling cosmetics to her friends and families for one and a half years.

Meanwhile, Yesica is 30 years old. She also lives with her partner and two young children. Yesica transports clothing from the city of Lima and then sells it to friends, families, and different institutions. Together with her husband, Yesica travels to the city of Andahuaylas to buy different grains and then sells them in Ayacucho. She learned this business from her in-laws.

Lidia, Delia, and Yesica need loans of 200, 400, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will use to buy pork, colognes, perfumes, cosmetics, pants, and shirts.

loans.use: To buy pork.

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
I am the group leader Mussarat B. of a small group that is in the picture above. These women are: Safia B. who is borrowing for her husband who deals in ceramic objects. Nathoo B.’s husband manufactures home made soaps and needs to buy raw materials. Irshad A. trades cloth and Manzoora B. want to purchase a sewing machine. All of us have been together for a period of three years and completely trust each other.   Not only this we also help each other in matters other than money and business. 
I am a mother of six and I am currently borrowing for one of my sons who has an auto workshop and wants to buy spare parts.

loans.use: Buy spare parts for the auto workshop

loans.name: Ashura's Salon Group

texts.en:
Ashura is 28 years old and is married with 1 child, age 7. Ashura owns a small beauty salon, which she started in 2003. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Ashura has taken out 1successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Happy, who has a grocery.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi M., 60 years old, joined the Fund since 1995. Her family economy at that time was very poor because of lack of money and her husband was not in good health conditions. With the borrowed money from the Fund, she started breeding pigs. At first, she had one pig, and the number of pigs increased gradually. Her profit from breeding pigs was used to help her son build a house, and furnish her own home. Currently, she is breeding 30 pigs, each of 45kg and they are all ready to be sold. This time, she wants to borrow 1200 USD to expand her farm and buy more pigs. Her average income is 300USD/ month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Mạc, 60 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 1995. Kinh tế gia đình còn rất nhiều khó khăn do thiếu vốn làm ăn, chồng chị lại bị bệnh. Được vay vốn của Quỹ chị Mạc mua lợn giống về nuôi. Lúc đầu chỉ có 1 con, sau số lượng lợn nuôi tăng dần. Số tiền lãi từ chăn nuôi được chị Mạc mua đất làm nhà cho con trai, sắm tiện nghi sinh hoạt trong gia đình. Hiện nay chị đang nuôi 30 con lợn thịt, mỗi con khoảng 45 kg và chuẩn bị xuất chuồng. Dự định vòng vốn này chị Mạc xin vay 1200 USD để mở rộng chuồng trại và mua lợn giống. Thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng của chị Mạc là 300USD.

loans.use: Buy pigs and expand farm

loans.name: Julia Azucena

texts.es:
In the Villanueva municipal area in the city of Chinandega, Nicaragua, Julia B. has worked for more than 15 years in the business of selling food that she herself has made. Julia is someone who through difficult economic times, has moved her business forward, thanks to the support that she has received from Ceprodel through credits that she has used to buy ingredients for the food.

Once more she is looking for credit to purchase ingredients for food. Her dream is to create a larger business and as a single mother, continue supporting her only child.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Julia B. se ha dedicado desde hace más de 15 años a su negocio de venta de alimentos que son elaborados por ella misma. Es una persona que a pesar de las difíciles situaciones económicas que ha atravesado, ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio y esto lo ha hecho gracias al apoyo único que ha recibido de Ceprodel por medio de los créditos que los ha utilizado para la compra de los ingredientes para los alimentos.

En la actualidad una vez mas ella solicita un crédito para la compra de los ingredientes para los alimentos. Su sueño es convertirse en una gran comerciante y así lograr salir adelante beneficiando a su único hijo que por ser madre soltera hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food sales.

loans.name: Abibata

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abibata S. was born on November 27, 1976 in Lomé. She is married to Mr. Watika Alegah who is a cook in a local restaurant. She sells cereals (millet, corn, sorghum, and soy) in the Agoè market. She began this business in 2002.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to purchase 4 sacks of millet, 3 sacks of corn, 3 sacks of sorghum, and 2 sacks of soy. These purchases will bolster her stock of cereals.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame S. Abibata est née le 27 novembre 1976 à Lomé. Elle s’est mariée à monsieur ALEGAH Watika qui est un cuisinier dans un restaurant de la place. Elle est revendeuse de céréales (Mil, Maïs, Sorgho, soja) dans le marché d’Agoè. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2002.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter quatre sacs de mil, 3 sacs de maïs, 3 sacs de sorgho et deux sacs de soja. Ces achats viendront augmenter son stock de céréales.

loans.use:
Purchase of cereals

Achat de céréales

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario A. is 47 years old. He lives with his wife Zunilda Duarte, who is 28 years old. They have four children, some of whom are school age. They own their home, where they have a small milking yard with 4 cows which produce 50 liters of milk a day.

Mario and his wife are very hard working. They wake up very early very day to milk the cows. Additionally, Mario has an ox cart that he uses to transport sugar cane to the sugar factory in the city of Benjamín Aceval, during the sugar cane harvest. He also uses the cart to deliver firewood to the nearby bakeries. He is a very hardworking man who makes a lot of sacrifices. He must take on all these jobs in order to support his family because the cost of living is higher very day and the money is not enough.

The loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle to deliver the milk.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal Kiva volunteer

El señor Mario Aguliar tiene 47 años de edad vive con su esposa la señora Zunilda Duarte de 28 años de edad, tienen cuatros hijos algunos ya en edad escolar y otros no. Tienen su casa propia en donde cuenta con un pequeño tambo con cuatro vacas lecheras de las que obtiene diariamente 50 litros de leche.

Don Mario y su esposa son muy sacrificados ya que muy temprano se levantan para el ordeñe diario de sus vacas.

Además el señor Mario cuenta con un carro estirado por dos bueyes con el que realiza transporte de caña de azúcar a la Azucarera de la Ciudad de Benjamín Aceval en periodo de zafra y ademas leñas a las panaderías de la zona. Es un hombre muy trabajador y sacrificado, y que debe realizar todas estas actividades para poder solventar los gastos de la familia, ya que la vida esta cada vez más cara y el dinero hoy día ya no alcanza.

El préstamo es para la compra de una moto para repartir su leche.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to deliver milk

loans.name: Phoung

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoung V. is a villager in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Prok Chan, is a cow breeder. They have three children, two of whom are attending school while the third is too young to work or study.

Even though Mrs. Phoung V. and her husband have different businesses, they still live in an old house and in poor conditions. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Phoung V. has decided to ask for a loan to build a new house for her household.

loans.use: to build a new house for her household in order to improve their living conditions

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima, married with one child aged 18, has operated her own shop since 2005. Working everyday from 7:30 a.m. to 10 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Halima is now requesting a loan to buy more commodities for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for the expansion of her business,

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey Mbangirensi is married with three children and he takes care of 3 brothers and sisters. He owns a retail shop in Kamwokya that has been operational for 8 years ever since his relocation from Rukungiri, his home town. With the small loans that he started with, he has been able to make a much bigger retail shop out of it, has built his own house in Kamwokya and another back home, as well as providing for his children, sisters, and brothers.

He has been repaying his loan and now needs another loan to be able to buy more sugar, salt, soap, and cooking oil for his shop so that it can bring in more profits. In the shop, he works with his wife but has a plan of opening up another shop for her to manage.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, soap, and cooking oil for his shop

loans.name: Noem

texts.en: Mrs. Noem S. is a 57-year-old villager in Pearaing Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a farmer who earns a living by cultivating rice on a small piece of land which she owns. To improve her living conditions, she is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Riel in order to buy a parcel of land to cultivate rice and thereby increase her rice revenue. Her husband's name is Mr. Yim Tha; he is a palm juice collector who gathers the juice to process into palm sugar or wine. Mrs. Noem S. has three children two of whom are firewood sellers while the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a parcel of land to cultivate rice

loans.name: Astrid

texts.es: Astrid tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace un año que se dedica a vender ropa, sus clientes son sus amistades y vecinos de confianza, así solo cubre pedidos, empezó este negocio por medio de un préstamo que le otorgaron que le fue muy beneficioso, ahora sigue manejando su capital con tendencia a crecer, para ello va de casa en casa ofreciendo sus prendas, así conoce a sus clientes, su proyecto es seguir creciendo y ampliar su mercadería, para Astrid el mejor regalo de su negocio es la amistad que entabla con sus clientes, la cual la empuja a seguir dedicándose a ello. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en los pagos correspondientes. Esta cantidad será el impulso para viajar a la ciudad de Lima, y comprar al por mayor, diversas prendas de vestir para dama.
texts.en:
Astrid is 45 years old, she lives with her husband and her 3 children. A year ago she began selling clothing, her customers are her friends and trusted neighbors, she alone takes requests, she began this business with the help of funding that she found was very beneficial, now she wants to grow the business more, she goes house to house selling her clothes, as she knows her customers, her intention is to keep growing and expanding her merchandise, for Astrid the best gift of her business is the engaging friendships she’s established with her customers, which inspires her to continue working hard for the business. This is the first time she’s asked for a loan with MFP, she commits to making payments on time. This amount will give her the chance to travel to the city of Lima and buy wholsale, diverse women’s clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Travel to the city of Lima to buy new clothing

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah K. is 42 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children. All are attending school in Nkawkaw in the Ashanti region of Ghana, where they stay. She is a crop farmer who produces food items such as maize and plantain. She has being farming for the past four years on five hectares of land in the village. In 2007, she was fortunately adjourned the best farmer in her town and she was given a prize. Hannah said initially it was very tough for her, until she met Sinapi, because she did not have adequate funds to buy chemicals to spray the farm. She produces in a large quantity and retails to food suppliers. She also sells at the market square during the market days.

With this loan, she wants to buy more farm supplies and employ more hands on her farm to achieve greater yields this year. In this way, she can supply to a large number of customers to increase her market size, hence, her profit margin. Hannah dreams of providing high quality education for her kids and this dream also depends on you to materialize. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mrs. Thy K. is a 41-year-old widow who now lives in Tnaut Bak village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She sells Khmer cakes and owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She is requesting a loan to buy a cow to start a cow-breeding business to increase her income. Mrs. Thy K. has four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while two are construction workers and the youngest attends the local school.

loans.use: To start a cow-breeding business.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena M. is a sixty-two-year-old married woman with eight children: fours sons and four daughters. She says all of her daughters are married and are into trading. Of her sons, Abena says only one is in the training college while some work as drivers or in other jobs. Abena’s husband is a retired carpenter.

Abena lives with her husband and some of their children in their own toiled-equipped house in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Berekum is a busy business centre about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Abena trades in maize. She buys maize directly from the farmers in the surrounding villages because it is most cost-effective. She sells it in the local market, mostly to food vendors. Abena has been in business for over twenty years. She says it is necessary to be in business to supplement the meager income their children give them. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure bags of maize in bulk.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth vive con sus 2 hijos y su madre en su casa propia. Hace 3 años decidió tener su propio negocio, bebido a su buena sazón eligió abrir un restaurante, el cual implementó en su casa, ya que está ubicada en una de las principales calles de su localidad por lo que garantiza sus ventas. Elizabeth ofrece almuerzo y cena, su trabajo empieza todas las mañanas, muy temprano, para comprar los ingredientes frescos para las comidas que ha de preparar, y es al medio día donde tiene muchos más clientes, necesitando la de sus hijos y su madre, quienes se encargan de atender a los clientes, y por la noche es la jornada de limpieza. Próximamente, Elizabeth está planeando ofrecer también desayunos por lo que tendrá que invertir más tiempo y dinero. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las promotoras de la unidad en su banco comunal, y para este nuevo ciclo se compromete, una vez más, a seguir  promoviendo ese valor. El dinero solicitado es para la compra de mesas y un estante para su restaurante, además de pintar el local para que tenga una mejor presencia.
texts.en:
Elizabeth lives with her two children and her mother in her own home. Three years ago, she decided to open her business, and due to her ability to cook, she chose to open a restaurant, which she started in her home. Now it is located on one of the main streets of her town, which guarantees her sales. Elizabeth offers lunch and dinner. Her work begins every morning very early when she buys fresh ingredients for the meals that she needs to prepare. At midday when she has many more clients, she needs her children and her mother to attend to the customers. At night she has to clean. Soon, Elizabeth plans to offer breakfast as well, which means she will have to invest more time and money. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is one of the promoters of unity in her communal bank, and in this ninth cycle of theirs, she will once more promote this value. The money requested will go towards purchasing tables and a shelf for her restaurant. She will also paint her location so it will look better.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To paint her location and purchase furniture

loans.name: Faamelea

texts.en: Faamelea T., 24, is married with two children.  She has two years of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public four days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala.  SPBD loans are Faamelea’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase tools & equipment, weed killer, fertilizer, and chemicals

loans.name: 41 - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
"Thanh N. Thị (281) is a 53-year-old woman living in the town of phường Nam Ngạn - thành phố Thanh Hoá. Thanh is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 041 - Nam Ngạn (17.08.041).

Thanh is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Thanh owns and operates a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving breakfast foods to customers in the local community. Thanh has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Thanh joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Thanh is requesting a loan for the first time from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 1,626,900 VND which will be used to renovate her business. The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Thanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Đỗ Thị Lan (284) is a 59 year-old woman who is requesting a 1,626,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. N. Thị Kiệm (282) is a 49 year-old woman who is requesting a 1,626,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3. Ngô Thị Tuyết (285) is a 41 year-old woman who is requesting a 1,626,901 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

4. N. Thị Cành (283) is a 63 year-old woman who is requesting a 1,626,902 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.


About Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


************************************************************

Thanh N. Thị (281) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở phường Nam Ngạn - thành phố Thanh Hoá. Thanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 041 - Nam Ngạn (17.08.041).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ phục vụ thức ăn sáng cho khách hàng trong cộng đồng địa phương. Thanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Thanh kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND. Vào 2009, Thanh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Thanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 1.626.900 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Đỗ Thị Lan (284) là 59 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2. N. Thị Kiệm (282) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. Ngô Thị Tuyết (285) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.901 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

4. N. Thị Cành (283) là 63 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.626.902 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva."

loans.use: To invest in renovating her business

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia C. A. vive en  Santa Tecla, dentro del departamento de La Libertad.
