Nadie nunca le enseño como cocinar, como administrar y mucho menos como montar un negocio, y es precisamente montar su propio negocio que junto a ser madre, eran sus sueños. Con perseverancia y fe en si misma y respaldo de su familia, montó hace ya 5 años una pequeña tienda en su propia casa, donde empezó vendiendo tortillas, y ahora vende toda clase de productos de uso diario. Curiosamente su única hija, Erica tiene también 5 añitos, lo que deja en claro el inmenso giro que Ana Cecilia ha dado en su vida, en tan solo media década. Ana solicita un préstamo, pues considera que es el tiempo justo para, apostar un poco más en su familia, y adquirir nueva mercadería para ampliar su tienda, pues la vida le ha enseñado, que el deseo acompañado del esfuerzo, pacientemente, da frutos.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia C. A. lives in Santa Tecla, in the department of La Libertad. No one ever taught her how to cook, how to manage, and much less how to run a business. Her dreams were precisely to have her own business with her mother. With perseverance and faith in herself and the support of her family, she has had a small store for five years in her own house, where she started selling tortillas. Now she sells all kinds of products that are used on a daily basis. Curiously, her only daughter, Erica, is also 5 years old, which clarifies the great turn that Ana Cecilia took in her life in only half a decade. Ana is requesting a loan, since she considers this to be the right time to bet a little more on her family and buy new merchandise to grow her store. As life has taught her, desire, accompanied with effort and patience, leads to results.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica D. is 38 years of age. She is single and has no children. She says she lives with her mother in a family house in a very busy commercial town called Goaso, in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Monica is a trader. She trades in groundnut paste. She buys bags of fresh groundnut from nearby farming communities, roasts it, sends it to the mill and sells the paste on a tabletop at the community market. She also supplies to food vendors in her community and treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Monica also sells other food items in addition to the groundnut paste. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure bags of groundnut in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of groundnuts in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim B.. Ibrahim is a local entrepreneur based in Magburaka town. Ibrahim owns a shop at the Magburaka town market where he sells cosmetics. This is not the first loan this entrepreneur has received from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have created a lot of meaningful impacts in the life and business of this entrepreneur. Having made his last loan repayment as a solidarity group member, he has now qualified for an individual loan. He is currently asking for a loan of SLL 3,000,000 to further strengthen his business. 

Ibrahim B. is now age thirty-five. He was born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and he and his wife run the business. Ibrahim and his wife have five children, four in secondary schools and one in primary school. Ibrahim has been a businessman for over six years now.

loans.use: To invest in his business.

loans.name: Yibem

texts.en:
Born on the 21st March 1957, Pa S. married and has six children, 2 of which are below the age of fifteen years. Pa S. and his family lives  in a two room’s apartment in the Baingo neighbor hood in Belo Sub division in the NWR of Cameroon.    
Due to circumstances beyond his control he hadn’t any privilege to have basic education nor learn a trade because his parents where poor, worst of it all was the dead of his parents when he was still very young which occurred due to lake of money to pay for medication. Also her cocoa plantation was destroyed by fire. Motivated by all these circumstances and the need to bring up a good family, he became a member of GHAPE in 2008. Since then, he has borrowed and successfully repaid his first loan and the profit of this loan has helped him sustain his life and that of the family and also cater for the school needs of his children

Given a loan he plans to buy  plantain suckers , clearing of farm land and the purchase of two goats . He will use the profit of this loan to continue to educate his children and build a good house for the family. He thinks his business will succeed because his farm produce are highly needed in the urban centers of Bamenda, Bafussam and Yaonde and he has enough grazing land. The first installment repayment shall be on the date of disbursement.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: purchase of plantain Suckers, clearing of farm ,digging of holes and the purchase of 2 goats.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary C. sells beef, pork and gari at Amissano in Elmina. Mary has received junior high school education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband works with zoomlion. Mary has been selling beef, pork and gari since 2006. She is responsible for paying school fees and bills. She is requesting a loan to buy more food stuff to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to further expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase more food stuffs

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria., pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 05 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Alto Alianza  Jr. Tribuna.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 6 años, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de cuyes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de cuyes y aves de corral.  Maria los vende en el mercado Unión y Dignidad de  Puno.

Su deseo es poner una granja de cuyes ya que nos dice que tiene buena demanda.

A ella le gustan la unidad en las socias y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the 3 de Mayo II (Third of May II) communal bank, located in the Puno district. She is 38 years old, married, with 5 children. She finished her school studies. She lives in the Alto Alianza Jr. Tribuna neighborhood. Maria has been working with the Manuela R. Movement for 6 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy guinea pigs. Now she needs a loan of 1200 soles to purchase guinea pigs and fowl. Maria sells these at the Union y Dignidad market in Puno. Her dream is to have a guinea pig farm, as there is high demand. She enjoys the unity and regularity of the [communal bank] meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase guinea pigs and fowl

loans.name: Maica Joy

texts.en:
Maica Joy T. is from the village of Dalapang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old. Maica Joy is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Maica Joy owns and operates a sari-sari, or general store. She sells soft drinks and daily use products in the local community. Maica Joy has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Maica Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maica Joy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maica Joy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies and for her children's tuition. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Zoidolith

texts.es:
Zoidolith es una persona dinámica y extrovertida, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera de  dos hijos menores de edad, ella ha sabido salir adelante sola. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas , su pequeño negocio funciona en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su papá quien le ayuda a atender en su negocio. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “las Heroínas”, desde hace 5 años. Su primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, monto que invirtió en la apertura de su negocio de venta de golosinas. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1400, comprará golosinas y también frutas. La meta de Zoidolith es poder llegar a tener una gran bodega bien surtida de productos.
texts.en:
Zoidolith is a dynamic and outgoing 31 year old single mother of two small children who has been a successful businesswoman. She sells candy. He small business is in her home and she relies on her father’s support to help take care of the business. She has been a part of the “Las Heroínas” (The Heroines) communal bank for 5 years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she invested in opening her candy business. With this loan for 1400 soles, she will buy candy and also fruit. Ziodolith’s goal is to be able to have a large well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy candy and fruit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicken feeds and treatment

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo es un hombre con un gran sentido del humor, tiene 40 años y es padre de 5 hijos. La agricultura es la actividad que desarrolla desde su infancia, actualmente siembra papas y arvejas en chacras alquiladas, donde por hectárea paga 1200 soles al año y algunas veces trabajaba tan solo para pagar el alquiler. Por tal motivo, Mateo se esfuerza mucho para sacar el máximo provecho de las tierras y para ello se ha propuesto sembrar gladiolos, los cuales le ha resultado muy rentables. El mes de octubre es una temporada donde hay gran demanda de flores y el precio sube, por ello trabaja junto a su esposa para la recolección y preparación de los ramos que transporta al mercado de flores de su ciudad, esta es una labor de mucho cuidado para no maltratar los pétalos. Mateo tiene la esperanza de que durante la última semana de octubre podrá obtener muy buenas ganancias, debido a la tradición en estos días de visitar los cementerios. Y con estas ganancias podrá solventar la educación de sus hijos.

Durante sus tres créditos anteriores con MFP, no tuvo dificultades de pago. Asimismo, su cargo como tesorero de su banco comunal lo viene cumpliendo responsablemente. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará semillas de arvejas e invertirá en el preparado de la tierra para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Mateo is a man with a great sense of humor; he is 40 years old and is the father of 5 children. He has been involved in agriculture since childhood. Currently, he is sowing potatoes and peas on a rented plot where he pays 1200 soles per hectare per year; at times he works just to pay the rent. Therefore, Matthew works very hard to make the most of the land and has set out to plant gladioli, which has proved very profitable. The month of October is a time when there is a great demand for flowers and the price rises, so he works with his wife to collect and prepare the bouquets that he then transports to the flower market in his city. He must work very carefully so as to avoid damaging the petals. Mateo is hoping that during the last week of October he will be able to have very good earnings, owing to the tradition in this area of visiting cemeteries during this time of year. With these earnings he will be able to afford to educate his children. During his 3 previous loans from MFP he had no difficulties making the payments. Also, he has carried out his position of treasurer with his communal bank very responsibly. With the money that he is currently requesting he will buy pea seeds and will invest in preparing the earth for the next harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To organize his burger and fruit selling business.

loans.name: Richard Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Richard Martínez se dedica arduamente a laborar para llevar el bienestar a su casa de habitación puesto que necesita mucho de él porque requiere el cambio del techo porque ha estado muy dañado y es de importancia realizar dicho cambio para así brindarle a sus hijos y esposa las condiciones necesarias para vivir.

El señor Richard ha solicitado el crédito para comprar los materiales de construcción y de esta manera dar lugar a la obra para que al final de todo, su familia pueda tener un techo digno donde habitar y juntos puedan salir adelante como familia.
texts.en:
Richard Martínez works very hard to provide wellbeing for his household. However, his house requires much from him because its roof, which is very damaged, needs to be replaced. It is important to do this so that his wife and children can have the proper living conditions. Richard is seeking financing to buy the building materials needed to provide his family with a proper home to live in so together they can get ahead as a family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building supplies.

loans.name: Aurelia Robertina

texts.es:
El banco comunal Santa Ana se encuentra ubicado en la parroquia del mismo nombre, esta localidad se encuentra a 18km de la ciudad de Cuenca siendo su principal actividad económica la agricultura, dentro de sus atractivos turísticos tenemos el cerro de Mama  Tepal  que constituye un excelente mirador natural con una vista panorámica de sus alrededores, de la ciudad de Cuenca, parte de Azogues y de los ríos Quingeo y Chordeleg, su gente  cálida y siempre amable reciben al turista nacional y extranjero haciéndolo sentir como en casa. 

La señora Aurelia F. es socia activa del banco comunal Santa Ana,  tiene 60 años y vive en la parroquia del mismo nombre de su banco comunal  junto a su esposo,  sus tres hijos son adultos  y tienen su propia familia,  viven en la misma casa pero en diferentes departamentos  fruto del esfuerzo y sacrificio de todos los miembros de la familia, su cónyuge es negociante de ganado.

 Aurelia se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, sacrifica cerdos  para preparar sus ricos platos típicos como el  chancho ornado, sancocho, morcillas, etc., lleva veinte años en éste  negocio y nos comenta que hay días buenos y malos pero siempre tiene un poco de ganancias, también cuenta con una pequeña tienda en su casa.

Trabaja con los préstamos que la fundación  otorga desde hace diez años invirtiendo en sus negocios, el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir en la compra de canchos para engordarlos y sacrificarlos para la elaboración de sus platos.

Su meta es  ayudar a sus hijos que se establezcan económicamente y no tengan que pasar necesidades.
texts.en:
The Santa Ana Communal Bank is located in the parish of the same name. The town is 18km from the city of Cuenca. The main economic activity is agriculture. This area is known for its tourist attractions, such as Tepal Mama Hill, which has an excellent natural vantage point. There are also panoramic views of the city of Cuenca and part of Azogues, as well as of the Quingeo and Chordeleg Rivers. The people welcome both foreign and domestics tourists. Their warmth and friendliness allow visitors to feel at home.

Sra. Aurelia F. is an active member of the Santa Ana Communal Bank. She is 60 years old and lives in Santa Ana Parish with her husband. Their three children are adults with their own families. They all live under the same roof but assume different responsibilities and make sacrifices for the other family members. Her husband works as a cattle dealer.

Aurelia prepares and sells food. She butchers her own pigs for making savory dishes such as roasted pork, sancocho, blood sausage, etc. Aurelia has been in this business for 20 years and says that there are both good days and bad, but she always manages to earn a little bit of profit. She also operates a small grocery store inside her home.

Aurelia has been working with the Foundation for 10 years and used her loans to invest in her businesses. This new loan from Fundación ESPOIR will be used to purchase pigs for fattening and slaughter. The meat will be used in the preparation of her dishes. Her goal is to help her children establish themselves financially so that they lack nothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs for use in her dishes

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Mrs. Severina A., 56 years of age, is married and is a resident of Bintana, Tangub City. She is blessed with five children and four of them are already married. Her husband, Rogelio, is a farmer with an average net income of not less than P2,000 a month.

To help her husband in supporting her family, Severina decided to engage in a sari-sari (variety) store and a hog-raising business. She started these businesses five years ago and now she earns an average net income of not less than P3,500 a month. This figure is very helpful to her family in meeting their daily needs.

Severina joined Paglaum MPC just a year ago because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006.

As member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) Program, she was able to obtain multiple loans because of her outstanding credit record. This time she is given the privilege of obtaining P14,000 as her 4th loan to add to the capital of her sari-sari store and hog-raising businesses.

The future income from this loan will be used for meeting their daily basic needs, loan repayments and savings for the future.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store and hog-raising business

loans.name: Rhiza

texts.en:
A newly recognized member of the PDP-LP, a microfinance program of PMPC is Mrs. Rhiza P.. She is 35 years of age, married and a resident of Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. Her husband is a farmer and a laborer. At this time the couple still do not have any child. As a micro-entrepreneur, she is engaged in selling “dayok”, a salted fish appetizer. She earns an average net income of 2,000 PHP. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC just this year as she is very much interested with the Coop's products and services. As a newly recognized member, she has requested a loan amount of 3,000 PHP to add the working capital of her existing business. She hopes that someday they will have a child to complete their family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her "Dayok" selling business

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario A. is from the village of Malintubuan. She is 46 years old. Rosario is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rosario owns and operates a business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rosario has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosario joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. 

Rosario is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which again will be used to invest in her business. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial es socia del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Marcial tiene 60 años y 7 hijos, Marcial junto a su esposa tienen un puesto en el mercado mayorista de frutas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende frutas variadas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Marcial necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de plátano.
Los sueños de Marcial son tener un restaurante en su casa y un hotel en la selva ayacuchana.
texts.en:
Marcial is a member of the communal bank Juanito. He is 60 with 7 children. He and his wife have a stand in the wholesale fruit market in the city of Ayacucho, where they sell various fruits, an activity that they do every day. Marcial needs a loan of $425 to invest in bananas. Marcial's dream is to have a restaurant in his home and a hotel in in the Ayachuchan jungle.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bananas

loans.name: Nhao

texts.en:
Mr. Nhao Y. is a villager who lives in Chen village, Takeo province. He is 51 years old and married with six children. One of the children is a seamstress in the garment factory, three are car wash laborers and two are students in the local school.
Mr. Nhao Y. and his wife, Mrs. Choeun Kil, are farmers who own a two-hectare field to grow rice. In this dry farming season, they now face a problem because they do not have enough financial resources to support their farm. Thus, Mr. Nhao Y. is now requesting 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to purchase fertilizer, rice seed, and fuel and to rent a plowing machine. His wife is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, rice seed, and fuel and rent a plowing machine

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria A. is a married woman who supports her family with her general store and pig-fattening businesses. She lives in Cabulakan, Barangay Maguiling, Sagay City, Negros Occidental, with her husband and their five adult children. Maria has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1997 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and pig fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 15,000. Maria is now borrowing Php 14,000 so that she can expand her general store and pig-fattening businesses. This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHp 12,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Maria aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy an additional piglet and to use as additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia S. is from the village of Owaon. She is 59 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Lilia owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2006, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Mrs. Pruch Sang Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of fourteen people who live in Prey Run village in Takeo province. All the members plan to use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Pruch S. is the village bank president selected by all the members. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Her husband is a battery charger in the local village. She is the mother of two children, one of whom helps with the farming while the other attends the local public school. Although they work hard, the family earns little income. So they want to start a new business, but do not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Pruch S. decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets and pig food for breeding pigs. Mrs. Pruch S. is busy with her rice field so her husband came instead of her to take out the loan.

loans.use: To buy some piglets and pig food for breeding pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying rice

loans.name: Tamana Dil Jan Group

texts.en:
Bibi J. is the daughter of M. D. and is the leader of Tamana Dil J. group. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is 43 and married. There are 7 members in her house and all of them benefit from the income her eldest son Saboor gets from selling different kinds of fruits and vegetables in his fresh fruits and vegetables shop.

Saboor would like to expand his business and buy more fruits and vegetables for his shop, especially those items which are not available and for which there is a lot of demand in the market, so his mother (Bibi J.) has requested a loan for him.

She would like to say that Kiva is an effective loans process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for shop

loans.name: Kely Ivet

texts.es:
Kely estudia contabilidad en la Universidad, es soltera, tiene 24 años y vive con sus padres, Kely vende cosméticos por catálogos, ropa a pedido, ganchos, joyas, todos estos productos son en base a pedidos que le realizan sus clientes, sus ventas son en mayor parte a crédito, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja regularmente dependiendo de sus pedidos.
Kely necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que invertirá en la compra de pantalones y polos.
El objetivo de Kely es implementar una tienda de ropa y culminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Kely is an accounting student at the university. She is single, twenty-four years old, and lives with her parents. Kely sells cosmetics by catalog, clothing on request, pins, and jewelery. She sells all of these products according to her customer's orders, mostly on credit. She gets most of her products in the city of Lima where she travels regularly depending on her orders. Kely needs a loan of 1,000 soles to invest in the purchase of shoes and polo shirts. Kely plans to open a clothing stO. and to finish her university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants and polo shirts.

loans.name: Raquel De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Raquel es una mujer con deseo de superación, tiene la edad de 29 años con dos hermosos hijos,  con ayuda de su esposo logro poner su pequeño negocio una pequeña librería que lleva poco tiempo de administrarla. 
En donde vende una variedad de productos para los estudiantes, hay días que las ventas están bajas pero no se deja de vender.
Su casa aun le falta mucho por hacer mejoras es por eso nace la iniciativa de poder trabajar para ayudar con los gastos básicos de agua, luz, y dar lo necesario a sus hijos para poder ahorrar y hacer las mejoras  de infraestructura.
Con este financiamiento comprara docenas de cuadernos, lapiceros, tijeras, reglas, comestiquera, bolsos y otros productos que se venden más para lograr equilibrar las ventas y obtener mejores resultado
texts.en:
Sra. Raquel is a woman who wishes to get ahead in life. She is 29 years old and has two beautiful children. With help from her husband she managed to open a small stationery store, a business that she has only been running for a short time. She sells a variety of products for students. There are days when she doesn’t make many sales but that doesn’t deter her. Raquel’s house still needs much work, and that’s the reason why she started her business: so she could help with basic expenses such as water, electricity, the children’s needs, and to be able to save and make some improvements to the house. With this loan she will buy notebooks, pens, scissors, rulers, makeup bags, purses etc. to increase sales and and provide a more regular income.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for her stationery store

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr: Madame Hawa M. est une institutrice de 39 ans qui habite à Daroukhane à Guediawaye. Elle fréquente  depuis plus de 3 ans l’école  Diambar  à Baye Laye. Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis mars 2004. Pendant les périodes  de vacance elle s’adonne aux activités  commerciales. Elle gère  une boutique  à son domicile qui est supervisée par sa fille pendant l’année  scolaire. Elle commercialise des denrées  alimentaires et autres produits divers. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs pour renforcer sa boutique en produits pour mieux rentabiliser son activité. Les bénéfices générés lui permettront d’aider son mari à supporter les charges de la famille et plus particulièrement d’assurer la scolarité de ses enfants .Elle est mère  de 6 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 1 et 18 ans.
texts.en:
Ms. Hawa M. is a 39-year-old teacher who lives in Daroukhane, in Guediawaye. She attended the Diambar School in Baye Laye for three years. She has been an associate of the Baye Laye credit association since March 2004. During vacation periods, she devotes herself to commercial work. She manages a store in her home that is supervised by her daughter during the school year. She sells foodstuffs and a variety of other goods. Hawa is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs for bolstering her store with goods in order to make her business more profitable. The profits generated will enable her to help her husband to support the family and especially to ensure her children's education. Hawa is the mother of six children, ranging from 1 to 18 years of age.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her working capital

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 50 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene dos hijas ya independizadas, vive en el caserío Tranca Sasape del distrito D. Mórrope, un distrito caracterizado por estar conformado por un pueblo central, lugar donD. se concentra el comercio, y un grupo D. caseríos conformados por pobladores D. condición humilD. que en su mayoría son agricultores, estos caseríos distan mucho entre sí. La zona pertenece a la provincia D. Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas D. hora y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Antonia se gana la vida vendiendo productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, este negocio es D. utilidad no sólo para ella sino que también lo es para sus vecinos, ya que la zona donD. vive se encuentra alejada del pueblo central, y sus vecinos no cuentan con el dinero suficiente para movilizarse hacia allá todos los dias y adquirir sus productos.

Adicionalmente ella cría animales menores en su vivienda y se vale D. ellos para percibir ingresos: cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona.

Antonia desea ampliar su bodega comprando ms artículos para ofrecerlos en venta a sus clientes, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y que dia a dia da lo mejor D. si para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Antonia is 50 years old, widowed, and has two daughters who are independent. She lives in the village of Tranca Sasape, a rural area in the district of Mórrope. This community is part of a central town where many businesses are located. The nearby villages are quite distant from one another and most of the residents are farmers who live under modest conditions. This area is part of Lambayeque province and located more than an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo.

Antonia earns a living by selling basic necessities and groceries from a store established in her home. This business is not only useful to her, but also to her neighbors since she lives in an area outsiD. of the central part of town. Her neighbors do not have enough money to travel that far every day to buy their products.

She also raises small animals at home and sells them in order to earn income. When the animals are fully developed, she offers them for sale to merchants who visit the area.

Antonia wants to expand her store by acquiring more products to sell to her customers. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to help accomplish this goal. She is a woman who works hard day after day in order to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Silvia Yaquelin

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia, se dedica a la comercialización de productos como té, flan, gelatinas, refrescos y otros, viene trabajando hace 10 años en el rubro de forma autónoma desde hace 4 años, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo tienen 4 hijos de los cuales 2 trabajan y estudian y los otros 2 solo estudian y dependen de sus padres, los productos que comercializa los trae de la ciudad de La Paz ya que la distribuidora con la que trabajaba la señora Silvia se mudo para esa ciudad y es desde allá que hace traer sus productos. La comercialización de sus productos los realiza en los mercados de La Ramada y Primavera teniendo clientas fijas, también distribuye sus productos en algunas otras provincias como Montero y Guarayos. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ya logro comprarse un terreno donde a construido su modesto hogar. En un futuro quiere que su negocio crezca mucho mas, para lo cual necesitara un vehículo mas grande, actualmente tiene una vagoneta Corolla en el cual distribuye todos sus productos con la ayuda de su esposo, el dinero del credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia como gelatina refrescos, sopas instantaneas, etc.
texts.en:
Silvia's work is selling products such as tea, flan, gelatines, soft drinks and others. She has worked in this field for 10 years, and independently for 4 years. Her husband supports her in her work. They have 4 children: two of them are both working and studying, and the other 2 are only studying and are dependent on their parents. They bring the products they sell from the city of La Paz, since the distributor Silvia works with moved that that city, and so she gets her products there. They sell their products at the markets of La Ramada and Primavera, where they have steady customers. They also distribute their products in other provinces, such as Montero and Guarayos. Through hard work and effort, Silvia has already been able to buy a piece of land where the family built their modest home. In the future, she wants her business to grow much more. For this, she needs a larger vehicle; she currently has a Corolla wagon, which she uses to distribute all of her products with her husband's help. She will use the funds from the loan to buy merchandise such as gelatine, soft drinks, instant soups, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise such as gelatine and soft drinks

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie D. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosemarie joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosemarie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Monica es socia del Banco Comunal Los Laureles y lo que mas le gusta son las charlas de cómo administrar su negocio.
Monica es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, Monica tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa en donde vende comida desde las 4 de la mañanas hasta la noche, su negocio esta ubicado en el paradero de una línea de transporte urbano, además vende golosinas y bebidas.
Monica solicita un préstamo de 900 soles para la compra de gaseosas y golosinas.
Los sueños de Monica son tener una tienda mayorista y comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo.
texts.en:
Monica is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Laureles”. What she enjoys most are the seminars that cover topics such as how to manage your business.

Monica is in a common law marriage and has two children. She has a small restaurant in her home where she sells food from 4am until nighttime. Her business is located at a bus stop for one of the city transportation lines. In addition, she sells candy and beverages.

Monica needs a loan of 900 PEN to buy sodas and candy. Her dreams include opening a wholesale store and buying a car that her husband can use for work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & candy

loans.name: Pou

texts.en: Pou C., 26, sells brooms at the local market in Takeo province. He has been selling brooms since 2006, and he is able to make US $3 of profit a day. His wife is a garment factory worker. Pou C. is asking for a loan of US $500 to increase his stock of brooms to sell.

loans.use: To sell brooms

loans.name: Marcia Karen

texts.es: La señora Marcia Karen V. B. V. vive con su menor hija de seis años de edad su domicilio se encuentra ubicada en calle Mercaderes Ica. La solicitante requiere del crédito para ampliar su negocio ya que sueña con tener una tienda más completa como un minimarkert, presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales no tiene deuda con entidades bancarias por tal mótivo se  le otorgará el crédito y de esta manera assumirá una nueva responsabilidad.
texts.en: Marcia Karen V. B. V. lives with her young daughter who is six years old. Her home is located on Mercaderes Ica street. Marcia is requesting a loan to expand her business; now that she has a dream of having a more well stocked store, similar to a mini-mart. She has good personal and work references. She does not have any bank debt. Therefore, the loan will allow her to take on a new responsibility.

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Silviya

texts.en:
Silviya is married with a teenage son, Chaba. She is a clothing vendor in the central marketplace of her home town of Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Silviya has been working in women’s clothing merchandise since 2005. She has invested 25,000 Grivnyas in inventory since she started her venture. Currently, her gross income is 15,000 Grivnyas. Her net profit is about 4,000 Grivnyas. 

Silviya is seeking a 6,000 Grivnya loan to purchase seasonal clothing items. She is a serious and prudent business owner. Sylvia’s pleasant manner and willingness to meet clients' needs, along with her assortment of clothing of different sizes, will help her to keep loyal clientele. Her responsibility, stable business growth and prompt payment record characterize Sylvia as a consistent and serious entrepreneur, capable of loan repayment.

loans.use: to increase her range of merchandise

loans.name: Maria Siriaca

texts.es:
Maria Siriaca de 64 años de edad su nucleo familiar esta conformado por 6 hijos todos mayores de edad 2 que trabajan en conjunto con ella y 4 que estan en el extranjero, ella es  habitante de colonia Los Laureles, labora en su pequeña unidad de producción en la que realiza actividades pecuarias con su pequeño inventario ganadero, como  tambien actividades agricolas, las que en conjunto funcionan como eje principal para el bien economico de su familia, sus hijos tambien colaboran enviandoles remesas para sus gastos y proyectos.  

Necesita este financiamiento para compra de ternero de desarrollo, logrando de esta manera aumentar su inventario ganadero y en el transcurso de un año poder vender animales de peso que generen mayores ingresos.   

En su comunidad la consideran como una persona progresiva, trabajadora y responsable,  espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA con el cual pretende cumplir con sus compromisos para saguir trabajando y por lo tanto hara que sus sueños se le hagan realidades.
texts.en:
Maria Siriaca is 64 years old. Her family consists of six grown children, two of whom work with her, and four of whom are abroad. She is a resident of the Los Laureles area, and works in a small production unit raising livestock. She also works in agriculture, which is the economic base for her family. Her children also cooperate, sending her remittances for her expenses and projects.

She needs this loan to purchase calves for raising. This way, she will increase her livestock inventory and in the course of a year, she will be able to sell heavy animals for a better income.

In her community, she is considered to be a progressive, hardworking, and responsible person. She hopes to benefit from a Kiva loan, which she promises to pay back, in order to continue working and make her dreams into realities.

loans.use: Purchase calves to raise

loans.name: Lucy Diana

texts.es:
Lucy de 22 años, tiene un taller de producción y reparación de zapatos. Vive con sus cinco hijos de 6, 5, 4, 3, 2 años en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes llamada suburbio de Guayaquil.  

El ex esposo le enseño como hacer zapatos y coserlos para que le ayude en el trabajo que el realizaba pero cuando se separo de él decidió independizarse. Ya tiene dos años trabajando independientemente produciendo y arreglando zapatos en la parte delantera de su casa. Su rutina del trabajo es iniciar las mañanas enviando a sus hijos a la escuela en el camino a casa comprar los materiales para hacer los zapatos y comienza a realizar los pedidos que los clientes les piden. Una de las dificultades para realizar su trabajo es que solo cuenta con una maquina y no tiene muchas opciones cuando se le daña. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar suelas, hilos para la elaboración de los zapatos. En el futuro quiere confeccionar y producir a una mayor cantidad los zapatos para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucy, age 22, has a workshop for making and repairing shoes.  She lives with her five children, ages 6, 5, 4, 3, and 2, in an urban zone.  This urban area is considered to be a suburb of Guayaquil and most of its inhabitants work as informal traders. 

Her ex-husband taught her how to make shoes and how to sew them.  He did this so that she could help him in his work.  When she separated from him she decided to become independent.  For two years she has been working independently making and fixing shoes in the front part of her house.

Her work routine is to start the morning by sending her children to school.  On the way home she buys the materials to make the shoes.  Then she works on the orders from her customers.  One of the difficulties in her work is that she only has one machine.  She does not have a lot of options when it is broken.

She wants to use the loan to buy soles and thread for making shoes.  In the future she wants to make and produce a greater quantity of shoes in order to give her children a better life.

loans.use: Soles and thread

loans.name: Maria Yeny

texts.es:
María Yeny tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene carga familiar. Reside junto a sus padres en el caserío La Ollerría, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope que se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

María cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, los cuales son de mucha utilidad ya que su comunidad se encuentra ubicada a varios kilómetros de distancia del pueblo de Mórrope. Paralelamente se encarga de ofrecer el servicio de peluquería entre los vecinos y vecinas de la zona. María se vale de estas actividades para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia en el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

María desea adquirir mas productos para poder implementar su bodega ya que debido a la cercanía de la temporada navideña sus ventas suelen aumentar, asimismo desea ampliar su peluquería con la compra de algunos implementos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Yeny is a 24-year-old single woman without children.  She lives with her parents in the town of La Ollerría, a rural zone in the district of Mórrope located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.  

María runs a small convenience store out of her home.  There, she offers her customers a diverse range of everyday products, basic necessities, and groceries, all of which are very useful since her community is located quite a few kilometers from the town of Mórrope.  She also works as a beautician for her neighbors in town.  María uses these jobs to pay for her personal expenses and to help her family with their daily expenses.  

María wants to acquire more products to stock her store since the holidays are approaching and her sales usually increase.  Also, she wants to expand her beauty salon by buying some hairdressing tools.  Therefore, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of $375.

loans.use: To acquire more products to stock her convenience store.

loans.name: Dolores Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal La California.
 
Aquí conversamos con la señora dolores, tiene 40 años de edad,  está casada  y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 10 años que estudian  en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es taxista. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal, le gusta por las reuniones porque en ellas ha hecho muchas  amigas.

Tiene un comedor en su casa, trabaja todos los días  menos el sabados, los  domingos ella prepara el delicioso caldo de gallina criolla y en los otros días varia de menú y prepara  todo tipo de platos entre los que más le piden  sus clientes es el delicioso caldo de pata y el seco de pescado picudo, trabaja desde las 8am hasta las 14h00 ya que solo prepara almuerzos, su hermana le ayuda en su negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar productos para la preparación de los alimentos como arroz, carne, gallinas, etc. Su sueño es  tener local bien arreglado.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'La California' community bank meet in the Nueva California district of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarind trees.

Here we speak with 40 year-old Dolores.  She is married and has two children aged 15 and 10.  They are studying at high school and elementary school.  Dolores' husband is a taxi driver.  This is the second loan cycle that Dolores has been through with her community bank.  She likes the meetings that the community bank have because she has made many friends there.

Dolores has an eatery in her home.  She works there every day except Saturdays.  On Sundays she prepares her delicious chicken stew and on other days she varies the menu and prepares all kinds of dishes.  One of the dishes her customers most request is her delicious duck stew and 'seco de pescado picudo' (fish stew).  She works from 8.00am to 2.00pm as she only prepares lunches.  Her sister helps her in her business.

This loan will be used to buy products for making meals such as rice, meat, chickens, etc.  Dolores' dream is to have smart premises.

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, chickens and food supplies in general

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a young man from Nablus who has a grocery store in the eastern part of the city. Yousef rented the store two years ago and since then the number of clients has increased rapidly. 

Yousef wants to increase the variety of goods he sells in the store, where he stands in the picture. He wants to include cleaning and hygiene products, Yousef received a $1,000 loan for this purpose. Yousef's store is located next to his house, which makes his brothers willing to help when he is out of the store.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods he sells

loans.name: 15 Dong Son Group

texts.en:
Bien N. T. (39) is a 55-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Bien is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 15 Dong Son (10.13.15 Dong Son).


Bien is married and has 2 adult children.  To making a living, Bien owns and operates a food stall business.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling pork products in the local community.  Bien has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Bien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Bien is requesting a loan for 4248000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding her business.  This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Bien from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Bien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  D. T. Bot (25) is a 58 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


2.  L. T. Sen (26) is a 22 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


3.  L. T. hanh (27) is a 34 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


4.  N. T. Mai (40) is a 55 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Bien N. T. (39) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Bien là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 15 Dong Son (10.13.15 Dong Son).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ thịt heo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Bien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Bien kiếm được khoảng 3000000 VND.  Vào 2010, Bien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Bien đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  D. T. Bot (25) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2.  L. T. Sen (26) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3.  L. T. hanh (27) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  N. T. Mai (40) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To expand food stall business

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia E. is from Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She is engaged in rice farming. She wants to buy more seeds and fertilizer. In that way, she will be able to grow her harvest and earn a better income for her family. She used to grow pigs in her backyard also, but had to focus on rice farming because of financial difficulties.

She is also considering using the loan money to start growing pigs again. She is interested in other income opportunities so that she can save more money for the educational expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Esi  Nstin Helena

texts.en: Esi Nstin Helena O. is married and has 16 dependents. Esi sells fruits and maize at Dompoase near Elmina, Cape Coast. She has been in this trade for twenty years. Her husband is a farmer. Esi uses her income to pay bills as a way of assisting her husband. Esi is requesting to use the loan to buy more bags of maize to sell and distribute to her growing clientele. She plans to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: To buy grains to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en:
Lhamsuren, 43, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her husband works as an engineer and both of her children attend a local secondary school. 

She has been operating a clothing-trading business since 1996. She rents a stall at an outdoor market, where she sells a variety of clothes, such as hats, scarves and other outerwear, depending on the seasons. 

She wants to expand her business and operate her own store in the future. She is a modest and hardworking person who says, "I would like to have my own store in the future." 

Lhamsuren is requesting a loan of 2,300,000 Mongolian tugriks to purchase spring and summer clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase spring and summer clothes

loans.name: Juana Jeannette

texts.es: Juana tiene una pulpería, es una persona my responsable por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita créditos. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, con mucho sacrificio ha logrado tener esta actividad. La comarca donde ella vive se llama tololar, la mayoría de sus clientes son amigos, vecinos y familiares, pues Juana siempre ha sido una persona carismática y bondadosa, tiene 4 hijos delo cuales tiene que hacerse cargo. Solicita este crédito para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, jugos, detergentes, sopas y pan.
texts.en:
Juana owns a grocery store.  She is a very responsible person and this is not the first time that she has requested a loan.  Juana's store is located in her home and she worked very hard to set up her business.  The region where Juana lives is called Tololar.  Most of her customers are friends, neighbors and family members.  Juana has always been a charismatic and kind person.  She has 4 children to take care of.

Juana is requesting this loan to buy basic grains, candies, soft drinks, juice, detergents, soup and bread.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, soft drinks, juice, detergents, soup and bread

loans.name: Maria Marleny

texts.es: Maria tiene 26 años de edad. Es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Morrope en la provincia de Lambayeque ubicado en el norte de Perú. Vive en la parte rural de este distrito.  Desde hace 3 años, cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Maria es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con clientela ya establecida. Desea surtirse su bodega con más mercadería para poder aumentar sus ventas e ingresos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Con sus ingresos, Maris puede seguir ayudando a sus padres con sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Maria is 26 years old, single and has no children. She lives in her parents' house in the district of Morrope in the province of Lambayeque, located in the north of Peru. She lives in the rural part of the district.

For three years, she has had a small grocery store in her home. There she offers diverse products of daily consumption for sale to her neighbors and customers from the area, including staple goods and groceries. Maria is very well known in the area and has an established clientele. She wants to stock her store with more merchandise so that she can increase her sales and income. For this reason, she has asked Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 2000 nuevo soles. With her income, Maria will be able to continue helping her parents with their family expenses.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with more products

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Huong T. L. D., 22 years old with 1 child, is living in Ngoc loi commune. One year after getting married, she opened a wood workshop that makes home equipment. Her business is running  well and creates a considerabL. income for her family.  Huong has been attending our credit program since 2006, She used her first loan of 1,900,000 Vietnamese dong to invest in buying  material. Year after year, her loans are bigger. For this new loan cycL., Huong  is requesting a loan of 7,630,000 Vietnamese dong to buy a new  cutting machine.

D. T. Ve  is 45 years old with 2 children. She is  running a wood workshop. She needs to have a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnamese dong to buy clothes.

Mui T. N. is 47 years old with 2 children. Being a farmer, she focuses on doing farming. She now  wants to have a loan of 5,886,000 Vietnamese dong to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

L. T. N. is 40 years old with 2 children. She is raising 200 chickens for eggs . She needs to have a loan of 5,886,000 Vietnamese dong to buy food for them.

Lua T. N. is 38 years old with 2 children. She is managing a vegetabL. shop in a local market. She needs  to have a loan of 5,886,000 Vietnamese dong to improve  her shop.

Man T. L. is 45 years old with 2 children. She is selling wood. She needs to have a loan of 5,886,000 Vietnamese dong to buy more products.

010103070005-4991

loans.use: to buy a new  cutting machine

loans.name: Ameh

texts.en: Ameh is a 44 years old, a married man from Jenin. He lives with his wife and four children, two of whom are in school. In 2005, he bought his own Moving Stroller that he sells products on. He hopes that with this loan he will be able to buy a refrigerator and products which will help him in increasing his income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and products which will help him in increasing his income.

loans.name: Sipora

texts.en:
From the town of Kitale in western Kenya, Sipora is a 58-year-old married mother of 11 children between the ages of 15 and 38, three of whom are currently attending school. She has been a farmer for 39 years, selling her milk, eggs, beans and vegetables to the local market.

Sipora has made a loan request of 62,400 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help her provide for the basic needs of her family. She, however, will face the challenge of fluctuation in the market prices of milk and diseases which will affect her production. Sipora hopes to acquire at least three high-yield dairy cows in the next five years.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He is from Lebanon. In 2010, he started his own business selling batteries for electronic devices such as radios, televisions and computers.  He works on a freelance basis, selling his products to customers and merchants located in different areas and villages. His wife works in a local company to provide the family with extra financial support in order to improve their standard of living. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his purchases. In the future, he is planning to open his own shop where he will display  electronics for sale and perform technology repairs.

loans.use: to increase his purchases.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca D. 54 años D. edad, vive en su casa con su esposo D. 72 años D. edad el cual ya es jubilado. Francisca lleva muchos años dedicándose al negocio. Gracias a su dedicación y disciplina ha logrado mantener activa una pequeña tienda dentro D. su hogar D. habitación. Francisca es una mujer ejemplar ya que a pesar D. su edad no se da por vencida y sigue luchando para mantener activo su negocio el cual le ha ayudado a sobrevivir durante muchos años. El lugar D. ubicación es muy estratégico se encuentra en una zona muy concurrida y D. fácil acceso por el momento cuanta con muchos clientes,  pero ella es una mujer emprendedora y quiere surtir su tiendita para que sea más atractiva y los cliente la prefieran mas. Esto la ha hecho tomar la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad D. artículos D. tienda como golosinas, detergentes, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aceite, papel, pan dulce y D. mas artículos que logren a traer a mas clientes. Con esto espera cumplir su sueño D. ver su tienda surtida y contar con muchos clientes que la prefieran por tener  todo lo necesario. A demás D. esta manera espera lograr mayores ganancias que le permitan acceder a una mejor vida.
texts.en: Francisca is 54 years old and lives with her husband, who is 72 years old and now retired.  For many years Francisca has run a business.  Thanks to her dedication and discipline, she has been able to maintain a small general store which she runs from her home.  She sets a great example,  never giving up,  she continues her struggle to run her business which has helped her survive for many years.     Her location is very strategic, with regular passers by and easy access.  Francisca has many clients for the moment, but she is an enterprising woman and she would like to stock her small store so that people find it attractive and prefer to shop there.     She's requesting a loan from Integral to purchase a variety of merchandise such as sodas, detergents, rice, sugar, beans, oil, paper, pastries and other items to help attract more customers.    With this investment, she hopes to get closer to her dream of seeing her store well stocked and visited by many customers who count on her.  In this way, Francisca hopes to increase her income,  enabling her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise for her general store, including sodas, detergents, sugar, rice, beans, oil, paper and bread.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 38-year-old, married woman with two children in school. She runs a butchery to earn a living. She works hard in her business so as to provide for her family. Mary has retained her business for four years thanks to her business management training from Faulu Kenya. Her dream is to own rental apartments. She has requested for 50,000 KES to buy chicken and milk.

loans.use: to buy chicken and milk

loans.name: Baghdasar

texts.ru:
Багдасару 40 лет, он живет в селе Гегамаван (Geghamavan), Севанской области, с женой и тремя детьми. Старший сын учится на первом курсе Севанского техникума, младщий сын и дочь учатся в средней школе. 
После полученя среднего образования Багдасар занялся животноводством. Жена и старший сын помогают Багдасару в животноводстве и благодаря совместным усилиям они разводят коров, телят и бычков. Полученное молоко Багдасар сдает перерабатывающим компаниям в пунктах приема, которые находятся в соседних селах. 
Багдасару необходим кредит на сумму в 1.050.000 драм для преобретения корма для скота. Данный кредит является седьмым кредитом, полученным Багдасаром из Нор Оризона (Nor Horizon).
texts.en: Baghdasar is forty years old and lives in the village of Geghamavan, Sevanskaya region, with his wife and three children. Baghdasar's oldest son is a freshman at Sevanskii college, his youngest son and daughter attend middle school. After receiving his primary education, Baghdasar began breeding cattle. He's assisted by his wife and oldest son; together, they grow cows, calves and bulls. They deliver milk to drop off points in local villages; the milk is later taken to refining plants for processing. Baghdasar is asking for a loan of 1,050,000 drams to purchase animal feed. This will his seventh credit from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 36 and has been involved farming for the last 10 years in his hometown of Nyamira, South Rift, Kenya. He produces and sells tea to the Kenya Tea Development Authority. He also produces maize and milk and sells these products to the local market. James is married and has 3 children, all of school going age. James also works as a driver.

James has made a loan request for 41,867 KES, from Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the improved business will help him in improving his family's living standards and educating his children. He adds that he would like to build a permanent house for his family and hopes this will happen.

James says stiff competition, especially for dairy, during high seasons remains a challenge.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Faysal

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 57 years old, married and has three children, all of whom work.

Faysal has owned a store since 2001, selling men’s clothing and accessories. He has good experience and he has a deep understanding of the local consumer. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to enlarge his store and to buy a generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to enlarge his store and to buy a generator.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira es socia del Banco comunal Paraiso, tiene 59 años, ella tiene un máquina de escribir y redacta documentos, tiene 2 hijos mayores, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en el techado de su casa, con mucha alegría recuerda cómo empezó a trabajar en el Registro Electoral de Ayacucho antes ella enmicaba documentos y vendía lapiceros, porta DNI y canguros, poco a poco fue progresando, ella está muy feliz en Finca porque le ha brindado todo lo que otra entidad financiera no podría, agradece por los préstamos recibidos, que le han permitido educar a sus hijos, ahora la meta que tiene es poder techar su casa el 2ª piso, para tener habitaciones para alquilar.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the Paraiso Communal Bank, and is 59 years old.  She has a typewriter and types up documents.  She has two grown sons.

She will invest the loan she is requesting in the roofing of her home.  

She remembers with much joy how she started working at the Electoral Register in Ayacucho in earlier times.  She laminated documents and sold pens, ID card holders, and fanny packs.  Bit by bit she made progress, and she is very happy with Finca, as they have provided everything that the other financial institution was not able to.  She is thankful for the loans she has received, which have allowed her to educate her children.  

Now her goal is to be able to put a roof on the second floor of her house, so as to have accommodation to rent out.

loans.use: to put a roof on her house.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 45 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with eight children.
Editha works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 3,000 Philippine Pesos to purchase one box of fish to sell.
Editha has been a member of PMPC since this year, 2011. In the future, Editha hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase one box of fish to sell

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Silvia Elizabeth tiene 46 años de edad es soltera tiene tres hijos vive con los hijos de veinteisiete, veintitres, diecisiete años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC 1º de mayo, se encuentra ubicada en la cdla 1º de mayo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos se dedican a labores comerciales.

Silvia se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos de belleza desde hace un año y medio.Las compras lo hace en Guayaquil y las vende en el Cantón Ventanas.El crédito lo solicita para comprar mercaderia nueva y poder ampliar el local  y aumentar, mejorar los ingresos económicos.

El sueño es  ampliar el negocio  y poderlo administrar sin ningún problema. Los desafios al que se enfrenta a diario es la competencia que se da entyre comerciantes.

En los momentos libres le gusta pasar con la familia y compartir momentos agradables.
texts.en:
Silvia Elizabeth, 46, is single and has three children, ages 27, 23 and 17 who live with her in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank "1º de mayo" is located in the residential community 1º de mayo which belongs to the Ventanas Canton.  Its members are merchants.

Silvia has been selling cosmetics for a year and a half.  She buys products in Guayaquil and sells them in the Ventanas Canton.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy new merchandise and expand her shop.  This way she will be able to increase her income.

Her dream is to grow the business and manage it without any problems.  Her main challenge is the daily competition that exists among merchants.

In her free time she enjoys taking walks with the family and sharing good times.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise and expand her shop.

loans.name: Kum

texts.en:
Mrs. Kum is a 51-year-old married woman who resides in the Steung Sen district in the Kompong Tom province. Mrs. Kum has operated a business as a local farmer since 1979 with her husband, Mr. Oun, who is 54 years old. Aside from cultivating rice, the couple also grows potatoes on their farmland for more profit. They typically earn an average of $8.7USD per day. 

They have three children, all of whom are single. Two of their children always help them work on the farm when they get some free time from school. In order to improve her business, Mrs. Kum would like to request some funds from Kiva to purchase a pumping machine and seeds. In the future, Mrs. Kum plans to enlarge her business and support all of her children so they can go to the university.

loans.use: to purchase a pumping machine and seeds.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Janet is a 48-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 12 years to 22 years. She describes herself as patient, ambitious, and polite. She operates a poultry farming business; she sells chickens to her customers. She has been involved in this business for eight years. 

Her business is located in a busy shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be seasonality and disease outbreaks which could kill the chickens leading to high losses. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more chickens. Her business goal is to grow her business and become the major supplier in Kakamega within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia is 60 years old; married with seven kids, and residing at Calabayan, Ozamis City, Philippines. Remegia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. Remegia engaged this type of business to help her husband in having a good return of income for her family. As a result, she was able to earn 2000 Php a month.

Remegia requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional product to resell. She's been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Remegia plans to improve their house so as to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase additional product to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Vilma tiene 36 años D. edad, es casada con dos hijos.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 20 años D. dedicarse al destazo D. vacas,  Vilma antes trabajaba para su papá quien le enseño la actividad, pero luego se independizo, por que ya conocía como se distribuía la carne y los clientes también la conocían.

Vilma compra las vacas, en una ciudad del oriente del país y tarda unas tres horas en llegar al lugar. Ella destaza dos vacas por semana y luego distribuye la carne y el hueso en las comunidades vecinas, se levanta a las 3:30 a.m. hasta terminar su mercadería.

Vilma solicita el préstamo, para comprar D. tres a cinco vacas, para destazarlas. Ella quiere aprovechar que en este momento que el precio D. las  vacas ha bajado y comprarlas a buen precio, D. esta manera obtendrá mejores ganancias y destazara tres vacas a la semana. Así ella asegurara la alimentación y la educación D. sus hijos.

Ella esta trabajando para tener un buen mercado, para ser la única vendedora D. carne en donD. vive y abarcar a más clientes. Para contar con suficientes ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma is 36 years old, married and has two children. 

She is a hardworking woman and for 20 years has worked butchering cows. Vilma used to work for her father, who taught her this activity. Later she became independent, because she knew how to distribute the meat and the customers knew her as well.
