Vilma buys the cows in a city in the eastern part of the country that takes three hours to reach. She butchers two cows a week and later distributes the meat and bones in neighboring communities. She gets up at 3:30 a.m. and works until her merchandise is gone.  

Vilma is asking for the loan to buy three to five cows to butcher. She wants to take advantage of the fact that at this time the price of cows has gone down and she can buy them at a good price. In this way she will earn more income and butcher three cows a week. In this way, she ensures feeding and educating her children. 

She is working to have a good demand and be the only meat seller where she lives and gain more customers. She does this to have enough income for her family.

loans.use: to buy from three to five cows to butcher.

loans.name: Allan Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Allan tiene 32 años y vive en la aldea de Villa Real en el municipio de Villanueva.  Es casado y su esposa Alba trabaja con él en el negocio. La pareja tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad.  

Desde pequeño don Allan ha trabajado en la soldadura. Su padre le enseñó el oficio. Hace 5 años, Allan dejó de ser futbolista para iniciar su propio taller de soldadura. Trabaja 5 horas al día en la construcción de portones, verjas, balcones y techos. 

Solicitó este crédito de L14,000 para surtir su taller con la compra de materiales. Espera ver crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Allan is 32 years old and lives in the village of Villa Real  in the Villanueva municipality.  He is married, and his wife Alba works with him in his business.  They have a two-year-old son.

Since he was young, Don Allan has worked as a solderer.  His father taught him the trade.  Five years ago, Allan left off from being a footballer to start his own soldering workshop.  He works five hours a day making gates, railings, balconies and roofs.

He requested this loan of L14,000 to stock up his workshop by purchasing materials.  He hopes to see his business grow.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his workshop.

loans.name: Angel Group

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Ottilia from Machipisa, Harare. She is married and has two children, as well as a dependent she is also looking after. Ottilia runs a retail business selling clothes for both adults and babies. The business has been in operation for two years. 

Ottilia says her main business challenges are competition, which is becoming very stiff, and lack of capital to purchase more inventory. Ottilia has requested a loan of 400 USD to pay for duty as most of her products are imported from countries like South Africa, Botswana, Mozambique, and Zambia. With the extra income generated as a result of this loan, she will be able to afford school fees for her three school-going children. In the future, Ottilia plans to operate from the Central Business District in Harare.

loans.use: To pay import duty and buy some clothes for resale

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
10 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé se unieron con las ganas de salir adelante, ayudarse y por medio del trabajo en conjunto superar las barreras que tienen. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y muy sacrificadas. Día a día se esfuerzan por darle a sus familias lo mejor y de esa forma evitar que pasen por privaciones.
Una de las miembros es la señora Nilsa, quien se dedica a la venta de helados. Ella tiene una buena clientela, ya que se dedica a esto hace ya un tiempo. Gracias a sus ventas ella puede ayudar en los gastos de la casa, y de esa manera hacer un poco más llevadero los gastos. Una de sus metas es poder tener un gran local donde pueda ofrecer más comodidad a sus clientes.
Nilsa solicita el crédito para la compra de helados de variados sabores, con los cuales podrá abastecerse y tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes, ya que se acerca la época de calor y desea tener un buen stock.
texts.en:
Ten women from the city of Caacupé have joined together because of their desire to move forward, help one another, and work together to overcome the barriers that they face. They are hardworking, enterprising, and self-sacrificing women. Day after day, they strive to provide the best for their families so that they can avoid hardships.

One of the members is Sra. Nilsa, who sells ice cream. She has a good customer base since she has already been in business for some time. Thanks to her sales, Nilsa is able to help with the household expenses, which makes dealing with the bills a little more bearable. One of her goals is to have a large shop where her customers can be more comfortable.

Nilsa is requesting a loan to buy ice cream in various flavors so that she can be well-stocked and have more variety to offer to her customers. The warm season is approaching, so she wants to have a large inventory.

loans.use: to buy ice cream in various flavors.

loans.name: Vrinia

texts.en:
Virinia is 28 years old, married to Andrew and they have one child. She has been running a fruits and vegetables stall for the last four years, earning a monthly income of KES 4,000.

She is applying for her third loan with KADET Ltd of KES 25,000. She will use the funds to purchase potatoes and tomatoes for the business. With the anticipated profits, she will educate her child and save.

Her hopes and dreams are to own a grocery store and become self-reliant.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegteables to sell

loans.name: Zaphania

texts.en:
Zaphania is 41 years old, married and supports his three children, aged 10, 8 and 6 years old. He runs a general shop in Kabarnet town and has been in operation for a period of eight years. He earns a monthly income of KES 34,000.

He has asked for a seventh loan of KES 85,000 from VisionFund Kenya, and hopes to use this amount to purchase cement to build a house for his family. 

With the profits he earns, he wishes to expand his house. His dream is to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase cement to build a house for his family.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is married and works hard to support her family. 

She has a general store business in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years now.

Epifania requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Epifania would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Né en 1979 à DIALAKOROBA, YAYA vit avec ses 2 enfants et son épouse  dans une  famille nucléaire à OUELESSEBOUGOU, dans la Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du MALI). 
YAYA n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente des intrants, semences, engrais.     
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, YAYA décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son premier prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  20 sacs d’engrais,  10 cartons d’herbicides. Il  s’approvisionne auprès des  grossistes à BAMAKO  et effectue ses ventes à Ouélessébougou au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à une clientèle mixte. 
YAYA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 140.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et s’investir dans les activités d’achat vente de produits agricole.

loans.use: Achat d’engrais et d’herbicides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.en:
Mr. S. Ayaovi was born in 1981 in Lomé in the county of the Golfe. He abandoned his schooling at the elementary level because of lack of support; very quickly he launched himself in the wood selling business (boards for carpentry work) to meet his own needs. Very good at management, he succeeds at drawing a profit.

He solicits a credit of $600 to buy a stock of boards from the zone of large productions in order to make a maximum profit. He could then open a store; have a permanent stock and retail wholesale. This will increase his income and his well-being.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Ayaovi est née en 1981 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe. Abandonnant ses études au cours primaire par manque de soutien, il s’est très vite lancé dans le commerce de bois (planches pour travaux de menuiserie) pour subvenir à ses besoins. Très doué en gestion, il arrive à rentabiliser ses activités. Il sollicite un crédit de $600 pour s’approvisionner dans les zones de grandes productions de planches en vue d’un bénéfice maximum. Il pourra ouvrir un magasin, avoir un stock permanent et vendre en gros. Ceci augmentera ses revenus en vue de son bien être.

loans.use: Open a store and have a wood inventory

loans.name: Justice Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame A. is a half-owner of J & K Engineering, a truck and automobile repair shop in Pokuase, just north of the city of Accra on the Achimota Highway. He has a wife and three children and lives in the neighboring town of Ofankor. As a child, Kwame walked two miles to school each day. He completed middle school, went on to a five-year engineering apprenticeship, and then worked three years at Big Joe Engineering in Ofankor before he struck out on his own.

In twelve years, J & K Engineering has grown to a thriving business with 11 apprentices and a contract to repair all of the DAF trucks and buses used by Ghana's Education Department. Kwame is on call to travel all over Ghana at a moment's notice, whenever there is a breakdown, and he is known for his ability to restore battered vehicles to better than new! Having to travel into Accra for spare parts is very time-consuming, and Kwame plans to use the $1,000 to purchase and maintain a parts inventory, reducing his time away from repairing vehicles and training his apprentices.

loans.use: The purchase of an inventory of spare parts

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en: Vitalyi owns and operates a computer center in Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine. A skilled computer expert and savvy entrepreneur, Vitalyi provides quality computer services with no direct competition. Lively and hard-working, Vitalyi opened his computer center two years ago to support his wife and son. Over that time, Vitalyi has received and successfully repaid three loans through Nadiya Ukraine. Currently, Vitalyi is seeking a loan of $800 to purchase some new computers. With the additional profits, Vitalyi plans to expand his business and eventually purchase newer, high-tech computers.

loans.use: Vitalyi would like to purchase new computers for his computer services center.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice was born in 1964 and is the mother of seven children. Her husband, Vincent, is unemployed, so he cannot provide basic needs for his family--particularly medications for his wife, who is suffering from health problems. This is why she joined GHAPE in 1999 and got a first loan of $30. Since then she has been able to manage and repay loan amounts up to $1200, with which she raised money to pay school fees for her children.

With a loan of $600, she plans to cultivate crops and fatten pigs, which she will sell. With the profit she makes, she can buy medication for herself and clothes for her family.

She plans to repay her loan in 24 months. The first installment repayment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs and feed, fertilizer

loans.name: Gloria Verónica

texts.es:
Gloria is a mother and enthusiastic woman who never misses a chance to live her life to the fullest, enjoying time with her husband and four children. Her children, now near the final years of schooling, attend a prestigious university in their small city and this effort to complete their educations requires a substantial economic investment. For this reason, three months ago Gloria decided to open a small general store with the help of a small loan.

Thanks in great part to her charisma, she has seen with much satisfaction a healthy growth in her business. This success serves to further motivate her to grow her enterprise to help improve her family’s quality of life. She has applied herself to learning about sales and customer service, and she is eager to apply her lessons to her business.

She is requesting a loan of $350USD to help increase the variety of products she carries in her store, and she commits herself to repay the funds in a timely manner. Let’s support Gloria’s efforts and hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria es una madre y mujer muy impetuosa que no pierde la oportunidad de vivir la vida sanamente disfrutando de la compañía de su esposo y de sus cuatro hijos, que se encuentran en la etapa final de su educación en una prestigiosa universidad de su pequeña ciudad y requiere de una fuerte inversión económica; es por ello que hace tres meses ha decidido abrir una bodega con un préstamo que le dieron y con el carisma que ella tiene observa con satisfacción el crecimiento y arraigo de su pequeña tienda ya que acuden a ella a cada hora en búsqueda de los artículos de primera necesidad que ofrece con mucha gentileza. Esto la llena de optimismo y muchas ganas para seguir incrementando sus esfuerzos a fin de consolidar su actividad y seguir incrementando el nivel de vida de su querida familia.Sus continuos deseos de mejora la han llevado a capacitarse en el tema de ventas y calidad de servicio y ahora está muy deseosa de aplicar lo que ha aprendido teniendo como referencia y campo de acción a su pequeña bodeguita. Para iniciar su interesante labor ha planeado incrementar sus artículos con el objetivo de poner en marcha sus proyectos; a razón de esto solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares que se compromete a reintegrarlos puntualmente. Apoyemos el ímpetu y el esfuerzo digno ganado con arduo trabajo de Doña Gloria.

loans.use: Purchase additional goods/products for general store.

loans.name: Susilawati

texts.en: Susilawati, 23 years old, is mother of a child aged 5. She has been running her business selling cosmetics on credit. She usually goes around to various places to sell them. She usually earns $10 per week and is requesting a loan of US$ 75 to expand her business, buy more goods to sell. Her husband, A., is a driver who earns a small income. Susilawati is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Mrs. Chuon P., 27, is married and has three little children. She works with her husband on a rice paddy growing rice crops and vegetables earning around $5 each day from selling their outputs to the people in a market. In order to raise her family’s income, Mrs. Chuon P. would like to use this loan to purchase mangoes from the growers and resell them for a good profit. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to purchase a mini-truck so that she will use to buy and carry a large quantity of seasonal fruits from everywhere in her area much faster and easier for sale.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes to sell

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Seven years ago, Alejandra began her business selling groceries from her house and, little by little, she stocked more items. At first, she only had sweets and now she has more products to sell. Thanks to this, she has more customers, who are in general children who buy candy.

“It is important that our customers always see that we are well stocked and that they do not have to look for another shop that is farther away from their home,” commented Alejandra. It is due to this that Alejandra is soliciting a credit of US $1,125 which she will repay in 6 months. With this money, Alejandra may move her business and family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 7 años que Alejandra comenzó con el negocio D. venta D. abarrotes en su casa y poco a poco le fue metiendo más cosas. En un inicio sólo tenía dulces y ahora ya tiene más productos que vender. Gracias a esto ya tiene más clientela que en general son niños los que más compran por las golosinas.

“Es importante que nuestros clientes siempre vean que esta bien surtido y que no tengan que ir a buscar a otras tienda que están mas lejos D. sus casas” comentó Alejandra. Es por eso que Alejandra está solicitando un crédito D. US $1,125 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo D. 6 meses y con este dinero Alejandra podrá sacar adelante a su negocio y a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Amina's Kasi Group

texts.en:
Amina is 32 years old. She is a single mother with a seven year old child. Amina owns a small cafe and is also a tailor. She started her business in 2000. Everyday, she works from 8:00 am to 6:30 pm.

She would like a loan to buy more items for her business and to build a house. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business selling charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business and to build house

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr:
Antoinette A. is from a disadvantaged family. She has always had the goal of getting out of her initially precarious situation. She is succeeding with the support of her husband and financial help from her parents in getting settled in her food selling business, which has experienced appreciable change. A very ambitious individual, she made contact with Alidé and is benefiting from a loan that she renewed twice. These days, her working capital went from 200,000 francs to 800,000 francs [$500 to $2,000 USD]; her booth, which was constructed of fragile materials in the beginning, has become an actual bar--restaurant, where customers benefit from the comfort. Ms. A. helps her husband a lot at home. With her profits, she has created two other sales outlets and has acquired a parcel of land. She was born around 1975 in Bonou in the wealthy county of Oueme. Married, she is the mother of three children, one of whom is in school. Of good character, she has come to request this fourth loan to position herself better in the competitive catering market in Benin.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Dame A. Antoinette est issue d’un milieu défavorisé. Elle a toujours eu pour objectif de sortir de sa situation initiale de précarité. Elle réussit avec l’appui de son mari et l’aide financière de ses parents à installer son activité de vente de nourriture qui connaît une évolution appréciable. Très ambitieuse, elle entre en contact avec ALIDé et bénéficie d’un crédit qu’elle renouvelle deux fois. Aujourd’hui, son fond de roulement est passé de 200 à 800 milles francs ; sa baraque construite en matériaux précaires au départ est devenue un véritable bar restaurant où la clientèle bénéficie d’un bon confort. Dame A. Antoinette aide beaucoup son mari au foyer. Avec son bénéfice, elle a créé deux autres postes de vente et acquis une parcelle. Elle est née vers 1975 à BONOU dans le riche département de l'OUEME. Mariée, elle est mère de 3 enfants dont 1 scolarisé. D'une bonne moralité, elle vient solliciter ce quatrième crédit pour mieux se positionner sur le marché concurrentiel de la restauration au Bénin.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep, 5 sacks of corn, 100 kg of cassava flour, and various condiments

loans.name: Facundo

texts.es:
In the district of Cinco Pinos in the city of Chinandea, Facundo M. has spent much time as a farmer and has thus been able to support his household, his wife and his children. It is important to emphasize that he needs to remodel his house immediately because he has already started the work but does not have the finances to complete it.

For this reason Facundo M. is seeking help through Ceprodel to take out a loan that will enable him to continue the remodeling on his house. He, his wife and his two children will all benefit from the loan from Ceprodel. It is also important to emphasize that the sooner he receives the loan the better because he needs to restart the work soon because winter is approaching quickly and his house needs to be perfectly completed before that time of year.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Cinco Pinos en la ciudad de Chinandega, el caballero Facundo M. se ha dedicado por mucho tiempo a la agricultura con el fin de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos. Es necesario destacar que la necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa es la reconstrucción inmediata de su casa de habitación debido a que esta labor ya la había iniciada pero al no contar con el recurso económico se vio en la labor de suspender dicha obra hasta obtener el ingreso.

Por este motivo es que el caballero Facundo M. se refugia en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita continuar con la obra de reconstrucción de su casa de habitación. Por medio del préstamo que Ceprodel le otorgue será beneficiado tanto el como su esposa y sus dos hijos. Es necesario destacar que mientras mas rápido logre obtener el crédito con mucha rapidez iniciará la labor de reconstrucción por el hecho de que pronto llega el invierno y al llegar esta estación del año, su casa debe de estar en perfectas condiciones.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to build an addition on his house

loans.name: Lesbia Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Lesbia lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood, and she is 54-years-old. She has three adult children who work and help to support the home. She is a widow. Her business is dressmaking. She has 14 years of experience and started by sewing clothing for her children and relatives.

The credit that you might offer her will go towards constructing a wall to have more security for her family. In the future, she would like to obtain a larger quantity of customers and make improvements on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Lesbia habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, tiene 54 años de edad, tiene tres hijos mayores que ya trabajan y que aportan al hogar, ella ya es viuda. Su negocio es corte y confección y tiene catorce años de experiencia y comenzó cociendo ropa para sus hijos y familiares.

Con el crédito que le otorguen es para construir un muro para tener mas seguridad para su familia. A futuro es obtener mayor cantidad de clientes, y mejorar su vivienda.

loans.use: To construct a lateral wall for her house

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah M. is the mother of two children and a resident of the Chanika neighborhood of Dar Es Salaam city. She has run a restaurant and bar for the last four years. The profits from her business have helped her put her children in school and look after her family. She needs a loan to help her expand her business and her family's income.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant

loans.name: Mercedes Huamani Caceres Group

texts.en:
Mercedes, Sonia and Balbina are members of the Florecer Village Bank. Mercedes is a twenty-three-year-old mother of one son; she sells candy at the entrance of a school and also operates a small kiosk where she sells fruit, candies and cancha, a traditional corn snack. Sonia is a forty-year-old single woman who lives with her father and brother; she has a store in their house where she sells groceries, vegetables and fruit. Lastly, Balbina is a thirty-eight-year-old mother of five children; she works with her husband and children at fabric artisan work such as tapestries, walkways, and so forth.

Each of these women is seeking a loan of 400 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in supplies necessary for their businesses (i.e., cookies, caramels, gums, sugar, rice, wool and dyes). All three women dream of expanding their businesses and exporting the products, eventually being able to own their own homes and their own cars.

loans.use: Mercedes, Sonia and Balbina need loans of 400 Peruvian Nuevos Soles each, to invest in cookies, caramels, gums, sugar, rice, wool and dyes.

loans.name: Khalad

texts.en:
Khalad is 23 years old. He is engaged but still not married. He lives with his own nuclear family. He is a carpenter, a business that he has been involved in for more than 8 years now. He is a good worker, and he employs 3 other workers, although his shop is small. He needs a bigger one but he hasn't been able to make his shop larger; for that he needs a loan.

So he has requested to take out an individual loan of US$ 1075 to complete his stock materials and change his shop to make it larger so as to make a good income and get ready for his wedding. He is sure that he can do it with this loan.

Khalad would like to thank AFSG and Kiva for making this opportunity possible for people of his country, especially for hard workers. He would like to grow his business day by day. Finally, he wants to thank all lenders around the world who help people.

loans.use: To complete his stock and enlarge his workshop

loans.name: Fatali

texts.en: Fatali Y. is a 45 year old man and is married with 2 children. His main activity is selling spare parts. He opened his shop in 1999 and, since that time, it has been the main financial source for his family. He applied for $1200 USD to diversify the products he sells, and increase his inventory.

loans.use: to diversify the products he sells and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Бакирова Саломат жительница города Вахдат.Возраст 38 лет, замужем,имеет 3 детей.Образование среднее,клиентка занимается производством  лепешек и самбусы.Она имеет небольшой цен на местном рынке города Вахдат.В данный момент очень вырос спрос на ее продукцию.Саломат решила увеличть производство хлебо-булочных изделий.Поэтому решила взять кредит сроком на 3 месяца.
texts.en:
Salomat B. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 38 years old, married, and has three children. She has a secondary education. This entrepreneur produces flatbread and sambusa (Tajik savory pastries), which she sells at a low price in the local Vahdat market. Recently demand for her products has been growing significantly, so Salomat decided to increase her production of baked goods using a 3-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour

loans.name: La-It

texts.en:
Mrs. La-it N., 27, lives in Prey Kla Thboung village in Takeo Province with her family. Her husband, Mr. Nen Rei, is a construction worker. Mrs. La-it N. is a mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the other two are too young to work or study.

She farms a plot of land to cultivate rice, but because her field is infertile soil her crop yield is poor. In order to deal this problem, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her field to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve her field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Omar Antonio

texts.es:
El negocio de carpintería por ser una actividad muy drástica requiere de mucho sobre esfuerzo por lo que se trabaja con grandes cantidades de madera pesada que debe ser trasladada de un lugar a otro.

A este negocio el caballero Omar Antonio R. se dedica en su propia casa de habitación donde es visitado por los clientes para elaborar roperos, puertas, sillas, etc. 

Hoy en día una vez más se ha apoyado de Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de madera para continuar con su actividad en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino en Managua.
texts.en:
The business of carpentry, being a extremely tough job, requires considerable force as one works with large quantities of heavy wood which must be moved from one location to another. Omar Antonio R. works in this business, from his own house where clients visit him to commission the fabrication of wardrobes, doors, chairs, etc. Today, he's been helped once more by Ceprodel to obtain a credit in order to purchase wood to continue his activity in the municipality of Ciudad Sandino in Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de madera

loans.name: Houleye

texts.fr:
Madame Houleye D. a 47 ans, veuve et vit dans la maison de son defunt époux avec ses enfants à Sanoubougou II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente d’huile alimentaire il y a maintenant dix (10) ans. Elle mène son activité a la maison et au marché de son quartier où elle dispose une place.
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle decida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq (5) ans. Après 4 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association JEKAFO de Sanoubougou II), elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel commerçant (PIC)  tous correctement remboursés. Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 2 fûts d’huile alimentaire au niveau des différentes  huiléries de place avant de les revendre en détail.  Madame Houleye D. vend ses marchandises au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée de  femmes. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Madam Houleye D. is 47 years old, a widow, and lives in the house of her deceased husband with her children in Sanoubougou II, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She got started in this commerce selling vegetable oil ten years ago. She works at home and at the marketplace in her district where she has a spot.

To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, she decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. After four solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid, with a women's association in her district (Association JEKAFO de Sanoubougou II) , she is now on her fifth PIC (an individual merchant loan).

She intends to use this loan to buy two barrels of vegetable oil from different oil suppliers locally and then resell them retail. Ms. D. sells her goods to customers composed of women, cash or credit accepted. She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA, which will be used essentially to help cover family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetable oil

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Mr. Thoa B. lives in Chan village in Kampong Cham province. At the age of 55, he is the father of two children. One child is a teacher in the local school while another is attending the local school. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Heang Noeun, breeds pigs and chickens. Even though they work hard, they still earn very little income and are unable to improve their living standards. Thus, Mr. Thoa B. is asking for a loan to buy a hectare of land to cultivate rice. 

His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy a hectare of land to cultivate rice

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos R. U. tiene 31 años, esta casado, y tiene 2 hijos. Todos los hijos estudian. La actividad económica de Don Juan es la venta de mercadería en general como: como: pantalones, camisa, faldas y ropa para niños, además de poseer este negocio posee otro como es el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 7 años que tiene de poseer este negocio. Los propósitos de Don Juan para su negocio son de mantener su negocio con los productos que sus clientes soliciten y con el negocio de su taxi es brindarles a sus clientes la eficiencia que ellos solicitan. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de ropa para niños, adultos, cosméticos y además proporcionarle mejoras a su taxi. Sus deseos son de obtener otro taxi para seguirle proporcionando a su familia el pan de cada día. La cantidad que necesita es de  C$ 19.500 córdobas a un plazo de 24 meses.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos R. U. is 31 years-old, married, and has two children who are in school. He sells general merchandise such as pants, shirts, skirts, and children's clothing, a business which he has run for over 7 years. Additionally, he also works as a taxicab driver. Juan wants to continue to provide the highest quality products (through his clothing business) and the best service (through his taxicab business) to his customers. Juan is requesting a loan of C$ 19,500 cordobas (that he will repay in 24 months) to purchase clothing (children's and adult's) and cosmetics, and to make needed repairs to his taxicab. He dreams of owning another taxicab so he can continue to provide for his family's daily needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing (children's and adult's) and cosmetics, and to make needed repairs to his taxicab

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal “Urbano Central”, del Barrio Central, en el distrito de Copani, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno; ella tiene 42 años de edad, ella es conviviente, y tiene a su cuidado de 02 hijos. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 05 años, ella se dedica a la pesca artesanal y a la compra y venta de pescado, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de mercadería (pescado) para su venta en las ferias de Yunguyo.  
Ella desea continuar con este negocio, por ello viene solicitando un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con dicho préstamo podrá adquirir mas pescado de lago al por mayor (Carachi, Trucha, Ispi, etc.) el mismo que le brindará buenos ingresos para ella y su familia; su anhelo es comprarse un Bote para poder pescar con tranquilidad, puesto que a la fecha viene alquilando esta movilidad lo que no l permite obtener las ganancias esperadas.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank “Urbano Central” [“Central Urban”], of the Central neighborhood, province of Yunguyo, in the Puno department. She is 42 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children under her care. Yolanda has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 5 years; she dedicates herself to traditional fishing, and the purchase and sale of fish. Her first loan was of 300 PEN, an amount that she invested in the purchase of merchandise (fish) to sell in the Yunguyo Market. She wishes to continue with this business, and because of that is requesting a new loan of 1,000 PEN, which she pledges to pay in 4 quotas. With this loan she will be able to acquire more wholesale lake fish (carachi, trout, ispi, etc). This purchase will provide a good income for her and her family; her greatest wish is to buy a boat to fish peacefully, given that currently she is renting a boat which does not allow her to obtain the desired profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire more wholesale lake fish (carachi, trout, ispi, etc).

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: A wooden house located in Banteay Meanchey Province belongs to Mrs. S. and the other four family members. She uses an old bicycle to transport vegetables to the local market to sell. She can make an income of $3 a day to feed her three teenage children who are studying in the local public school. Her husband Pak, age 39, works as a local farmer. Recently, S.'s business is not running smoothly because her bicycle often breaks down and she can't earn much income. To solve the problem, she needs a loan of $600. With the loan plus her savings, she can buy a motorcycle so she can use it for business transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Mrs. Elsa L. is 46 years old and married. She lives in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She has been an active and good member of Paglaum MPC for four years. The couple manages their business of vending vegetables, which is located in their house. Her customers are their neighbors and people in the neighboring barangay. Her business is still in progress. She hopes she can expand her business soon.

loans.use: To buy stocks of vegetables and spices

loans.name: William Fernando

texts.es: Don William Fernando Martínez Cortes, casado y tiene dos hijos, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino se desempeña como conductor en una empresa privada desde hace dos años, su esposa trabaja como costurera por cuenta propia en su domicilio. Unos de los proyectos para veneficio de su hogar es la culminación de su vivienda; colocando ladrillos en la sala y realizar unas divisiones en los cuartos, brindándoles comodidad a su esposa e hijos. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic ha realizado cambios en su hogar y espera seguir haciendo las mejora para tener una casa digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. William Fernando Martínez Cortes, married with two children, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. He has served as a driver in a private business for twelve years, and his wife is self-employed and works as a seamstress at home. Some of the projects that will benefit and complete their home are laying bricks in the living room and making divisions for the rooms, providing comfort for his wife and children. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic he has made many changes to their house and he expects to continue making improvements in order to have a decent home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to construct divisions and to lay bricks in his home.

loans.name: Deizy

texts.es: Deizy tiene 42 años, vive con su pareja y sus hijos Gracie de 17 años, Junior de 15 años y Ana de 14 en su casa propia. Desde hace un año se viene dedicando a la venta de ropa por pedido, ofrece su mercadería a sus vecinos, y es así como logra juntar sus ingresos para los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le da libertad de realizarlo cuando ella disponga, y a su vez dedicarle tiempo a las cosas de su hogar. Pero no todo es bueno, ya que al  ofrecer sus prendas muchas veces algunos clientes no le pagan a tiempo, por lo que tiene que ir a cobrar casa por casa, siendo esto muy tedioso, pero lo bueno es que esos casos son mínimos y que el negocio le arroja buenos ingresos, siendo eso lo más importante. Es por ello que Deizy le pone tanto empeño y tiempo, sabiendo que de lo que haga hoy dependerá su futuro. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y sabe que será muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará una vitrina para exhibir sus prendas en su casa, también arreglará un espacio de su vivienda para instalar un pequeño bazar, que es lo que más quiere.
texts.en:
Deizy is 42; she lives with her life partner and their children, Gracie (17), Junior (15) and Ana (14), in a house which they own. She has been selling clothes to order for a year. She sells to her neighbors, enabling her to supplement the family income to cover household expenses and pay for the children's education.

She likes the work a lot since she can do it in her free time while also attending to her chores in the house. However, she has some problems with customers not paying on time and has to go collecting debts door to door, which is very tedious. Fortunately, these cases are a small minority and the business is profitable, which is what matters.

Deizy works hard and devotes a lot of time to the business since she knows that her future depends on what she does today. This is her first loan from MFP, and she knows she must pay the installments punctually.

The money will be used to buy a glass cabinet to display garments in her house, and to outfit a small shop in the house.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a display cabinet and outfit a shop in her house

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Carmen Elena C. D. C. D. 30 años D. edad, resiD. en Lourdes Colón junto a su esposo y dos pequeños hijos. Ella como toda madre trabajadora, trabaja día a día vendiendo perfumes para hombres y mujeres y D. esta manera ella contribuye con su esposo a los gastos del hogar. Carmen Elena solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar más mercadería, ya que muchos productos son pedidos por las clientas, los cuales ella no los posee, y con este préstamo ella obtendrá el dinero para poder comprarlos y luego venderlos a sus clientas.
texts.en:
Carmen Elena C. D. C. is 30. She lives in Lourdes Colón with her husband and two small children. She, like all working mothers, works every day. She sells men’s and women’s perfume. This way she can contribute, along with her husband, to the household expenses. Carmen Elena is asking for a loan to be able to buy more merchandise. She has orders from her customers for a lot of products that she does not have. She will use the loan to buy these products and sell them to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Aydee Mery

texts.es:
Aydee  vive en la calle 14  de la zona Villa Alemania en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Por circunstancias de la vida, quedo sola a cargo de su hijos, ya que el esposo hizo abandono del hogar hace bastante tiempo, desde entonces se convirtió en madre y padre de sus cuatro hijos, de los cuales la mayor egresó de la secundaria el pasado año.

Actualmente trabaja en un sindicato de transporte urbano, como control de 
Asistencia, rutas de las movilidades y los conductores.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de una computadora de segunda mano, para el estudio de sus hijos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Aydee lives on calle 14 in the Villa Alemania zone of the city of El Alto.
Due to life’s circumstances, she has been left to look after her children on her own. Her husband left them a while ago and since then she has become a mother and father to her four children, the eldest of whom graduated from high school last year.
She currently works for an urban transport union monitoring the transportation routes and the attendance of the conductors.
She will use this loan to get a secondhand computer for her children’s studies. This is her first loan with Impro- an evaluation determined that she qualified to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Petrona Virginia

texts.es: Petrona Virginia E. Hernández tiene la edad de 53 años, es una mujer viuda. Tiene 2 hijas a su cargo, ellas le ayudan a salir adelante con su negocio. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio, Petrona es una mujer muy luchadora, por lo que empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia por lo que tenía que mantener a sus hijas y es por medio de su humilde actividad económica que ha logrado proporcionarles a sus hijas la oportunidad de brindarles estudios. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos para su pulpería como arroz, aceite, golosinas, refrescos naturales y jugos. Su mayor deseo es que sus hijas logren prepararse.
texts.en:
Petrona Virginia E. Hernández is 53 years old. She is widowed and has 2 daughters who help with her business. For 30 years, she has operated a small grocery store. Petrona is a fighter – she began working for herself in order to support her daughters and provide them an opportunity to receive an education.

She is requesting a loan to buy products for her grocery store, such as rice, cooking oil, candy, soft drinks and juices. Her greatest desire is to prepare her daughters for success.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto P. S. tiene 42 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la compra y venta de carbón y leña. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, es un hombre muy trabajador y con mucho esfuerzo logra sacar adelante a sus hijos. Carlos recorre todos los días diferentes calles ofreciendo carbón y leña. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante. El es un hombre muy humilde y disfruta mucho de su trabajo ya que la mayoría de sus clientes dicen que es una persona muy alegre. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo ara la compra de carbón, leña y además darle mantenimiento a su medio de transporte. Sus deseos son que sus hijos estudien y se preparen lo suficiente para que no tengan otras oportunidades
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto P. S., aged 42, is married and has two dependent children. He has been a trader of coal and firewood for more than seven years. He is a very hard-working man and with a lot of effort he succeeds in helping his children to progress. Carlos is a hawking trader who travels every day through various streets and offers his coal and firewood for sale. He is a very humble man and enjoys his work a lot because most customers appreciate his cheerfulness.

Carlos applies for a loan to expand his working capital. He will buy coal and firewood, as well as repair his cart. His wish is that his children study and get ready for life as they have no alternatives.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Daria

texts.en:
Daria L., 59 years old, owns a piggery business in Tagbilaran, Bohol. She has five children (33 years old is the eldest) and a supportive husband who helps her manage their business. She said that she wants to increase the size of her barn so that she will be able to earn bigger income for the whole family's needs.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 9,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy piglets and feed. With this loan that she hopes to receive from CEVI, she will have the chance to grow her business and income.

She is very happy with the services of CEVI. She likes CEVI so much because it charges a low interest rate-- 2% a month. Aside from that, CEVI provides insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: to buy 10 piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy yams and corn

loans.name: Abilio Guillermo

texts.es: El señor Abilio B. de 54 años de edad, casado, habita en el barrio Hialeah, su esposa es ama de casa, tiene un hijo, trabaja en una empresa privada como conductor desde hace trece años teniendo una estabilidad laboral, tiene como planes seguir la remodelación de su casa. Don Abilio, hombre humilde y trabajador ha estado dentro de la empresa en otras areas, demostrándole a su jefe la fidelidad y confianza que depositan en él. Este es su quinto ciclo en  Afodenic que invertirá en la compra de  materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques y arena para la construcción de una verja para su casa para seguridad de su familia. Agradece ala institución por la oportunidad de hacer las mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Abilio B., 54 years old, married, lives in the Hialeah neighborhood. His wife is a homemaker, and he has one child. He has worked as a driver for a private company for the last thirteen years and has job security. His plans are to continue remodeling and building his house. Abilio is a humble man and hard working. He has worked in other areas of the company, demonstrating to his boss the faithfulness and confidence the company places in him. This is his fifth cylce in Afodenic, which he will invest in the purchase of construction materials such as: cement, iron, blocks and sand to be used in the construction of a wrought-iron gate for his house for the safety of his family safe. He thanks the institution for the opportunity to make the improvements to his dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to install wrought-iron gates

loans.name: Qochasaywas Group

texts.es:
Estos son los socios del banco comunal denominado “QOCHASAYWAS”; este nombre es de origen quechua y significa traducido al español (laguna encantada); nuestros miembros son 11 socios, todos ellos muy amigables y emprendedores.

Nuestros socios alternas sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ellos tiene diferentes negocios como venta de comidas, pan, venta de productos de belleza, cuidado de niños particularmente, mecánico, peluquero, venta de ropa para turismo, artesanía. Todos los miembros del banco comunal son nuevos socios y están deseosos de invertir el préstamo en sus nuevos negocios y de este modo hacerlos crecer, esto ayudará a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hogares y les dará mayor producción y mayor ganancia.

Nuestros socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Invertir en sus diferentes negocios.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora D. is a hardworking mother and a good entrepreneur who is always looking for a great opportunity to earn more for her family and for the education of her children. She lives in the village of Prk Paraiso, Brgy Taloc, Bago City, Negros Occidental. She is 56 years old and married. Her husband, Rafael D., manages their 1.25-hectare rice farm. He also helps Leonora run their other business ventures. Together, Rafael and Leonora have 5 children, 3 of whom are already married. The other 2 are still single and live at home. Leonora has 5 grandchildren. 

Leonora buys and sells rice because rice production is prevalent in their community. Her trading business was earning her a good income, but when the opportunity to join NWTF-Project Dungganon came, she did not hesitate, and expanded her business activities to include pig fattening in 2001. Leonora treated this new business as a way to secure additional income. Every time she sold a hog, she would save a portion of the proceeds in her emergency fund. She also used the income to pay for her children's tuition. With the added income from hog-raising she was able to earn an average monthly income of 30,000 Philippine pesos, or about $630 US, good income that provides a comfortable living for her family.

Because Leonora is a responsible businesswoman, repays loans well, is very responsible and has good leadership qualities, she was elected as a center chief by other members of NWTF-PD. She wants to prove and teach other members that being a hardworking person helps improve one's standing in life. Even with the added responsibilities, Leonora continues to do well in her business activities and is a good center chief.

For her previous loan she borrowed 25,000 pesos, or about $525, as additional capital for her rice trading business and pig fattening venture. The loan was paid in weekly installments and was repaid without delay. For this loan, Leonora's 16th, she is requesting 29,000 pesos, or about $625, to be used as additional capital for her businesses. Income resulting from the loan will be used for the education of her children and daily household expenses.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: additional capital for her pig fattening & rice business

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL MUJERES 
EMPRENDEDORAS D. MICAELA BASTIDAS

Mujeres emprendedoras D. Micaela Bastidas se formo en el año 1995, aun permanece porque las socios son solidarias, responsables, puntuales además D. ser buenos amigos.
El mercado donD. tienen su negocio los socios,  cumple 23 años,  el mismo tiempo que ellos venden ahí. Reyna A. tiene un puesto D. venta D. ropa, ella empezó ambulatoriamente hasta que pudo comprarse un puesto en el mercado, donD. pueD. exhibir sus prendas. En la sección D. carnes venden Delia I. y Natividad V. donD. ofrecen  carne nacional e importada que lo traen D. un camal del mismo distrito.
Luis Auqui se dedica a la venta D. aves. Nuestras socias Lili A. y Lucila B.  se dedican a la venta D. calzado en el centro D. lima, nos comentan que tienen mucha competencia pero aun así pueden vender sus productos. Los demás socios tienen otros negocios tales como: venta D. verduras, mueblería, fotocopiadora.
Ellos solicitan el crédito para seguir mejorando sus negocios y tener mejores ingresos. Todos tienen un objetivo, ver a sus familias con una mejor condición D. vida.
texts.en:
Enterprising Women of the Micaela Bastidas Communal Bank Enterprising Women of Micaela Bastidas formed in 1995. It still exists because the members are very supportive, responsible, and punctual. They are also good friends. The market where the members have their businesses is 23 years old, the same amount of time they have sold there. Reyna A. has a stand selling clothes. She started as a street vendor until she could buy a stand to exhibit her clothes in the market. Delia I. and Natividad V. sell in the meat section. They offer national and imported meat, which they bring from a slaughterhouse in the same district. Luis Auqui sells birds. Lili A. and Lucila B. sell footwear in the center of Lima. They tell us that they have a lot of competition. Even so, they are able to sell their products. The rest of the members have other businesses like selling vegetables, furniture shop, and a photocopier. They are asking for the loan to keep improving their businesses and to have better incomes. All of them have one objective, to see their families with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of products

loans.name: Jazmin Group

texts.en: The Jazmin committee is in its second cycle. It is maD. up of very hardworking women, many of whom are single mothers. In this group, the loans are used for the individual businesses of the members, which incluD.: the recycling of paper, coal and plastics, buying ingredients for baked goods and pastries, such as the Paraguayan national “empanada”, selling fruits and vegetables, or cosmetics such as lipsticks, creams, shampoos and deodorants, or candy, or fabric for tailoring clothing, or bedsheets and towels, or skirts and shorts, or herbs and remedies, or sausages and sweetmeats. They work hard to help each other and support one another, and organize food fairs and raffles to raise money.

loans.use: capital for various businesses

loans.name: Laiy

texts.en:
Laiy KongC. is 26 years old and lives with his parents in the Battambang province. He is a single and a home construction worker. On average, he makes $3 of profit a day, and his mother sells fish and vegetables at the local market making $4 of profit a day.

Laiy is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work.  This will reduce his transportation costs.  (Laiy's mother is pictured.)

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Digna Margarita

texts.es:
El banco comunal Atenas se formó con  mujeres que  tienen un gran vinculo de amistad y formaron  un buen equipo de  trabajo,  las socias viven en diferentes  partes de la urbe cuencana, está cuidad está  ubicada en la zona austral y es la capital de la provincia del Azuay, esta  localidad es muy reconocida por sus escritores y artistas, su belleza arquitectónica, los cuatro ríos que bañan la ciudad,  las hábiles manos de sus artesanos, su suculenta gastronomía y su gente cálida atraen al turista nacional y extranjero.

Digna  B. vive en  la parroquia  Carmen de Sidcay,  tiene 48 años de edad y se encuentra divorciada  de su primer compromiso del que concibió tres hijos que ahora tienen 29,28 y 24 años  todos ellos ya casados,  desde hace 23 años tiene un nuevo compromiso y con él procrearon seis hijos que se encuentran de  20, 18, 17, 15, 13 y 8 años de edad, su hijo mayor es casado y vive independientemente, mientras que su hijo de 18 años trabajaba en un taller de fibra de vidrio realizando payasos para colocar la basura y estudia en el colegio San Francisco,  sus hijas de 17 y 13  estudian en el colegio Israel, su hijo de 15 en el colegio Manuel J. C. y su ultimo hijo en la escuela Federico Malo, no tienen casa propia viven y cuidan  el taller de su cuñado que no les cobra arriendo.

Digna es socia activa de éste banco desde hace tres ciclos incentivada por una amiga que también socia del msimo, nos comenta que antes trabajaba lavando ropa ajena, limpiando casas pero se enfermó y tuvo que dejar esta actividad,  desde hace cinco meses trabaja elaborando guaipe (trapos para limpiar),  los préstamos obtenidos los ha invertido en su negocio y con el crédito solicitado va a comprar  tela para la fabricación de guaipe, para los estudios de sus hijos y para llevar los productos necesarios a su hogar.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener su casa propia así sea pequeña.
texts.en:
lThe community bank Atenas was founded by women who share great friendship ties and establish a good work team. The partners live in different parts of the urban basin. This city is located in the southern zone and is the capital of the province of Azuay, well-known by writers and artists- Its architectural beauty, the four rivers surrounding the city, the skilled hands of the artesans, its succulent gastronomy, and its warm people attract national and international tourists.

Digna B. lives in the parish, Carmen de Sidcay, she is 48 years old, divorced with three children, 29, 28, and 24 years old, all married. For the past 23 years she has had another commitment and has six children, 20, 18, 17, 15, 13, and 8 years old. Her oldest son is married and lives independently. Her 18 year-old son works at a fiberglass factory making clowns for trash and studies at the San Francisco school. Her daughters, 17 and 13 years old, study at the Israel school, her son of 15 at the Manuel J. C. school and her youngest son at the Federico Malo school. They do not own their house and they take care of her brother-in-law's workshop who does not charge rent.

Digna has been an active partner of this bank for three cycles, motivated by a friend who is also a partner. She tells us that previously she worked doing laundry and cleaning houses but she fell ill and had to stop. For the past five months she has been working making "guaipe" (dust clothes). The previous loans have been invested in her business and with the loan requested she will buy fabric for "guaipe", pay tuition for her children and purchase the necessary products for her home. It is her dream to own a house even small.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cloth for "guaipe", pay tuition for her children, and buy products needed for her home.

loans.name: Dolgormaa

texts.en:
Dolgormaa is a teacher who lives in Mongolia with her two children and husband (pictured). She moved to her current residence 12 to 13 years ago. She had recently seen an Eco Products advertisement and decided to buy an energy efficient stove.  So far she has noticed that stove has helped her save money on fuel and that it keeps her yurt warmer for a longer time then her old stove. Based on her recommendation, her brother, and a friend’s mother have also bought similiar stoves.  She adds, “There is too much air pollution and smoke in Ulaanbaatar and I’m willing to take action against it.” 

About XacBank Eco Products Program
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world.  Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius.  60% of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. 60% of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth quintile spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy an energy efficient heating stove

loans.name: Theresah

texts.en:
Theresah A. cooks and sells food in Elmina, such as banku and okra stew, and fufu with varieties of soup. Theresah received a junior high education. She is a single parent and has two children. Theresah has been selling cooked food for some time now. She is responsible for paying of school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. 

Theresah will use her loan to buy more cassava, plantains and other goods to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to educate her children.

In the photo, she is preparing a traditional dish called "fufu" (cassava dumplings) . It is one of the nation's favorites.

loans.use: To buy more cassava, plantains and other goods to sell

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es una humilde y cariñosa mujer de 46 años, está casada con Andrés de 55 años, con quien tiene 5 hijos: Alejandro de 15, Paulo de 14, Ever de 11, Ana de 10 y Lucio de 8 años.  

Pese a no saber leer ni escribir, ella no permite que exista discriminación en su pueblo, actitud que la hace muy respetada y querida desde el más pequeño hasta la persona mayor. 
Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura, siembra café, plátanos y maíz, esta actividad la realiza junto a su esposo, quien muchas veces se queda a dormir en la choza que tienen en sus chacras para cuidar sus cultivos, siendo Bertha la encargada de la administración de las ganancias, pero también trabaja en las chacras cuando es necesario. Segura de que su actividad económica es muy rentable, para el futuro desea adquirir mayor cantidad de plátanos y yuca, que son productos de la selva muy requeridos en los mercados de las ciudades aledañas.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y gracias a la confianza que depositan en ella está progresando junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes son muy organizados. Para obtener mayores ingresos, con el dinero que ahora solicita, pretende comprar 230 plantas de plátanos y varios sacos de abono para nivelar su producción.
texts.en:
46-year-old Bertha is a rather loving, humble woman. She is married to Andres, age 55, and they have five children together: Alejandro (15), Paulo (14), Ever (11), Ana (10) and Lucio, who is 8. Although she can't read or write, she has no patience for discrimination. She has a great attitude that has earned her plenty of respect from everyone she knows, both young and old. Bertha and her husband have been farming coffee, bananas and maize for about 10 years. In order to better tend the crops, her husband often sleeps in a hut out on the fields. Bertha looks after the business end of things, but also helps with the crops whenever it's necessary. She's confident that her business has a good outlook, so she wants to farm more banana and yuca, which are both in high demand at nearby markets. This is Bertha's fourth loan with MFP. She's very thankful for the confidence the organization has in her and the other members of her community bank, all of whom are quite well organized. In order to increase her profits, she plans to buy 230 banana trees and several sacks of fertilizer, which will increase yields.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying banana trees and fertilizer

loans.name: Krisanto

texts.en:
Krisanto D. is from the village of Calabayan Minanga, Angadanan, Isabela. He is 30 years old and married. To make a living, Krisanto owns and operates a service-based business, providing internet services in the local community. He is just starting this business.

In 2010, Krisanto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional equipment. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to further expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment

loans.name: Aracele Tapales Group

texts.en:
Aracele T., from the town of Lopez Jaena, is the 65-year-old leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While both members of the group receive an individual loan, each is responsible for paying back the loan of her fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Aracele is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Aracele owns and operates a business selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Aracele joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale, she is now requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP to be used for the same purpose. This loan will be Aracele's third from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Kike

texts.en:
Kike sells frozen food like chicken parts, turkey parts and more. She travels to purchase her goods from other towns close to the Lagos border. She has been in business for ten years and, with it, she is able to sustain herself and her family financially.

Kike is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more frozen food to sell to make more profit. She says thanks to LAPO micro-finance and Kiva lenders who have greatly improved her business and family life. She indeed is very grateful to all.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing beverages [for resale]

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en: Sieng V. is 28 years old, married, and the mother of a young child who attends the local public school. She stays at home to manage the family housework and also sells some fruit to villagers for extra income. Sieng is married to 40-year-old Bunny, who helps support the family by running a motor taxi. Sieng V. will be using her loan to purchase a trailer to attach to the existing motorcycle, so her husband will be able to pick up more passengers.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to attach to existing motorcycle

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe A. ya ha tenido tres créditos con KIVA los cuales han pagado puntual mente y está agradecida por la cooperación que le han brindado en sus créditos.
Solicita nuevamente otro préstamo para poder comprar el material que necesita para la elaboración de la losa en los cuartos que esta construyendo en la parte alta de la vivienda.
Desea tener independiente el negocio de la casa, porque quiere ampliar más su negocio de papelería escolar. 
Plena pagar el préstamo con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que su esposo el señor Santiago Olguín quien se encarga de los gastos familiares en el sueldo que recibe como empleado de un taller de carpintería.
texts.en:
Guadalupe A. has had three previous loans with Kiva that she has repaid punctually; she’s grateful for the cooperation these loans have provided her. She is again asking for funding to buy the materials she needs to install tile flooring in the rooms she’s building in the upper part of her house. She wants to separate her business from the living quarters in her home because she wants to expand her school supply business. She plans to repay the loan with profits from her store since her husband, Santiago Olguín, will take care of household expenses with the salary he earns as a carpentry shop employee.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile flooring.

loans.name: Luisa Elizabeth

texts.es: La soicitante cuenta con un transporte (automovil), la cual la conduce su sobrino en forma diaria. Su conyugue le da una pension voluntaria la cual no ha sido considerada. Vive en casa propia, cuenta con buena acumulacion de bienes. El destino del credito  es para necesidad´personal y reparacion de su automovil
texts.en:
Our associate counts on her nephew to drive her daily. Her husband gives her an allowance that has not been considered. She lives in her own home. She is asking for this loan in order to take care of some personal expenses, including repairing her automobile.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Berechissou

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et a un enfant, elle vit avec son mari dans le quartier abové qui est un quartier périphérique de Lomé ; elle fait le commerce des habits pour enfants. Elle souhaite gonfler son stock raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 2 grand cartons d’habits pour enfant.
texts.en:
This lady is married and has one child. She lives with her husband in the Abové district, which is an outlying district of Lomé. She sells clothing for children. She would like to expand her inventory so she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 2 big cartons of children's clothing.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of children's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy four milk cows

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta tiene 57 años, es casada, resiD. en San Miguel, vive con el esposo y una hija, ella fabrica ropa.
Posee un negocio D. fabricación D. vestidos para ocasiones como bodas, quinceañeras, y otros festejos, venD. accesorios como son coronas para reina y otros. Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería ya que se aproxima las fiestas D. Independencia por lo cual necesita comprar telas D. alta costura y accesorios, esto contribuirá a mejorar el negocio y contar materiales para confección D. vestidos.
Las aspiraciones son mejorar el negocio para ahorrar una cuota destinada a su retiro, dedicarse ha viajar.
texts.en:
Marta is 57 years old, married, and lives in San Miguel with her husband and daughter. She manufactures clothing items. Her business is making dresses for special occasions, such as weddings, quinceañeras (formal parties for girls turning 15), and others formals. She also sells accessories, such as tiaras, etc. She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies, as the Independence Day festivals approach. She needs to buy high quality fabrics and accessories. This will help her improve the business and allow her to have dress making supplies on hand. She wants to improve her business so that she can save more money toward her retirement.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Petronio

texts.en:
Petronio C. is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 62 years old. Petronio is widowed and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Petronio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables, like squash, "kamungay", and "alogbati" for sale. Petronio has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Petronio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Petronio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,500 PHP from GDMPC. Petronio is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Petronio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Maria Esmeralda C. E., tiene la edad de37 años, habitante de un humilde barrio, con su pareja de vida y sus 2 hijos, laboran en una zona franca, y ella tiene una venta de cosméticos, fue con el apoyo de su esposo que logro realizar las primeras compras de la mercadería de cosméticos, ellos habitan en un pequeño y humilde hogar, el cual desean mejorar a futuro.

Es para este propósito que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, con el invierno han tenido muchos problemas de inundación que daña los electrodomésticos y las condiciones del hogar, con la inversión podrán edificar un muro al frente que no permita los estragos que ocasiona el invierno, sobretodo la tranquilidad de madre de ofrecerle a sus pequeños un mejor lugar donde morar y habitar de forma digna.
texts.en:
Maria Esmeralda C. E. is 37 years old and lives in a modest neighborhood with her life partner and their 2 children. They work in the free trade zone and she has a business selling cosmetics. It was with the support of her husband that she was able to make her first purchases of cosmetics merchandise. They live in a small and modest house, which they would like to improve in the future. It is for this reason that they are requesting a loan to buy construction materials. During the winter, they have had a lot of problems with flooding that has damaged their appliances and the conditions of the home. With this investment they will be able to build a wall in front that will prevent the damage that the winter brings, and will provide tranquility for the mother as she will be able to provide her small children with a better dwelling and a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build a wall to prevent flooding

loans.name: Hairane

texts.en: Hairane P. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 37 years old. Hairane is married and has two young children. To make a living, Hairane operates a tricycle-transport service. Hairane has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Hairane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hairane is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Hairane from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: María Adela

texts.es: María Adela M. D. M. D. 40 años D. edad, resiD. en Tonacatepeque, en donD. vive junto a su esposo quien es empleado D. una empresa privada y junto a sus tres hijos D. 20, 14 y 6 años D. edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar.  María posee una venta D. ropa para mujeres y hombre, la cual comercializa a las afueras del mercado municipal D. Tonacatepeque, así mismo venD. huevos D. codorniz, los cuales se venden a muy buen precio debido a que son muy poco comunes en esta zona. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda adquirir mayor cantidad D. ropa, lo que le permita atender a más clientes y ofrecer una mayor variedad D. productos, así mismo posee muchos clientes los cuales llegan a su negocio con el único fin D. obtener huevos D. codorniz, por lo que desea comprar mayor cantidad D. estos para suplir la necesidad D. sus clientes. D. esta manera María podrá obtener mayores ingresos los cuales son muy necesarios para la estabilidad D. su hogar.
texts.en:
María Adela M. D. M., 40, lives in Tonacatepeque with her husband who is employed by a private firm and their three children who are 20, 14 and 6 years of age and in school.

María sells clothing for women and men outsiD. the Tonacatepeque Municipal Market.  She also sells quail eggs at a very good price because they aren’t very common in this area.

María is asking for funds to buy larger quantities of clothes so that she can tend to more customers and offer a greater variety of products.  She has many customers who come by her business with the only end in mind to buy quail eggs so she also wants to increase her stock of these items to meet customer demand.

María hopes thus to earn higher income that is very necessary for her home’s stability.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Eduvi Cristina

texts.es:
Eduvi de 38 años, tiene una pequeña panaderia en su casa, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas

Escogía tener una panadería ya que hace muchos años atrás aprendió a hacer panes y no quería desperdiciar ese talento. Compro un horno y  harina para comenzar con la panadería en la parte delantera de su casa. En la actualidad vende pan en su pequeño local que tiene en su casa trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.
