Uno de los inconvenientes para hacer panes es el polvo que produce la calle ya que son de tierra. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar leche, mantequilla, harina para su panadería. En el futuro quiere tener su casa de cemento y tener mas grande su panadería.
texts.en:
Eduvi is 38 years old and has a small bakery in her house. She lives in a semi-urban area called Fortín, characterized by dirt roads and mountains.

She chose to have a bakery because many years ago she learned how to make bread and didn't want to lose the skill. She bought an oven and flour to start the bakery in the front of her house. Now she sells bread from her in-home store, working from 6:30am to 8pm every day. One of the inconveniences she encounters in making bread is the dust that spreads from the dirt roads.

With this loan, she would like to buy milk, butter, and flour for her bakery. In the future, she would like to have a house of cement and expand her bakery.

loans.use: Milk, flour, butter

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente con tres hijos, tiene estudios de educación primaria completa.
Yolanda viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 9 años, el primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual le sirvió para comprar insumos para preparar jugo de quinua.
La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/ 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para la compra de insumos en su negocio.
 Su sueño es tener además de la venta de jugo, una tienda de venta de pollos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es compartir la alegría.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the “Gran Poder” (Great Power) Communal Bank.  It is located in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department.  She is 29 years old, and she has a live-in partner.  She has three children, and she has an elementary school education.

Yolanda has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for nine years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to buy ingredients to make quinoa juice.

She is requesting a new loan for 800 soles, which she will use to buy supplies for her business.

Her dream is to have a store selling chickens in addition to her business of selling juice.

What she likes about her communal bank is sharing the joy.

loans.use: Buy ingredients to prepare quinoa juice

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y radica junto a sus padres y hermanos en el caserío Viviano Espinoza del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se caracteriza principalmente por producir mango y limón, el lugar se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Piura y pertenece a la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. Los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos, a los negociantes o en el mercado local. El negocio es su única fuente de ingreso y gracias a el solventa sus gastos personales y apoya a sus padres en el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Anabel desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. Ella es una mujer bastante activa y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucho cariño y estima.
texts.en:
Anabel is 24 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents and siblings in Viviano Espinoza village, in the district of Tambogrande, a farming area which is noted mainly for producing mangoes and lemons.  It is located in Piura province, in the region of the same name, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Anabel's business is raising pigs and poultry in a pen next to her home.  She feeds the animals grain and natural fodder.  When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to her neighbors, to traders or in the local market.  The business is her only source of income.  It covers her personal expenses and helps her parents in financially supporting the family.

Anabel would like to expand her business with the purchase of more animals and balanced animal feed.  For this reason she is requesting a loan for 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.  She is quite an active woman who has a great desire to succeed.  People who know her have a lot of affection and respect for her.

loans.use: To buy animals and balanced feed to expand her business raising and selling animals

loans.name: Estefania

texts.en:
Estefania D. is from the village of Capellan. She is 55 years old. Estefania is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Estefania owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Estefania has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Estefania joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estefania has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Estefania is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Estefania from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús es un padre de familia de 45 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en una zona urbano – marginal del distrito de Paiján, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad. La localidad se encuentra situada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace más de cinco años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte). El brinda su servicio en las zona donde vive y en las localidades aledañas. Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para solventar la economía de su familia y sacarlos adelante.

El excesivo uso brindado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que esta sufra algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Jesús ya ha tenido un crédito anterior financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad también pudo reparar su mototaxi y gracias a ello pudo trabajar normalmente durante una temporada. Por ello el se encuentra agradecido con las personas que le apoyaron.
texts.en:
Jesus is a father and is 45 years old. He lives with his wife and his two children in an urban area on the outskirts of the Paijan district, a commercial area located in the Ascope province in the La Libertad region. The town is located two and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region Lambayeque. 

For more than five years he has offered cargo and passenger transportation services in a motorcycle taxi (a motorized vehicle which consists of a motorcycle with a cabin attached to offer transportation services). He offers his services in the area where he lives and in the surrounding towns. He uses the income he receives to pay for his family's expenses and to get them ahead. 

The excessive use of his motorcycle taxi has resulted in its suffering some failures that need urgent repair to guarantee its proper function. This is why he thought it appropriate to request a loan from field partner Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 Nuevos Soles (PEN). 

Jesus has previously had a loan funded by Kiva through field partner Edpyme Alternative and Capital Semilla. On that occasion, he was also able to repair his motorcycle taxi and thanks to that he was able to work regularly for a while. This is why he is thankful to those people that helped him.

loans.use: Expenses for repair and maintenance of a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en: Roxana belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 38 years old. She and her common-law husband have two children. She has a shop where she restores and repaints cars in the San Sebastian neighborhood of Cusco, Peru.  She is requesting the loan to invest in her business by buying more parts and paint for her body shop. Roxana is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in spare parts and paint for her auto repair shop

loans.name: Wazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Wazeeran is a resident of Depalpur, which is an ancient city and famous for its agriculture industry. She has lived there with her family in the area named Khalilabad for past 16 years. She is a widow and lost her husband a few years ago as a result of a sudden death. It was a time of great difficulty for Wazeeran but she never lost her hope. She brought up her four sons and a daughter with great care. She helped her elder son to find a job and her younger son to establish his business of burger joint. Now all of her children are doing either their businesses or working in different organizations for reasonable income. Even her only daughter has started working as a teacher in nearby school. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her younger son who wants to buy some ingredients like cooking oil, bread, chicken meat and spices etc for his burger joint. He started this business four years ago and Wazeeran is very hopeful that the loan will help him in further establishing his business. She has a plan to marry her eldest son who is now 24 years old and she is confident that she will be able to do that with the help of an improved financial conditions. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fifth loan application. She is a responsible loan user who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like cooking oil, bread, chicken meat and spices for burger joint business

loans.name: Twelwaneko Nabingoola Group

texts.en:
Margret wants a loan to purchase drugs for her clinic. She is 40 years old and a mother of 4 children.  She  owns a clinic, which she has operated for 2 years after attaining training. She faces a problem of lack of medical equipment, like an ultra-sound scanner and a microscope for her clinic, among other equipmentnone the less in future she would like to see her business expand into a hospital.
Margret is a member of Twelwaneko Nabingoola, a group of members who came together for the purpose of improving their household income through access to loans.

loans.use: Buying  drugs for  her clinic

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa M. is married to a farmer.  They have five children. For five years now, Adjoa has been selling fish and kenkey (a Ghanaian staple, painstakingly made from fermented maize and cassava). Her income is used to pay for their five children’s school fees and for household expenses. 

Adjoa aspires to expand her business and needs the loan to purchase greater quantities of ingredients to produce more food for sale. She aims to reinvest the profits back into her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy herbicide products

loans.name: 0203013 Bac Son - Hoang Phu - Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Tuyet N. T. (203081) is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Tuyet is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 0203013 Bac Son - Hoang Phu - Hoang Hoa.

Tuyet is married and has 2 very young children. She operates a family member's specialized retail store, selling electronic products in the local community.  Tuyet has been engaged in this business for over 14 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from it.

In 2011, Tuyet joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This will be her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 3,079,800 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Tuyet plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  M. T. Hau (203082) is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her general store.


2.  M. T. Chung (203083) is a 51-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her restaurant.


3.  N. T. Hoat (203084) is a 49-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business.


4.  C. T. Thuong (203085) is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her general store.


5.  N. T. Quyen (203086) is a 38-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her general store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tuyet N. T. (203081) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Tuyet là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 0203013 Bac Son - Hoang Phu - Hoang Hoa (0203013 Bac Son - Hoang Phu - Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm điện tử trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Tuyet thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 14 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tuyet kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2011, Tuyet đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tuyet đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  M. T. Hau (203082) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


2.  M. T. Chung (203083) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh nhà hàng.


3.  N. T. Hoat (203084) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


4.  C. T. Thuong (203085) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


5.  N. T. Quyen (203086) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie Nyirahabimana est commerçante de pommes de terre dans le district de Rubavu, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle a 39 ans, elle est mariée, née a Rwanda, et elle a 5 enfants entre 5 ans et 23 ans.  Elle a aussi 1 personne en charge.  Quatre de ses enfants vont à l’école, et Marie a fini deux ans d’école secondaire.  Ce crédit est son deuxième cycle avec ACB, et elle a une bonne histoire de remboursement.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1000 kgs de pommes de terre, payer la main d’œuvre, et acheter 20 emballages pour son business.  Sa strategie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’acheter et vendre les pommes de terre en grande quantité ; donc, augmentation de la quantité.  Elle voudrait devenir grossiste, assurer le bien être de sa famille, payer et préparer les futures études pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marie Nyirahabimana sells potatoes in the district of Rubavu, and has been a  client of ACB since 2010. Born in Rwanda, Marie is 39 years old, married and the mother of 5 children between the ages of 5 and 23. She also takes care of one other person. Four of her children go to school. Marie finished two years of secondary school. This loan is her second cycle with ACB, and she has a good repayment history.

She will use her loan to buy 1,000 kg of potatoes, to pay for workers and to buy 20 packages for her business.  Her business growth plan is to buy and sell large quantities of potatoes, therefore, she needs to increase quantities. She would like to become a wholesaler, to guarantee her family's well being, and to pay and save for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 1,000 kg of potatoes, 20 packages for her business, and to hire workers.

loans.name: Rosa Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa C. es socia del banco comunal San Vicente, vive en la comunidad de San Vicente que  pertenece a la parroquia de La Victoria del Portete, este lugar es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad de Cuenca a laborar en diferentes actividades.

Doña Rosa tiene 50 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 28, 25, 22 y 11 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos han migrado en busca de un mejor futuro, su tercer hijo estudia en la universidad y su ultimo hijo en el colegio. Su esposo también se encuentra en el extranjero, con el sacrificio y trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Rosa se dedica al bordado, esta actividad la realiza hace 28 años, trabaja en su casa de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo. También se dedica a la cría de vacas, borregos y cuyes que son para su consumo y para la venta.

Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace 5 años y  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de telas,  hilos y en el arreglo de su máquina de coser.
 
Su meta es  construir una nueva casa para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa C. is a member of the San Vicente community bank.  She lives in San Vicente community which is located in La Victoria del Portete parish.  This area has a cold climate and its people raise livestock and farm.  Many leave the community daily to travel to the city of Cuenca to work in different jobs.

Rosa is 50 years old, married, and has four children aged 28, 25, 22 and 11.  Her two eldest children have migrated in search of a better future.  Her third child is studying at university and her youngest is in school.  Her husband is abroad.  Through their joint sacrifice and work, they have managed to build their own home.

Rosa's business is embroidering.  She has been doing this work for 28 years.  She works from home, from Monday to Saturday but doesn't working fixed hours.  She also raises cows, lambs and guinea pigs which are for her own consumption and also to sell.

Rosa has been a member of her community bank for five years and she will invest her new loan in buying fabric and threads.  She will also get her sewing machine fixed.

Rosa's goal is to build a new house for her children.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads, and to fix a sewing machine

loans.name: Rasoolan's Group

texts.en:
Rasoolan lives in Mian Channu, which is a small city located in Punjab, a province of Pakistan known for its agricultural industry. She lives with her family in a two-room house. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to improve her husband’s livestock business. He buys young animals, raises them, and sells to customers. With this loan, he will buy animals such as goats and sheep to sell at good profit. He started this business 20 years ago and it has worked well for him. Rasoolan is very hopeful about the future growth of her husband’s business and about a better financial future for her family. 

Rasoolan is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is 51 years old and still very active at this age. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep to sell.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese is 43 years old. She has nine children aged between one and twenty-five years old, seven of whom are in school. The eldest has completed school, while the youngest has not yet begun school. 

Therese sells food stuffs and her husband works with her. They have run this business together for six years and it has enabled them to pay fees for their children and to feed them. She is requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs, such as beans and sorghum, in order to expand her business.

Her future plans are to open up a wholesale shop and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs, such as beans and sorghum for her food business

loans.name: Nargiza's Group

texts.en:
Nargiza is 25 and married to a hairdresser. Along with her husband, she is raising their two-year-old daughter, who goes to kindergarten. Nargiza is the treasurer of this group.

Three years ago Nargiza saved 3,000 KGS and started to sell foodstuffs near the house. At the moment, her monthly profit is 7800 KGS. With money received from her loan Nargiza wants to purchase construction materials to build a shop.

In the future Nargiza plans to increase turnover of her stock and hopes that her business will progress successfully.

About Mol Bulak Finance:

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is a 40-year-old farmer from village Charnali, West Georgia. She is married and lives in the village with her husband Mamia and two sons (19 and 21 years old). Mamia is 52 years old; he is a metal worker by trade. Also he has a tractor and provides services to neighborhood farms, earning additional income for the family. Liana’s sons are students at a high school.

Liana’s family owns 0.4 ha of agricultural land, where vegetables are grown. Harvested vegetables are sold locally to vegetable retailers. Also they have one milk cow, whose milk is sold locally. 

The total average monthly income of the family is approximately 670 Laris. 

With the requested credit, Liana plans to purchase an additional milk cow. The family will get and sell more milk and increase their income. The increase in income will be used for purchasing new household goods in order to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Solidario Flores De Sumpango Group

texts.es: Solidario Flores de Sumpango: este grupo esta formado por tres señoras las cuales se dedican a la agricultura y a la confeccion de tejidos doña Maria es la lider de este grupo y nos cuenta que estan contenta porque su negocio a prosperado ella como las otras socias se dedican a la misma actividad las tres señoras estan convencidas que nececitan mas capital para trabajar por eso estan solicictando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos.
texts.en:
'Flores de Sumpango' Solidarity Group

This group is made up of three ladies whose businesses are farming and weaving.

María is the leader of this group and she tells us that she is happy because her business is prospering.  She and her fellow group members are in the same business.  The ladies need more capital to work.  For this reason, they are requesting a loan to buy raw materials for weaving their products.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving

loans.name: Kitombo

texts.en:
Kitombo is a 37-year-old, married father of two children. Kitombo is a retail trader in Mikindani, Mombasa. Kitombo's business has been in operation for the last 6 years and has been a success. 

He has been a KADET client and this marks his fourth borrowing to finance his business. With this loan he plans to purchase ear buds, toothpaste, toothpicks, bathing soaps, scissors, combs, mirrors, toys and powder for his business. The anticipated profits will be used to repay back the loan and to gradually expand his business.

His dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: purchase ear buds, toothpaste, toothpicks, bathing soaps, scissors, combs, mirrors, toys and powder

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is married with five children. He has been a farmer working in the Philippines for 20 years. Victor is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to pay for land cultivation and to buy hybrid seeds for his farm. He hopes this loan will help grow his operation. He currently earns PHP 15,000 each cropping season. In the future, Victor hopes to earn consistent profits in order to send his children to school continuously to get their degrees.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and to buy hybrid seeds

loans.name: Bonaventure

texts.en:
Bonaventure is 25 years old and is married with one child who is 2 years old. He has owned a small business selling shoes for the past 11 years. His business is well-organized and he works daily from 6am until 6pm every day, except Saturday.

He has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing various shoes for adults and children. With the profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: expand his shoe business

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and has two children.

Haydar has been an owner of a workshop since 2008. He repairs paint scratches on cars. He has good experience and he has a deep understanding of the local consumer. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2,700 loan to renovate his shop and to make sliding doors. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to make sliding doors.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: FabioL. tiene 26 años D. edad, elL. no estudio debido a que es sordomuda D. nacimiento, por eso no pudo ir a L. escueL. por que no entendía lo que decían los maestros debido a su discapacidad. ElL. tiene un negocio D. venta D. abarrotes, primero empezó vendiendo dulces en su casa dice que los tenia en su ropero y se los vendía a sus sobrinitos y uno D. ellos le ayudaba a cobrar y a vender, después se puso una mesita fuera D. su casa y empezó a venderles a los niños D. su colonia y ahorita poco a poco a través D. los créditos que le a otorgado L. financiera a podido comprar y hacer su tiendita D. abarrotes en su cuarto. Comenta a través D. señas y gracias a su esposo que nos traduce lo que quiere tratar D. decirnos, que hace como un año se caso y que su esposo le ha ayudado a entender y ha como comunicarse con las personas. ElL. es una mujer muy trabajadora y pese a su discapacidad no ha sido un obstáculo para salir adelante,  doña FabioL. esta pidiendo un crédito a L. financiera para L. compra D. productos como jabón, huevo, azúcar, leche, aceite, frijol, etc. L. meta D. FabioL. es hacer un local especialmente para su tienda D. abarrotes ya que L. tienda L. tiene en su cuarto.
texts.en:
FabioL., 26, did not go to school because she’s been deaf and mute since birth.  Because of this she was unable to go to school because her disability kept her from understanding what the teachers were saying.

She has a business selling groceries.  She started out selling candy at first at home.  She says that she’d keep it in her closet and sell it to her little nieces and nephews and one of them would help her sell and collect payments.  Later on, she set up a small table in her front yard and started selling to the neighborhood children and now, little by little, thanks to the loans from the financial institution she’s been able to buy and set up her little store in a room.  She speaks through gestures and her husband translates for us what she tries to say which is that she got married about a year ago and her husband has helped her understand and to communicate with people.

She is a very hardworking woman whose disability has not been an obstacle for her to het ahead. FabioL. is asking the financial institution for a loan to buy products like soap, eggs, sugar, milk, oil, beans, etc.  FabioL.’s goal is to build a locale specifically for her store because she currently has it installed in her room.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Thai, 31 years old, is a garment factory worker, earning the income of $3 per day. Her husband is also working in the factory with the income of $3 per day. This couple has one child who is four years old. They live with two other family members, Thai's mother and sister. Every month, Thai has to spend $82 on food, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. In the future, she wants to buy grocery goods to sell in front of her house to make more income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work

loans.name: Anamelba

texts.es:
Anamelba es socia del  Banco Comunal “Alto Alianza I”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, es  conviviente y tiene 4 hijos.  Cuenta con educación superior.
La señora se dedica a la compra y venta de animales caseros como pollos, trabaja con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace ocho años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00  nuevos soles dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 200.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital de su negocio y comprará veinte pares de pollos, para su respectivo engorde por veinte días para luego venderlos en las localidades de Tiquillaca, Mañazo, Vilque Atuncolla.  Ella trabaja sola en el negocio, su esposo trabaja como albañil.
La señora desea tener un restaurante y un locutorio que le permita generar otros ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la solidaridad, el intercambio de palabras con las socias y lo que gana su ahorro.
texts.en:
Anamelba is a member of the communal bank “Alto Alianza I” which is located in the district of Puno in the province and department of Puno. She is 36 years old, lives with her partner and has 4 children. She has a post-secondary education.

The lady works buying and selling farm animals such as chickens. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 years. Her first loan was for the sum of 300.00 nuevos soles (PEN), money which she invested in her business.

With this new loan of 200.00 nuevos soles (PEN), she will increase her working capital and will buy 20 pairs of chickens. She will fatten them for 20 days and then sell them in the towns of Tiquillaca, Mañazo, and Vilque Atuncolla. She works alone in her business. Her husband works as a bricklayer.

The lady wants to have a restaurant and a call centre that will allow her to generate additional income. 

What she likes about the communal bank is the solidarity, the exchange of ideas with members and the growth in her savings.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of chickens.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 60 years old and now a widow. She lives in a village with two adult children. They own and manage a rice farming business and a welding shop to earn income.The family has had this business for more than 30 years and is now earning a profit of P8,000 a month.  They work hard and endure hardships to earn income and satisfy their needs. 

Due to the high cost of commodities and transportation, Remedios aims to improve their welding shop and make it viable source of income. She is requesting  a loan of P15,000 to buy a welding rod, steel rods, G.I.sheets and paint to be use in the welding shop to provide  better service. She believes that through this loan, they will improve the business and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy a welding rod, steel rods, G.I. sheets and paint to use in her welding shop

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 53 years old and widowed with one child.  To earn a living, she has been practicing dairy farming for over 20 years.  She has employed one person to assist her in the business. She also owns rental houses, which earn her extra income. 
 
Ann has managed to improve her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she was trained on business management skills.  She has requested a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en: Gegham trades in furniture. He has been managing the business successfully for three years already, and would now like to expand his enterprise and trade in carpets and clothing, too. These products have been in high demand lately, so expanding his business will mean an increase of working capital for Gegham. This loan will help him get additional income and insure better living conditions for his family in the future. He lives with his parents.

loans.use: to purchase carpets and clothing for sale

loans.name: Mathieu

texts.fr:
Mathieu  est né au Rwanda et a 62 ans. Il est marié avec 4 enfants de 13 à 34 ans. Il a une autre personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de secondaire. 
Mathieu est agri éleveur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter une vache.
Mathieu voudrait agrandir son activité en achetant d’autres vaches. Il voudrait être le premier   éleveur dans sa région et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mathieu  is 62 years old and was born in Rwanda. He is married and has 4 children, aged from 13 to 34 years old.  Besides his children, he is responsible for one other person. He has received 4 years of secondary education. 

Mathieu is a farmer/breeder. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He wants to use the loan to buy a cow, and then to expand his business by buying more cows. His goal is to become the biggest breeder in the area, and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra: Maritza; La socia tiene 50 años D. edad, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio D. venta D. chompas,ella teje chompas para niños,mujeres y varones,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio D. compra y venta D. cerveza,ella venD. en forma independiente,por medio D. estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. chompas y negocio D. venta D. cerveza . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lana,hilos y palitos D. tejer y tambien para comprar cerveza al por mayor.
La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Maritza is the member; she’s 50 years old, married and has three children.  She’s still in business selling sweaters for children, men and women that she knits and she’s also a beer merchant.  She sells independently and through these businesses is able to support her children.  She wants to expand and improve the sweater and the beer sales so is asking for a loan to buy yarn, thread and knitting needles and also to buy beer at wholesale.  She is satisfied with the granted loan and commits to make her payments according to the established timeline.

loans.use: to buy yarn, thread and knitting needles and also to buy beer at wholesale.

loans.name: El Gran Esfuerzo 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Rosa has two children and they live together with her father. She tells us that her greatest challenge now is to have her own house. She loves going to church and to work.

Rosa is very excited to be receiving her 11th loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having satisfactorily paid off her previous loans and thereby given a step forward in the growth of her business. She has had her business for around 11 years. She set up her business with a small amount of savings which she was keeping for business purposes and she started growing it with her first loan from Esperanza. She is planning to invest her new loan in buying different styles of clothes. Now is Christmas season and people are needing to buy a lot of goods, which is the reason why she will be prepared for Christmas sales. She plans to use her profits to buy things she needs and start building her house.

Rosa is one of the members of 'El Gran Esfuerzo' (The Big Effort) 4 7 5 group which is located in the town of Hato Mayor. The town's economy depends on farming and it is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic. The city population is Dominicans and emigrant Haitians. The group's main business activity is selling clothes, and most of the members which compounded this group are Haitians immigrants.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 42-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two children, who are still attending school.  He is the main source of income for his family and works really hard to provide a better future for his young children. 

Nidal started his own metal work in 1990 and is looking forward to growing his business. Today, he wants to borrow $2500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a laser machine and additional metal equipment.  He notes that this Kiva loan will increase his profits by 20%. In the future, he plans to expand his business by buying extra technological tools.

loans.use: buy a laser machine and metal equipment

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 57 years old, married to Lucy. They have three dependants. He has been in the animal feed business for 5 years from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 15,000. He is applying for his second loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more stock of animal feeds.He paid the previous loan in time. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He hopes to use the profits to expand the business and re-pay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more animal feed for sale.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Matilde de 44 años vive en Bogotá, la linda capital de Colombia, con su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 17 a 21 años de edad.  En esta ciudad,  tiene el negocio de preparación de comidas rápidas, el que inició hace 7 años, cuando se radicó en Bogotá por motivos de desplazamiento; como siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer trabajadora, no dudó en iniciar   su idea emprendedora, apoyada con recursos del estado y algunos propios. En la actualidad requiere comprar un molino eléctrico para hacer más efectiva su producción y también un carro de perros calientes, pues los equipos con los que cuenta no son de su propiedad. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace la Fundación  Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará un molino y un carro de perros calientes que tenga todo incorporado y le facilite su trabajo. Su meta es continuar su crecimiento, pues aunque le ha ido muy bien,  su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para lograr responder a sus propias expectativas y sueños, con los cuales mejoraría sustancialmente su bienestar familiar.
texts.en: Matilde is 44 years old, lives in Bogotá, the beautiful city of Colombia, with her husband and three children whose ages range from 17 to 21 years of age. In this city, she has been selling fast food for seven years. She established herself in Bogotá due to displacement. Since she considers herself to be a very hard-working woman, she had no doubts in starting her business. She was supported with resources from the state and her own. At the moment, she wants to buy an electric grinder to make her products more efficiently and a hot dog cart since the equipment she uses now are not hers. These are the main reasons she is requesting the loan. This is the first loan that the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation will request in order to buy an electric grinder and a fully-equipped hot dog cart to make her job easier. Her goal is to continue growing her business, even though it has been doing very well, since her income is not enough to meet her expectations and dreams; those which would substantially improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: buy an electric grinder and a fully-equipped hot dog cart.

loans.name: Arnauline Reack Mildrede

texts.fr:
Cette commerçante est une cliente de 30 ans,  mariée et mère d'un enfant de 4 ans,elle vend de la friperie il y'a bientôt 6 ans, quand elle arrête ses etudes en classe de première.Elle commence avec la vente de la friperie pour aider son couple.
Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente des robes de fillettes, elle a su fidéliser ses clients et a des stratégies de vente  très efficaces, elle achète des ballots de robes neuves, qu'elle fait laver et vend chez ses clientes, dans le quartier et parfois dans les administrations.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va encore acheter des  ballots robes, surtout qu'elle est a la veille des fetes de noël.
Depuis l'obtention de son prêt,ses ventes ont largement augmentées, et elle épargne beaucoup et  fait des énormes benefices.
Elle a pour projet d'avoir un dépôt des ballots de friperie
texts.en:
This client is a 30-year-old vendor. She is married and has a four-year-old child. She started selling secondhand clothing about six years ago, when she stopped her schooling during secondary school. She began selling secondhand clothing in order to help her husband.

She has specialized in the sale of dresses for girls. She has built up a loyal customer base and has very effective sales strategies. She buys bundles of new dresses, washes them, then goes out to sell them to customers around the neighborhood and sometimes at public administration buildings.

With this loan, she will buy more bundles of dresses, especially since Christmas is right around the corner.
  
After having received a previous loan, her sales sharply increased, and she saves a lot and makes a large profit. Her goal is to one day have a secondhand clothing store.

loans.use: to buy bundles of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Drianke Kaffo Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité drianké kaffo a été créé le 04/01/2010.Il est composé de 21 membres qui sont issus des villages environnants.Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.
Madame Penda qui se trouve à l’extrême droite sur la photo et levant le bras gauche,est la responsable du groupe.

Sa principale activité est le commerce de céréales.Elle achéte du mil qu'elle stocke pour le revendre une fois que les prix seront en hausse.

Elle dispose d'une parfaite expérience pour ce type d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué pendant plusieurs années.

Son prêt lui permettra  de s'approvisionner en céréales et faire face à la demande.

Son objectif est d'assurer les frais médicaux de ses enfants et leur scolarité.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Drianké Kaffo was created on January 4, 2010. It comprises 21 members who are from nearby villages. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Penda, who is found at the far right in the photo with her left hand raised, is the group's official. 

Her main business involves commerce in grains. She buys millet which she stocks up for resale once prices rise. 

She has excellent experience in this kind of business for having worked at it for several years. 

Her loan will enable her to stock up on grains and to cope with the demand.

Her goal is to cover her children's medical costs and their schooling.

loans.use: to buy grain

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 42-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children. He has been a farmer for the last 20 years, and is facing hardships of price fluctuations, inflation and unpredictable weather changes. However, he has a vision of hiring employees to help him expand his business and has applied for a loan to help him hire more laborers.

loans.use: to hire more laborers.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, a Palestinian young man, lives with his parents in a camp for Palestinian refugees located in North Lebanon. He is 27 years old, single and hard working as he wants to prepare for his own future.

Ahmad started working few years ago. He is a contractor in interior decoration projects, specializing in gypsum board. He already has a network of clients and handles multiple projects per month. His clients appreciate his honesty and professionalism, in addition to his delivering the work on time.

For the first time, Ahmad is asking for a loan of 2,827,983 Lebanese pounds from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. He needs to buy a car. In that way, he will be able to expand his area of activity by taking projects from another part of the camp or even from the city. The car will facilitate his transportation and decrease related costs.

Ahmad's main priority is to develop his business and to find a sustainable way to decrease his costs and increase his profit and income.

loans.use: To buy a new car and reduce transportation costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on stock

loans.name: Sokémawu

texts.en:
Sokemawu K. was born on July 2, 1977 in Logowome. He is married and the father of two. Orphaned upon the deaths of his parents, he could not complete the apprenticeship that he had started in auto mechanics. He managed to do all right by using the little savings he had to get his driver’s permit. He also had to work for three years during which he acquired a used car of his own with the help of a loan. The car allowed him to take care of two brothers, as well as his children. The car is totally amortized at this point. And after much maintenance and repair work, it is apparent that a new car is needed. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $1,200 as supplemental funds to buy a new car and to revitalize his business. The realization of this project is the only way to achieve the steady revenues needed to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by David Pigott and Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteers.

Marié et père de deux (02) enfants, Monsieur K. Sokémawu est né le 2 Juillet 1977 à Logowomé. Orphelin de père et de mère, il n’a pas pu terminer son apprentissage de mécanique à 4 roues qu’il avait commencé. Il s’est débrouillé avec le peu d’économie pour avoir son permis de conduire et a eu à travailler pendant 3 ans au cours desquelles il a pu bénéficier de crédit pour s’acheter sa propre voiture d’occasion qui permettait de prendre en charge en plus de ses enfants deux frères. Actuellement le véhicule est totalement amorti et après plusieurs entretiens et réparations, l’acquisition d’un nouveau s’impose. Il sollicite alors un crédit de $1200 qui sera un complément de fonds pour acheter une voiture neuve et relancer son activité. C’est seulement à partir de la réalisation de ce projet que la famille de Monsieur K. peut disposer de revenus réguliers et améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: Purchase of a new vehicle

loans.name: Crisoforo

texts.en:
Mr. Crisoforo was left without a job, following the closing of the company he worked for. Without success finding another job, he decided to open his own business in making photo albums (weddings and Sweet XV) and bibles. In October 2004, he began his business out of his house. As the business grew and there was the need for more space, he rented a space to allow him to provide a better service. Crisoforo has two children of 24 and 17 years of age who help him in the business.

In order to grow his production, he needs a loan for $925 dollars which he will use to purchase supplies and materials, needed to continue working and to be able to distribute his clients’ orders. He offers to repay the loan within 6 to 12 months. You can be an important part in the growth of this business and to improve the life of this family. They appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Crisoforo se quedo sin trabajo por el cierre de la empresa en la que laboraba, y como no encontraba otro trabajo, decidió emprender su propio negocio en la que hace álbum para bodas y XV años y biblias, en octubre del 2004, empezó en su domicilio y como estaba creciendo y necesitaba de más espacio, ahora renta un local para poder ofrecer un buen servicio y continuar creciendo, Crisoforo tiene dos hijos de 24 y 17 años que colaboran con él en su negocio.

Para incrementar su producción necesita de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los insumos que requiere para continuar trabajando y poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, él ofrece devolver este préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, y mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Working capital and to purchase supplies, materials/ Para capital de trabajo e insumos

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Ladislaa

texts.es:
Ladislaa is a woman with a strong entrepeneurial spirit. She is divorced, solely raising her child, who will be attending his second year of Veterinary school. At 47 years of age she works out of her small workshop where she performs all types of sewing and prepares garments for sale. Her excellent skill has brought on greater demand, which has led to a notable increase in work. Nowadays she works on larger quantities for companies and schools. With her sister's help, they manage to meet specific solicitations for jackets, uniforms, and athletic wear.

Since it is winter, people have solicited Ladislaa for jackets, and Ladislaa in turn asks for a loan to aquire fabric, thread, zippers, and buttons in great quantities so that she can begin working. She asks for a loan of 200 dollars, which she pledges to pay off on time.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Ladislaa es una mujer con un fuerte espíritu emprendedor. Ella es una mujer separada que crio sola a su hijo, que ya va al segundo año de la carrera de Veterinaria. Con sus 47 años de edad ella enfrenta la vida en su pequeño taller en donde realiza todo tipo de costuras y prendas para la venta. Gracias a su excelente labor, la demanda de su trabajo ha ido incrementandose notablemente. Hoy día ella realiza trabajos en grandes cantidades para empresas y colegios, ayudada de su hermana, reciben pedidos de camperas, uniformes y buzos (ropa deportiva para colegios).

Como estamos en invierno, ella ha recibo pedidos de camperas y solicita un crédito para adquirir telas, hilos, cierres y botones en grandes cantidades para poder empezar su labor, ella solicita $ 200 que se compromete a devolverlos puntualmente.

loans.use: To purchase zippers, buttons, fabric, and thread

loans.name: Savri

texts.ru:
Savri P. has been in the trade business for 13 years. She is married with 3 children and has a community college diploma. She started out by selling children’s clothing, with assets worth about $50. Gradually she moved on to selling men’s clothing. After getting her first loan, Savri increased the variety of her inventory (she added men’s sportswear), secured a better selling location and had her son also join the business to help out. Today her assets are worth twice what they were initially. Savri plans to increase her sales using the new loan.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Парпиева Саври вот уже 13лет занимается торговлей. Замужем, имеет троих детей, образование среднее специальное. Начала свою деятельность с продажи детской одежды, тогда её активы составляли 50$. Постепенно она перешла на продажу мужской одежды. После получения займа она увеличила ассортимент товара (добавила мужскую спортивную одежду), приобрела новое более лучшее место для торговли, также сын начал помогать своей матери в торговле. Сейчас её активы увеличились в два раза больше. В дальнейшем планирует увеличить товарооборот

loans.use: to increase sales/turnover

loans.name: Santos Dionicio

texts.es:
My name is Santos G. and I'm the owner of a grinder which we use to make dough for tortillas. We also grind coffee and cocoa, which are used for various drinks in my country. I'm requesting a loan to buy materials necessary to do mantainance on my shop. With the repairs I hope to increase the number of customers I have and increase my profits.

mi nombre es Santos G. y soy propietario de un molino en el cual fabrico la masa con la cual se elaboran tortillas, además muelo café y cacao con el cual preparan diferentes bebidas nacionales. Estoy solicitando el crédito para comprar los materiales necesarios para realizar el mantenimiento a mi local, Con las reparaciones espero incrementar el número de clientes y elevar mis ingresos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY SPARE PARTS FOR A GRINDER

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es:
Ruben is an animated young man filled with enthusiasm. He works hard preparing and selling food in a small space he rents. He has big plans and dreams to grow his business. Since he was very young, he learned a great deal about food preparation from his mother and that's why he decided to dedicate himself to this work. His goal is to have his own place where he can offer more comforts to his customers, and he'd like to buy a refrigerator so he can begin to offer cold drinks as well. He is very motivated to grow his business and increase his income. With his efforts, and your important contribution, he can reach his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva volunteer.

Rubén, es un joven lleno de optimismo y ánimo que se dedica íntegramente a la preparación y venta de comida en un puesto que alquila para este fin y que le ha proporcionado inmensos planes y deseos de superación. Él recibió desde niño muchas enseñanzas valiosas respecto a la cocina, razón por la que ha decidido dedicarse a esta actividad en su localidad, dándose de lleno y aplicando lo que aprendió gracias a su laboriosa madre. Su anhelo es tener su propio local para ofrecer mayores comodidades a su exigente clientela en el que pueda expender también bebidas frías con una refrigeradora que piensa comprar. Es por ello que con un corazón lleno de optimismo se esfuerza al máximo en la preparación de sus potajes para así mejorar los ingresos económicos de este año. Con su esfuerzo, dedicación y sobre todo nuestra importante contribución logrará la realización de cada uno de sus sueños.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A REFRIGERATOR SO HE CAN OFFER HIS CUSTOMERS COLD DRINKS ALONG WITH THE MEALS HE SERVES, GROWING HIS BUSINESS AND INCREASING HIS INCOME.

loans.name: Tariyel

texts.en: Tariyel is 30 years old, married, and has two children. He is a butcher at his own small meat store in the Sabirabad region. He began his business in 2005, and since then, his business has grown tremendously and brings his family support and income. Tariyel is currently applying for 1200 USD to improve his store conditions, and attract more customers.

loans.use: Going to improve his store conditions

loans.name: Thi Men

texts.vi:
Mrs. Mến, 28 years old, is married with two school age children. She and her husband both are carpenters. Their income is about 4USD a day. They have never had a loan with anyone and this is their first time. Having a loan with Binh Minh is convenient for them because they don’t have to travel far to get and pay money.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Mến, 28 tuổi, có 2 con còn đang đi học. Hai vợ chồng đều làm nghề mộc. Thu nhập hàng ngày của hai vợ chồng từ 50000-70000đ. Nói chung cuộc sống hơi vất vả, tuy vậy hai vợ chồng chưa đi vay vốn ở đâu cả. Nay, anh chị mạnh dạn vay 2006000đ của Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì thủ tục thuận tiện, anh chị lại không phải đi xa để nhận và trả tiền.

loans.use: Expand the wood shop

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Mrs. Chin N., 35, sells meat and vegetables at the Sarm Ki market in Phnom Penh City. Because of her business, she can now help pay her family’s expenses and pay for her children to go to school. She earns about $5 a day and has three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband, Mr. Kem Sokhorn, drives a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi and earns about $2 a day. To earn a living for their family, she and her husband work hard every day.

Chin is now asking for a loan of $600 to buy a store in Ek Reach II market in Phnom Penh City. This will enable her to move her meat and vegetables business to a better location.

Her husband is pictured in the photo because she was not available at the time the photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy a store to sell meat and vegetables

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Dr. Andrew O. (standing second left with clinic staff) is a general practitioner managing his own private facility in Kisumu, Kenya. He is 44 years old and lives with his wife and six school-aged children. He was employed by the government for the first three years of his career. He then worked at a private hospital for six years before starting his own practice in 1997. He ran his current facility on a part-time basis using it primarily for admissions, while his main practice remained in the center of town. He gradually focused his efforts on building a larger out-patient facility at this location and eventually shifted his client base here three and a half years ago. Besides general curative services and an observation ward, his facility offers a pharmacy, a laboratory and maternal and child health services. Dr. O. attributes his success to hard work, perseverance and assistance from KMET’s/KIVA's previous three microfinance loans. He has been able to expand his facility, increase the number of services he offers and improve the quality of care he provides. Dr. O. also carries a very good reputation from his many years of good work in Kisumu. His practice continues to grow as he attracts more corporate clients as well as private patients. Dr O. plans to purchase additional of drugs in bulk with US $1200 he has applied for.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock of drugs

loans.name: Erenia Cecilia

texts.es:
Erenia has working with our institution for 4 years and has obtained 6 loans that have been used as working capital. In her house one can see that she has improved her quality of life and that her business has expanded. She is married and her husband works in a security company and contributes to the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace cuatro años donde ha obtenido seis creditos los que a utilizado par capital de trabajo, en su casa se puede ver que ha mejorado condiciones de vida así como el crecimiento de su negocio ella es casada su esposa trabaja en una empresa de seguridad y colabora con los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Working capital - purchase of basic grains, candy, soft drinks, cosmetics and other products.

loans.name: Port

texts.en: Port S., 44 years old, lives in Kampong Cham Province where she has owned her farm since 1985. Both she and her husband are  traditional rice farmers, earning a little less than $3 per day combined. They have a large family of nine children, a necessity for rural farming families as children bring in much needed income once they can work and will care for the parents in their old age. Six of the children are still single, and only the oldest of this group currently works outside the farm, operating a motor-taxi for about $1.50 per day. Port S. hopes to support her next oldest son living at home to enter the same profession and is therefore requesting a loan to purchase a motor-bike for him.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Amia Sulemani

texts.en: Amia Sulemani S. is a 45-year-old resident of the town of Chanika. She is a seamstress who works at home, and has supported herself by doing this for the last 10 years. She specializes in making ladies clothing and needs a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
40-year-old Pili is married, with six children between the ages of 2 and 14. Since 2005, she has owned a small general store where she works from 6am to 6pm daily. She earns a monthly profit of $140 from her sales.

Pili now hopes for a loan to buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for business

loans.name: Amaka

texts.en:
Amaka N., 35, has been selling prepared foods and beverages in her restaurant for the past four years. She learned this business on her own. She is married, has four children, and lives in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria.

Amaka has used loans over the past three years to improve her business. She is requesting a new loan to purchase a larger inventory of drinks and food items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more beverages and food items for resale

loans.name: Zahar

texts.en: Zaher is 35 years old and the father of one child. Zaher lives in the Mount Lebanon region, near the town of Aley. A hairdresser by trade, Zaher owns a salon for women. Zaher believes that a confident vision for the future is essential to the success of his business, and has recently asked for a loan of $1000 improve the decoration of his salon, as well as to purchase several new salon chairs. Zaher is confident that these improvements will increase his client flow. Over his past four loan cycles, Zaher's honesty and punctuality with his payments have helped him earn the trust of Al Majmou's loan analysts.

loans.use: To help fund the purchase of new salon chairs and decoration for Zahar's salon.

loans.name: Abdou Salam

texts.fr:
Ce habitant de la banlieue Kandé de Ziguinchor s'active dans le secteur de la peinture. Avec son activité, Abdou Salam D. gagne son quotidien et arrive à entretenir son épouse et ses 3 enfants
Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des seaux de peinture et faire face à l'exécution de ses marchés
texts.en:
This inhabitant of the Kandé suburb of Ziguinchor works as a painter. With his little business, Abdou Salam D. earns his daily bread and manages to support his wife and his three children.

He is requesting this loan to buy some pails of paint so that he can fill his work orders.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying paint for his business

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhanh K. is 39 years old. She is married and mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school and she lives with her family in Krang Roung village in Takeo Province.

She is a rice farmer. Her husband, Mr. Nhoei Houy (on the left of the photo), is a construction worker. Since his work place is far from their house, he pays much money on transportation. He wants to buy a motorbike to go to work. Thus, Mrs. Nhanh K. is asking for a loan to add her savings to buy a motorbike for transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transportation to work.

loans.name: Edgar Antonio

texts.es:
El señor de nombre Edgar Antonio Sánchez tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es casado, este Señor tiene 2 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 32 años de edad trabaja por cuenta propia y su hija de 30 años que también labora por cuenta propia, su esposa labora como comerciante, sus deseos son de ampliar su negocio para seguir proporcionando a su familia ayuda económica ya que hasta los momentos con este negocio ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, en sus propósitos esta proporcionarle a su vivienda mejoras para que en un futuro sus hijos puedan tener un lugar digno donde vivir ya que todo lo que tiene es debido al arduo trabajo que ha realizado.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de reloj para mujer y para varón el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 15 años, la ubicación es de forma ambulante, el inicia este negocio por cuenta propia ya que Don Edgar poseía conocimientos de relojería y es así como el obtiene la experiencia en este campo y decide realizar la compra de reloj y venderlos al por mayor a sus clientes y así obtiene este tipo de negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de mas producto ya que a Don Edgar le resulta mas favorable la compra en los diferentes departamentos como Chinandega, Managua y Chichigalpa para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Edgar Antonio Sánchez is 53 years old, married and has 2 children, His oldest son is 32 years old and is self-employed and his daughter is 30 years old and also works on her own. His spouse works as a trader, their desires are to increase his business to continue providing his family with economic help because this business has helped the family move forward. It is in their plans to improve their home so that in the future their children will have a decent place to live, for all that they have is thanks to the hard work that he has done. The economic activity he is dedicated to is selling watches for women and men. He has owned his business for 15 years, it is located in a mobile cart. He began this business by himself because Mr. Edgar has contacts in the watch business and this is how he obtained the experience in this field and decided to purchase the watches and sell them to customers, and that's how he had this kind of business. The financing is for working capital that will be used for the purchase of more products because Mr. Edgar found it is more favorable to purchase in different regions such as Chinandega, Managua y Chichigalpa to satisfy the demand from his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Habil

texts.en: Habil is a very optimistic man in spite of the circumstances he has endured. He is 47 years old and married with five children. Habil raises cattle, and he uses his the income to support his family’s expenses. He has a great appreciation for animals, and Habil wishes to increase his cattle and therefore increase his earnings. He hopes that you can help him by funding his loan. You could become an important part of his family's life. Hobil deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merly A., 41, lives in a rural area of Barangay Cabisera 14-16, Ilagan, Isabela. Married to Rodolfo A., who works as the driver of a passenger jeep and maintains their farming business, they are blessed with a happy family life and hope to provide all six of their children, who range in age from 16 to one, with quality educations. 

Merly is requesting a loan for her mini-grocery store to purchase additional supplies of items such as sugar, coffee, milk, detergent and fragrance soap, rice, soft drinks, bottled and canned goods, etc. to satisfy her customers' needs. Her main purpose in seeking to improve the business is to better help her husband sustain the education of their children

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her store.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El Sr.Anibal es del Barrio Santo Domingo de Carapeguà  vive en concubinato con la Sra Ramona  Fleitas  viven en casa propia 

Es una persona muy trabajadora,  se le conoce por ser multifacético y  luchador  en todos los trabajos, ya que desde joven se  independizò de sus padres  para formar así su propio local de ventas de verduras y frutas.

En horario  de  la mañana el Sr Aníbal realiza  venta de  empanadas y otra comidas rápidas   para mas tarde atender en su  local de venta de frutas y verduras .Tambien  los fines de semana por las noches también realiza trabajo de mozo para encuentros sociales 

	Solicita el préstamo para la compra frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Anibal is from the Santo Domingo de Carapeguà neighborhood. He lives with Ramona Fleitas in common law marriage in their own home.

Anibal is a very hardworking person. He is known to be multifaceted, a fighter in all his work, as in his youth he sought independence from his parents to form his own fruit and vegetable sales business.

In the mornings, Anibal sells empanadas and other fast foods. During the afternoon, he works selling fruits and vegetables. On the weekends, during the evenings, he works as a waiter for social events.

He seeks this loan in order to buy fruits and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort G. is 47 years old. She is married and has four children, two boys and two girls. The first-born has completed junior high school and is trading. The rest are in senior high and basic schools. Her husband is a tailor by profession. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming.

Comfort trades in palm oil. She procures the palm oil from the producers in her community and distributes it. She distributes to customers who sell at retail and to food vendors. Comfort treks to nearby towns to sell. She wants a loan to procure palm oil in large quantities so that she can distribute to her increasing number of customers. She has been in this business for 13 years. She aspires to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Erdenebulgan

texts.en: Erdenebulgan L. is 29, married, and has a three year old daughter. His family lives in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian tent) district in Arhanghay, one of the Mongolian central provinces. In 2004, Erdenebulgan, along with his brother, started selling bricks to local construction companies. From the beginning, the business has been doing well. Business capital has increased from 200,000 MNT ($1 USD= 1,500 MNT) to 1.5 million MNT. Erdenbulgan dreams of owning a larger brick factory that can meet the needs of larger construction companies. He hopes his only daughter will acheive a high level of education. Erdenebulgan is requesting a loan to buy construction materials for his brick baking.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for brick baking

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: Maria Leticia O. G. vive en Soyapango departamento de San Salvador, junto a su mamá. Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa, en la cual también le ayuda su madre; el negocio lo tiene ubicado en la casa donde vive,  pero diariamente sale a ofrecer  y a distribuir mercadería en bazares de la zona, de San Salvador, Maria ya ha obtenido créditos en los cuales ha sido muy responsable en sus cuotas; ahora solicita un nuevo crédito,  porque quiere comprar mercadería para surtir su inventario de productos.
texts.en:
Maria Leticia O. G. lives with her mother in San Salvador's Soyapango neighborhood. She operates a business selling clothing in which, too, her mother helps her. The business is located in the house where she lives but she goes out every day to peddle her wares in markets around San Salvador. Maria has received loans before and has been very responsible in repaying them. Now she's applying for a new loan because she wants to buy merchandise to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Simona De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Simona es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 42 años de edad, reside en el barrio 25 de Febrero en la ciudad de Managua, con cuatros hijos, su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos y perfúmenes que inicio hace veintidós años, con dinero propio ya que vendía ambulante, ropa, zapatos, luego compro un vehiculo para movilizarse con la ventas, también comenzó ha hacer prestamos para incrementar su inventario. En Afodenic es su octavo ciclo y con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construccion
Sus planes es poder mejorar las condiciones de su casa ya que es muy sencilla de tabla y de zinc y necesita terminar de cerrarla para mejor seguridad de su famila.
texts.en:
Simona is a very hard working woman. She is 42, and she lives in the 25 de Febrero neighborhood in the city of Managua. She has four children. Her business is selling clothes, shoes, and perfume. She started her business twenty two years ago with her own money. She sold clothes and shoes door to door. Then she bought a vehicle to get around with her sales. She also started to get loans to increase her inventory. This is her eight loan cycle with Afodenic. With this loan she will buy construction materials. Her plans are to improve the conditions of her house. It is very simple; it is made of wooden planks and zinc sheeting. She needs to enclose it to make it more secure for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to enclose her house

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis E. sells CDs, VCDs, and cassettes. He sells in a store at the market square. Francis buys from Kumasi. He is 27 years old, single, and has no children. He lives alone in a rented apartment in Goaso in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Goaso is one of the busiest business centres in the region. He has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. He is hoping to expand his business and increase his profit margin.

loans.use: To buy CDs and cassettes

loans.name: Akpene

texts.fr: Akpene M. est une jeune femme de 29 ans, mariée et mèré d’un enfant. elle est détentrice d’un bar à Lomé. Depuis 3 ans, l’ambition d’Akpene est de créer un dépôt de boissons. Avec ce crédit, Akpene réalisera ses ambitions. Ce secteur est très prometteur à cause de la forte demande.
texts.en:
Akpene M. is a young woman, 29 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She has a bar in Lomé. For three years, her ambition has been to establish a beverages outlet. With this loan, she will realize her ambitions. This field is very promising due to the strong demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renovate and supply her business

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.en:
Originally from Colombia, Luz moved to Miami four years ago in hopes of establishing a life in the United States. She has 14 brothers and sisters, some of whom still live in Colombia, as well as two daughters. Luz is trying to learn English, so that she can start expanding her business outside of Spanish-speaking Miami. She tries to practice English daily with her clients.

Luz has always enjoyed the work of a seamstress and has successfully earned a very small monthly contract with a company that pays her to create clothing patterns. Luz’s work requires her to travel from Miami to places such as Illinois and Pennsylvania. To save on costly train and plane tickets, Luz will use her loan to purchase a car, so that she can get around to client meetings more easily and increase the efficiency of her business.

This is Luz's first loan from ACCION USA, and while it is small, it will help her build her credit so that she can borrow more in the future.

loans.use: A vehicle for her business

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Máximo es socio del Banco Comunal Morenita Huamanga.
Máximo es separado, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Máximo tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir llamado Confecciones M., actividad que realiza con el apoyo de personales, además vende telas.
Máximo necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Los sueños de Máximo son adquirir un local propio, aperturar sucursales en la región sur.
texts.en:
