Máximo is a member of the community bank Morenita Huamanga. He is separated, 50 years old, and has three children.

Máximo has a clothing workshop called "Confecciones M." (M. Clothing), a business he carries out with the assistance of staff. He also sells fabric.

Máximo needs a loan of 3000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of cloth. His dreams are to acquire his own shop, and open branches in the southern region.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: La Superación 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana P. (second from right) and four other members of La Superación are all seeking their very first loan with Esperanza.  Living on a hill just outsiD. of Samaná, Dominican Republic, Ana is anxious to start her very first business venture with this loan.  She plans to start a store which sells various sorts of food and drink, including chicken, vegetables, fruit and soft drinks.

Ana currently lives with her parents in a cramped home, with her two small children and another young cousin.  Looking into the future, Ana is hoping to proviD. for her children as they grow – they are currently just 2 years old and 8 months.  Currently planning on selling her wares from home, Ana seeks to one day have her own little store.  A home for her children, while still a goal some time in the future, is something she is already dreaming about.

I urge you to consider loaning to Ana and the others in her solidarity group.  All five of them have inspiring stories which have led them to take out their very first microloans.  It would be wonderful if you were to support these first-time entrepreneurs, discovering how to do business in the Dominican Republic.

For a list of all other Esperanza loans currently waiting for funding on Kiva, click on the following link:  Currently Fundraising Esperanza Loans.

Muchas gracias!

loans.use: chicken, vegetables, fruit and soft drinks

loans.name: Arselinda

texts.en:
Two years ago, Arselinda joined ASHI for a loan to start up a business of her own. At the age of 57 and with an unemployed husband, she needs to be productive to be able to support her two children, who do not have enough education and are 26 and 28. Before ASHI came into her life, Arselinda and her family succumbed to poverty. The income she had raising and selling goats wasn't enough for her to be able to finance her family's daily needs. Goat is not salable in the province and not as expensive when sold to people unless one has a large volume of goats for selling.

Through loans, she was empowered to start up another business fattening hogs in addition to her current business. This business gives her profits as much as double the capital. However, she wanted to request a much bigger loan to be able to grow her business further and to be able to make it more sustainable with larger profits. Arselinda also wants to reinvest her profits into opening a variety store in the next few years.

For her personal and family life, she wishes that she will be able to build a concrete house for better shelter.

loans.use: Will be used to finance a hog-fattening (pig-raising) business.

loans.name: Marible

texts.es:
La señora Maribel  pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan de Tahuaco”  que esta ubicado en la comunidad de San Juan de Tahuaco del distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 43 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 05, y estudio educación primaria completa, y vive en la comunidad de San Juan de Tahuaco.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años es una socia fundadora del Banco Comunal su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado porcino. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, con este préstamo la señora lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y ganado vacuno que vende en la feria de Yunguyo.

Su mayor deseo es dedicarse a la venta de ropa y poner su puesto en la Cuidad de Tacna y que sus hijos tengan una profesión.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maribel belongs to the community bank "San Juan de Tahuaco," which is located in the community San Juan de Tahuaco, Yunguyo district, Chucuito province, department of Puno. She is 43 years old, married, and a mother of five. She completed her primary education and lives in San Juan de Tahuaco. For years, Maribel has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement. She is a founding member of her community bank. Her first loan was for 300 soles for buying pigs. Currently she is asking for a loan of 2000 soles. With this loan, she will invest in buying clothes and cattle to sell in the Yunguyo market. Her biggest wishes are to work selling clothes and have a market stall in the city of Tacna, and she wants her kids to have a job. She likes parties and savings.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle and clothing

loans.name: Carla Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Carla del Socorro M. se ha destacado por ser una excelente trabajadora el cuál se dedica al negocio de la venta de comida siendo preparada por ella misma con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación.

Ella prepara deliciosos platillos y es por esto que las personas le buscan para adquirir los alimentos. Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito oportuno para la compra de la materia prima y de esta manera elaborar dichos alimentos.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima para elaborar alimentos

loans.name: Clenith

texts.es: La señora Clenith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Ángeles”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 34 años, 03 hijos que aun depende de ella.Clenith, a su edad aun se siente con fuerzas para seguir trabajando, ella se dedica a la venta de aguajes (Fruta típica de la Región). Manifiesta que con el negocio que ejerce se siente muy tranquila y contenta, es ella quien administra su negocio. Se siente muy capaz y responsable con las cuotas que debe pagar mensualmente al Banco Comunal.Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio,  es conocida en el barrio; ya que sale por los diferentes lugares de la Cuidad a vender sus aguajes. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará sacos de aguajes, para luego venderlos.Se siente orgullosa por haber logrado implementar su negocio, y asegurarse una vejez tranquila. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a superarse y a otras mujeres que quieren salir adelante y a defenderse como mujeres.

loans.use: Comprará sacos de frutas.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The client is 44 years old and single. She lives with her old mother and is the breadwinner for her family. She has been a tailor for ten years and has acquired a great deal of experience in the job. She is doing tailoring in order to make a living for herself and her mother. She requested this loan in order to buy a new sewing and knitting machine as well as some fabric and other supplies.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing and knitting machine, fabric and supplies

loans.name: Xiomara Isabel

texts.es: Xiomara started her clothing and cosmetics business six years ago in order to increase her household income. She is married and has three children, the older two are 21 and 17, and the youngest is eight. Because of her business she is able to support their educations. Her greatest dream is for her children to be able to continue with and complete their educations. Xiomara has a strong credit history with Fundación León 2000 and their financial support of her business has allowed her to improve her living conditions. Xiomara reports that the difficult economic situation challenges her business. She will use this loan to buy more clothing inventory.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 33 years old and married with three sons aged 7, 10, and 11. His wife is his partner in his business, a retail shop selling sugar, flour, fat, soap, and other items. He's been in this business since 1999 and also has a taxi business. Before starting his shop, he was a construction worker.

Thomas has successfully repaid two previous loans from Faulu and has requested this loan of Kes 80,000 to purchase bales of sugar and flour and crates of soft drinks.

Thomas describes himself as a hardworking entrepreneur and says that he has been able to expand his business to two shops since he joined Faulu. His hope for the future is to further expand his business into wholesale supply so that he can provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flour and crates of soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: La Nueva Luz Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. J., TIENE 41 AÑOS, ES CASADA, TIENE 3 HIJOS. ELLA ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO "LA NUEVA LUZ",DONDE SE DESEMPEÑA COMO SECRETARIA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA. ESTE GRUPO ESTA FORMADO POR SIETE INTEGRANTES RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA DE SANTA ROSA EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS.
LA SRA J. SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCIÓN DE PRENDAS INTIMAS, SU NEGOCIO TIENE COMO NOMBRE "CONFECCIONES ZEFLOR" EL CUAL FUNCIONA EN SU DOMICILIO.
NOS COMENTA QUE ELLA INICIÓ SU NEGOCIO, DEBIDO A LA NECESIDAD DE APOYAR ECONÓMICAMENTE EN LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES SOBRETODO CUANDO SU ESPOSO SE QUEDABA TEMPORALMENTE SIN TRABAJO.
AL INICIO EMPEZÓ TRABAJANDO EN UNA EMPRESA. LA EXPERIENCIA RECIBIDA DE SU MADRE Y LO APRENDIDO EN LA EMPRESA EN LA QUE TRABAJABA,ELLA DECIDIÓ INDEPENDIZARSE.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN MATERIALES PARA INCREMENTAR LA MERCADERÍA DE SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
J. is 41, married, and has three children. She is a member of La Nueva Luz group. She is secretary of the governing board. This group is comprised of seven members who are residents of the Santa Rosa Zone in the Comas district. J. makes intimate wear. Her business is called Confecciones Zeflor, and it is in her house. She tells us that she started the business because of the necessity to help with the family expenses, especially when her husband was temporarily out of work. She started working in a company. With the experience she received from her mother, and with what she learned in the company, she decided to become independent. The loan she is asking for is to buy materials to increase the merchandise in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Armie

texts.en:
Armie A. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Armie owns and operates a bakery, baking and selling bread in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Armie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. Armie is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: La Fe 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Rosaura is the coordinator of her loan group, which is called "La Fe" (The Faith). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the Samana Peninsula, a lush, rugged area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water is not potable and electricity is unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure. She is a single mother with 8 children.

Rosaura is excited to be taking her sixth loan from Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to expand her clothing business by purchasing skirts, shoes and pants to sell to her well-developed clientele, and a sewing machine to do alterations and repairs. She will use the profits to purchase food for her children, and a computer for them to learn on. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Skirts, pants and shoes to sell and a sewing machine

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Mr. Thou U. is a villager who lives in Prey Chheu Teal village, Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Tei Pet, sells groceries where she can earn a littler income to support her family. Mr. Thou U. is a hardworking man with his farming. 

In order to improve his living situation and to support his wife's business, Mr. Thou U. would like to make a loan of 1,000,000 Riel from AMK. The loan will be used to bU. more groceries to enlarge his wife grocery shop to meet customer requirements and to improve their income. His wife is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Fatimo

texts.en:
Fatimo runs a barbering salon with a viewing center where people gather to watch football matches in same arena. She also sells drinks. She buys drinks in bulk and sells them retail and has been in this business since 2005.

Fatimo is 51 years old, married, and has six children. With the business she is able to assist her husband in supporting the household. She further said they intend to renovate their building, which forms part of where she runs her business, though her profit.

Fatimo is requesting the loan amount of NGN 120,000 to buy more drinks to sell. She expresses her appreciation to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Gloria is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Gloria raises crops. The main source of income for her business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Gloria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence buys and sells kerosene at retail prices to her customers. She gets kerosene directly from the depot as she is a big dealer and has been in this business since 2000.

Florence is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to buy more kerosene to sell. With part of her profit and what her husband brings home they are able to clothe and feed the family and also take care of their house rent as they are yet to have a building of their own.

Florence is 48 years old and is married with six children. She expresses her gratitude to all lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi M. sells slippers at Abura. Esi has received senior high education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a welder. She helps her husband in providing food, clothing and shelter for her family. Her loan will be used to buy more slippers for sale. She hopes to use the new income from her business to save to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: buy more slippers for sale

loans.name: Leilla

texts.en:
Leilla S. is 40 years old, widowed, and has two children who go to school. She is currently in the business of selling bread and charcoal at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal. With the extra profits from her loan, Leilla hopes to build up a restaurant.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Gladys Del Carmen

texts.es: Gladys Del Carmen tiene 39 años, su actividad es la venta y elaboración de repostería. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella dio inicio porque no tenía un trabajo estable, por lo que tenía que mantener a sus 2 hijos, que son menores de edad. Ella se levanta desde la 5 mañana para la elaboración y la venta la realiza por la tarde ella es una persona muy dedicada en su trabajo. Este financiamiento lo realiza para la compra de azúcar, leche, manteca, harina y queso. Su deseo es establecer otra panadería como fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Gladys Del Carmen is 39 years old. Her activity is making and selling pastries. She has been in this business for more than 18 years. She started because she didn't have a stable job and she had to support her 2 children, who are minors. She gets up at 5 in the morning to make the pastries and she sells in the afternoon. She is very dedicated to her job. This financing is to buy sugar, milk, shortening, flour and cheese. She wants to establish another bakery as an income source.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marco Aurelio

texts.es:
el señor Marco Aurelio D. S. tiene 37 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de achineria, vive en union libre con la señora Maria S. Mejia con quien a procreado 4 hijos. tambien tienen una pulperia en su casa de habitacion la cual es atendida por Maria Mejia.

poco a poco han ido mejorando su condicion de vida para el y la de su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para surtir el negocio ya que en esta epoca el pueblo tiene una actividad donde las ventas se mejoran, muchas personas vienen de varios pueblos aledaños a comprar cosas.
texts.en:
Marco Aurelio D. S. is 37 years old, and has a business selling low-cost consumer goods. He lives in a common-law marriage with Maria S. Mejia, with whom he has fathered 4 children. In addition, he has a grocery store in his home which is attended to by Maria Mejia. Gradually he has been improving the living conditions of his family. This loan will be used to restock his store, since in this season this town has an activity where the sales increase; many people come from the various surrounding towns to buy things.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy calculators, cellular phone cases, chargers, toys, batteries, deodorants, dolls, hats, colas

loans.name: Anjou

texts.fr: Monsieur Anjou N. est un animateur en music de  37 ans. Il exerce parallèlement  l’activité  de ventes d’appareils de portables téléphoniques. Il s’est lancé dans cette activité par passion. Il habite à Daroukhoudosse, il est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis mars 2004 et a déjà  bénéficié  de 6 prêts  antérieurs. C’est durant les fins de mois que son activité  marche le plus. Monsieur N. emprunte 300 000 frs dans l’objectif de renforcer son stock de portables et accroitre ses bénéfices. Ce crédit  pourra constituer une solution  à son souci de financement de son activité. Ainsi il pourra renforcer le soutien qu’il  assurait a ses parents et amis qui sont plus demunis.
texts.en:
Mister Anjou N. is a 37 year old disc jockey. At the same time, he sells mobile phones. He started this business out of passion. He lives in Daroukhoudosse. He has been a member of the Baye Laye credit institution since March 2004 and has already received 6 loans in the past. His activity is most successful at the end of each month. Mister N. is borrowing 300,000 francs in order to build up his supplies in mobile phones and increase his profits. This loan could help him solve his activity’s financing problems. He will thus be able to provide better support for his parents and friends who are worst off.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor pertenece al Banco Comunal Despertar hace 1 año y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro.
Flor es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Flor vende salchipollos de manera ambulante en el mercado de las Américas, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 3 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche, negocio que inicio hace 5 años, por las mañanas se encarga del cuidado de sus hijos. Solicita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de aceite, cremas, gas y papa.
Su sueño es educar a sus hijos y tener casa propia porque vive en casa alquilada.
texts.en:
For the past year, Flor has been a member of the Communal Bank, Despertar, and what appeals to her most are the savings incentives. Flor is married and has got 2 children that attend school. Flor sells salchipollos (a dish that consists of shredded chicken or hotdog served over french fries) at the Las Américas market, a job that she does every day from 3 in the afternoon until 10 at night. She began this business five years ago. In the morning, she takes care of her children. She is applying for a loan of 1500 soles which she plans to invest in the purchase of oil, sauces, gas, and potatoes. Her dream is to educate her children and have her own house, since she is currently renting hers.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase oil, sauces, potatoes and gas.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha U. is from the village of Macabibo, Baliangao. She is 58 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Editha is engaged in weaving of "nipa", a native leaf, to sell. She has been operating her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 2000.00 a month. While her husband provides for their daily needs from his fishing business.

In 2005, Editha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Editha is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase housing materials. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Editha from PMPC. 
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials.

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en:
Romelyn E. is from the village of D'ban Calamaba, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Romelyn has a business making and selling breads, cakes and hotcakes. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Romelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her baked goods. This will be the first loan taken out by Romelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her baked goods

loans.name: Aura Dilia

texts.es: La señora Aura Dilia A. R., tiene la edad de 32 años , habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo el cual trabaja en una funeraria como vendedor , para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ya que ellos tienen dos pequeños varoncitos que estudian la primaria y necesitan del apoyo económico de sus padres para que puedan seguir estudiando , la señora  Alemán desde hace cinco años labora como domestica en una casa privada , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de recursos  económicos para poder comprar de  una sola vez materiales de construcción pero con mucho esfuerzos ha ahorarrado para una parte del material y lo que quieren es terminar de construir una pared de la vivienda para poder tener mas espacio y tener mas comodidad, para el goze de los miembrod e su familia.
texts.en:
Aura Dilia A. R. is 32 years old. She lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe together with her husband, who works in a funeral home as a vendor. She contributes with her husband towards the household expenses especially because they have two young boys in primary school and they want to keep them in school. For the past five years Mrs. A. has worked in the private house cleaning industry. The greatest challenge that she faces is the insufficient financial resources to purchase construction materials. She has saved enough to be able to purchase part of the materials they need to finish building a wall in their home, to have more space and greater comfort and enjoyment of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall in her home.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry G.'s main source of income comes from operating a tricycle transport services. He is 32 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. Jerry has been in his business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Jerry joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Jerry is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle for better service

loans.name: Sulima

texts.en:
Sulima D. C. joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc., (ASHI), a partner MFI (microfinance institution) of Kiva in the Philippines, in the year 2005. She is one of the reputable members of ASHI in her town. She is married to Nestor, who is a fisherman and sometimes a driver. They have three children: a 29-year-old construction worker, a 21-year-old factory worker and a 16-year-old high school student. 

The main source of their family income is fishing and a secondary source comes from selling barbecue sticks. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos to finance construction of a pump boat that her husband will use in his fishing activity. They will buy materials and a new motor to complete the building of the boat. 

Her business plan after this loan is to invest capital in putting up fish cages to increase the fish catch. She hopes that Kiva friends will continue their financial support to her for the benefit of her family and grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy materials and a motor for the construction of a pump boat

loans.name: Yulbe

texts.es:
Yulbe, es un hombre alegre y trabajador de 35 años, que vive con Jarid de 24 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos menores, Yens, de 5 y Zian de 9 meses; a los que cuidan y educan en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad nativa de Centro Pumpuriani). Cuando tenía 19 años, Yulbe comenzó su camino por la agricultura, con el tiempo fue adquiriendo mucha experiencia, sobre todo, en las técnicas de cultivo. En sus sembríos de café, plátano, maíz híbrido y yuca, aplica todo lo aprendido; ahora está poniendo en práctica unos viveros de café; con ello podrá renovar sus plantaciones, con unas nuevas y de esa manera obtener sembríos de mayor calidad. Ahora Yulbe, es uno de los mejores productores de café, en su localidad, es reconocido por su trabajo y constantemente los compradores mayoristas visitan sus terrenos agrícolas para poder negociar sus productos. En adelante el está él está pensando comprar más terrenos de cultivo, con los que podrá ampliar sus sembríos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y está agradecido con su banco comunal, ya que sin su apoyo no podría sembrar en mayor cantidad y calidad; afirma. 
Yulbe, podrá comprar con el crédito obtenido 900 mamones (plantas para el sembrío de plátanos), como también en el pago de los peones que atienden su vivero de café.
texts.en:
Yulbe is a happy man and worker of 35 years of age, that lives with Jarid, age 24, with whom he has 2 small children; Yens, age 5 and Zian, age 9 months.  They take care of the children and educate them in their own house located in the Peruvian forest (native community of Centro Pumpuriani).  

When he was 19 years old, Yulbe began his road in agriculture.  In time he acquired a lot of experience, above all in the techniques of cultivation.  In his sown fields of coffee, banana, hybrid corn and yucca, he applies all that he learned.  Now he is putting in practice some coffee fields. With this he will be able to renew his plantations with a new crop and in that way obtain fields of greater quality.  

Now Yulbe, is one of the better producers of coffee in their locality.  He is recognized for his work and the wholesale buyers constantly visit his agricultural lands to be able to negotiate for his products.  Going forward, he is thinking of buying more lands for cultivation so that he will be able to expand his sown fields.  

This is his fifth loan with MFP and he is grateful to his communal bank, since, without its support, he would not be able to sow in greater quantity and quality, he affirms.  With the loan requested Yulbe will be able to buy 900 young banana plants (for sowing a field of bananas) and also to pay the laborers that tend his coffee fields.

loans.use: To buy 900 banana plants and to hire labor to tend his coffee crop.

loans.name: Telesfora

texts.en:
Telesfora is a member of the Communal Bank group "Pink Women", located in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, and in the department of Puno. She is 58 years old and married with seven children. She has no formal education.

Telesfora has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. Her first loan in the amount of 300 PEN allowed her to fatten small animals such as sheep and pigs. 

She is now asking for a loan of 500 PEN to increase the capital of her business so she can fattening sheep and to breed pigs. 

Her dream is to grow her business and to see her children secure jobs. What she likes about the Communal Bank is working in a group with joy.

loans.use: Increasing in her business of fattening livestock (sheep) and breeding pigs

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
La Sra. Epifania S. Benegas de 38 años de edad, es comerciante desde hace mas de 6 años, tiene una despensa bien surtida desde hace más de 3 años. 
Solicitó el crédito para aumentar la cantidad de mercaderías para la venta en su despensa, donde atiende a una gran cantidad de clientes, mas en los días viernes, sábados y domingos.
Nos comenta que gracias al primer crédito que retiró de la Fundación Paraguaya, ha logrado aumentar de manera progresiva la cantidad de mercaderías puestos para la venta y de esa manera aumentó aún más sus ingresos. Con estas ventajas asegura que logrará mejorar su calidad de vida  y de su familia. Comenta que día a día seguirá trabajando con mucho esfuerzo para lograr todos sus objetivos
texts.en:
Mrs. Epifania S. Benegas, 38, has been a merchant for over 6 years; she has had a well-stocked store for over three years.

She asked for a loan to increase the amount of merchandise to sell in her store where she takes care of a large number of customers, more on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays.

She comments that thanks to the first loan she got from Fundación Paraguaya she has been able to progressively increase the amount of goods for sale thus increasing her income.  She assures us that these advantages will make it possible for her to improve her family’s quality of life.  She comments that she will continue to work every day with much effort to reach all her goals.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, milk and canned goods.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila T. is from the village of Villa Marzo Cordon. She is 63 years old, married, and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Leonila owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport in the local community. Leonila has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Leonila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase equipment to improve the business. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Leonila from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: 66- Thôn 8 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Tân Vũ Thị (12) is a 51 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Tân is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 66-Thôn 8-Quảng Hưng (18.8.66 Quảng Hưng).


Tân is married and has 3 adult children.  To making a living, Tân owns & operates a business raising livestock, primarily cattle, for sale.  Tân has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Tân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Tân is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,787,900 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Tân from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tân plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. Thị Hồng (13) is a 51 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  T. Thị Liên (14) is a 65 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Lê Thị Quế (15) is a 55 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

4.  N. Thị Tuyến (16) is a 29 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5.  T. Thị Hương (17) is a 24 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

6.  M. Thi Trông (18) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

7.  P. Thị Thuỷ (19) is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Tân Vũ Thị (12) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Tân là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 66 -Thôn 8- Quảng Hưng (18.8.66 Quảng Hưng).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Tân thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tân kiếm được khoảng 1000000 VND.  Vào 2010, Tân đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tân đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,787,900 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  N. Thị Hồng (13) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5787900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  T. Thị Liên (14) là 65 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5787900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3.  Lê Thị Quế (15) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5787900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

4.  N. Thị Tuyến (16) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5787900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

5.  T. Thị Hương (17) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5787900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

6.  M. Thi Trông (18) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5787900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

7.  P. Thị Thuỷ (19) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5787900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 31 years old and has a common-law husband and one child. She is a street vendor who makes and sells silver jewelry: bracelets, necklaces, and rings.  She is requesting the loan to purchase more inventory and raw materials to support her business. Justina is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her jewelry business

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees lives in Depalpur, a small city of Pakistan that is known for its dairy industry. She has lived there for many years with her family in the area named Khalilabad. Bilqees has given birth to two sons and a daughter. 

Her husband’s name is M. Y., and he is a tailor by profession. He is expert in sewing men’s clothes and known for his good quality work in the region. 

Bilgees is a very talented lady who does embroidery work, mainly for her neighbors. She has been doing this business for more than 10 years. Now she wants to introduce her work to different customers as well.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her embroidery business. She will hire a worker who will collect orders from different boutiques and clothes-selling shops. With the loan, she will buy supplies such as cloth, beads and colored thread in bulk. Then she will fulfill the orders on time and increase her sales. 

Her elder son also does embroidery. He learned this art from Bilqees and helps her in completing the orders on time. Her second son is a driver by profession. Her daughter is 11 years old and stays at home. Bilqees couldn’t provide her children a good education due to financial constraints.
 
Bilqees is very hopeful that an investment will take her business to a more profitable position and will help her manage her household expenses better. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy supplies for embroidery business

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She has electricity, but not piped water, in her house. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a grocery shop, selling vegetables, tomatoes and onions. Her customers are neighbours and passersby.  In her business, Phanice faces the major challenges of seasonality and delayed payments by creditors. She hopes to open another business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and onions for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Mrs. Bou Naom Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. B. N., born in 1985, is a village group bank loA. president, selected by its twelve members. They will use their individual portions of the loA. in various ways to support their families in Thkov village, Takeo province. Mrs. B. N. is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family; her husband, Mr. Pheap BA., is a vice village chief and construction worker who also earns some money to help. She wants to breed cows, but her saved money is not enough so Mrs. B. N. is applying for a loA. to buy a cow to start her breeding business. This couple has a three-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer Rodríguez definitivamente es un hombre muy feliz,  que siempre tiene proyectos en su mente,  su  anterior plan de inversión fue adecuar su puesto de trabajo con pintura y una publicidad que le ayude a identificar mas, la compra de materiales para la remodelación y elaboración de calzado pero adicionalmente se dio a la tarea de comprar calzado de marca y vender lo también, esto fue lo que justamente hizo con su anterior credikiva. En la actualidad está solicitando su segundo crédito por esta misma línea  porque va a comprar materias primas para elaborar calzados en consonancia con la temporada de carnaval que se avecina y comprará calzado para comercializarlos también porque le fue muy bien con que vendió en su anterior inversión. “Gracias por el apoyo brindado y la oportunidad de un nuevo crédito” este es un mensaje que Wilmer quiere hacer llegar a sus financiadores de Kiva mediante este medio.
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Wilmer bien puede ingresar al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/170483
texts.en:
Wilmer Rodríguez is definitely a happy man who is always thinking up new projects.  His previous investment plan was to improve his sales stall with paint and advertising to help it stand out more, to purchase materials to repair and make shoes, and additionally he took on the task of purchasing brand name shoes to sell.  That is precisely what he did with his last credikiva loan.  Currently he is requesting a second loan through this same line because he is going to purchase raw materials for shoe making, in keeping with the approaching carnaval season.  And he will purchase shoes for re-sale as well because he did very well with those sales with his last investment.  "Thank you for the help you have offered and the opportunity for a new loan" is the the message that Wilmer wants to send to his Kiva financial backers.
If you would like to learn more about Wilmer's story, click on the following link:
http://kiva.org/lend/170483

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and supplies for shoe making.

loans.name: Lodivina Abrenilla's Group

texts.en:
Lodivina A. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21, Ilagan,Isabela. She is 35 years-old. Lodivina is the group leader of a five member group loan offered by Kiva partner ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lodivina is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Lodivina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lodivina has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Lodivina joined  Kiva partner ASKI in order to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lodivina is requesting a new loan of 32,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the firstt loan taken out by Lodivina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is a fishmonger from the village Ntranoa, near the fishing town of Elmina. Her income is used to provide for her household of five children. Rose wants to expand her business and will use the requested loan to purchase larger quantities of fish to sell. She plans to reinvest the profits back into her business for further growth, as well as save up for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of fish to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma M. is 46 years old and has five children.  

Alma is a vegetable farmer in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Alma has been vegetable farming for 19 years now and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Alma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Davlatbibi

texts.ru: Саидова Давлатбиби проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем, имеет 4 детей. Ее муж работает в России. Сама она занимается шитьем национальных платьев. У нее среднее образование. Она берет заказы на дому. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит просит для покупки тканей, чтобы сшить платья для продажи.
texts.en: Davlatbibi S. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children. Her husband works in Russia. She works sewing traditional dresses. She has a secondary education. She takes orders at home. She has been doing this work for three years. She is taking out a loan to buy fabrics to sew new dresses for sale.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sew new dresses.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
For the past 10 years, Agnes B. has been selling kenkey to make a living. (Kenkey is a popular Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize dough, usually eaten with pepper sauce and fried fish). 

She is married to a farmer and her income helps pay for their three children’s school fees.
 
Agnes wants to increase her earnings and plans to do so by increasing the production and sale of kenkey. Her Kiva loan will allow her to purchase more maize and other ingredients. 

She plans to reinvest any extra earnings back into her business for further growth. 

On the floor, on her right is a bundle of plantain leaves for the kenkey. On her left is the container she uses to boil the kenkey.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and other ingredients.

loans.name: Gulsada's Group

texts.en:
Gulsada is the treasurer of this group. She is 48 and is married to a farmer. Together they have raised a daughter and a son. The daughter, 26, is handicapped and the son, 23, helps his parents with housework. The family has been engaged in cultivating agricultural products since 1993. By selling part of the harvest Gulsada earns 3,000 soms each month. With the loan she wants to purchase 200 liters of fuel, which is needed for work in her field. She will use part of the loan to hire labor. In the future Gulsada hopes to obtain a good harvest. She wants to make some money to improve her family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and hire labor for field work

loans.name: Nelson Ernesto

texts.es: Nelson  Ernesto de 40 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su esposa y dos hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Para Nelson la Familia lo es todo y día a día lucha por darles lo mejor. Durante toda su vida ha trabajado duramente en una pequeña carpintería que con mucho esfuerzo  ha logrado instalar en su casa  de  habitación.  Sus productos son muy demandados por que para él lo más importante es que los clientes estén satisfechos con el producto que solicitan, por tanto Nelson  se esmera por dar un producto de buena calidad y de dar la atención que el cliente se merece. Últimamente ha notado un pequeño aumento en la demanda de sus productos  y como todo hombre emprendedor no quiere dejar pasar la oportunidad, ha decidido solicitar este crédito para poder cubrir esa demanda que cada día es más grande. Con el crédito piensa comprar variedad de madera, clavos,  hierro y las herramientas necesarias para poder trabajar en los productos que el elabora. Con todo esto espera aumentar  el nivel de ventas que le permitan obtener mayores ingresos y con esto ´poder aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nelson Ernesto, 40, lives in his own house with his wife and two children who are in school.  For Nelson, the family is everything and he struggles daily to provide them with the best.  All his life he’s worked hard in a small carpentry shop that he was able to set up at home with much effort.  His products are in high demand and it is very important to him that his customers are satisfied.  Because of this, Nelson strives to provide a good quality product and provide the customers with the kind of service he deserves.  He has noted a small rise in demand recently and, like all enterprising men, does not want this opportunity to go to waste so has decided to request this loan to cover demand which grows daily.

He plans to use the loan to buy wood, nails, metal and the tools needed to work on the products he manufactures.  He hopes all this will help him increase sales levels that will lead to high income and thus hope for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy assorted lumber, nails, metal and tools.

loans.name: Piñafor

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; El socio vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

El socio Piñafor; tiene 35 años de edad; la socia es casado; el socio tiene 5 hijos, el socio se dedica a la compra y venta de carne al por mayor, el socio trabaja comprando ganados vacunos del camal del poblado, el luego los troza o los vende según sea el pedido de los diferentes clientes, el socio les provee carne al por mayor y es bien conocido en el pueblo. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de carne al por mayor.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "SR. DE TAYANCANI".  He lives in the district of Ocongate in the province of Quispicanchis in the department of Cusco.

Mr. Piñafor, 35, is married and has five children.  He buys and sells meat wholesale.  His work involves buying cattle from the village herd which he later butchers and sells on an order basis to customers, as he is well-known in the village.  He is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale meat.

He is very grateful for the loan which will allow him to incease business and improve his lifestyle.  He is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale meat.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Benkadi 3 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kantela, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KOROTOUMOU, qui est debout au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,9 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women, who average 33 years of age an 2 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kantela, one of the villages in the Commune of Massigui, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of Mali).

In order to better organize their business as the rainy season begins, they work with Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. Their crops include, among others, rice and peanut. They are seeking their fifth loan from Soro Yiriwaso.

With this new loan, Korotoumou (standing in the middle) intends to buy fertilizers and small tools, and to pay the cost of plowing and weeding to maintain about 0.9 hectare of pearl millet and peanut fields.

After the harvest, the production is sold in Massigui to a clientele comprising both men and women. The members of the group intend to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 100) during the season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicide, and small tools, and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: María Ercila

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive por la comunidad de Nabon, esta comunidad es de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, mucha de su población labora en la ciudad.

La Señora. María tiene 41 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos de 23, 19, 17, 14, 11, 8 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija es casada e independiente, sus cuatro hijos siguientes sufren de discapacidad ya que son sordo mudos y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora como albañil, tienen casa propia pero ya está muy deteriorada.

Doña María se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, lo que siembra es para su consumo y para la venta. También se dedica a la cría de cuyes, gallinas y ganado a  los que los vende en su comunidad.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes gallinas, ganado y alimento de animales.

Su sueño es tener una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Mas Que Vencedoras", meaning "More Than Victorious". She lives in the outskirts of the city of Azogues. The city possesses a beautiful architecture and its people maintain their culture and traditions. They are very kind and charismatic people.

Maria is 41 years old, married, and from her relationship she has conceived 7 children. They are 23, 19, 17, 14, 11, 8, and 6 years old. Her eldest daughter is married and independent. Her next four youngest children are disabled, being deaf mutes. The two youngest children attend school in the sector. Her husband is a bricklayer. They own their own house but it is much deteriorated.

Maria works in agriculture. And the harvest is for their consumption and to sell. She also raises guinea pigs, poultry, and cattle. She sells them in her community. 

She is on her third loan with her communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of guinea pigs, poultry, cattle, and livestock feed.

Her dream is to have a better home.

loans.use: to purchase poultry, guinea pigs, cattle, and livestock feed.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is 33 years old, married and has two sons. Both of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Her husband is a government employee and Robina operates a grocery store adjacent to her home where she sells grocery such as spices, sugar, cooking oil, etc. at very reasonable prices. She started this business to help her husband financially as his income is not enough to fulfill the needs of his family. 

Robina is also a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities and also takes care of her children very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her grocery business that will allow her to fill the needs of her customers and increase her profits. 

She has been operating her business for the past two years and is confident that an investment will be profitable for her and help her establish her business.  She is a new loan applicant and very hopeful about her business future.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery store business.

loans.name: Salameh

texts.en:
Salameh is a 52-year-old man, who is married and has six sons and four daughters. He works as a taxi driver and also, one of his sons works in the field of telecommunications. Salameh has one of his sons studying in the university, and he needs to cover his son's university fees, but the money he has is not enough to cover them. So Salameh needs to take a loan of $600. 

As Salameh gets a FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will pay the fees and his son will able to continue his university education smoothly.  Salameh is keen to have all of his sons educated, so they can have a better social level in the community, improve the family sources of income, and live in better conditions.

loans.use: To pay the university fees for his son.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elsa de 48 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias y tiene un hijo de 22 años de edad. Desde allí maneja su propio negocio de variedades, donde vente accesorios femeninos, artículos para el hogar, cosméticos, colonias, ropa entre otras mercancías. Su negocio está ubicado en una parte de la sala de su casa, e inició para generar ingresos para el hogar, pero muy pronto se convirtió en su proyecto de vida y está entusiasmada haciéndolo crecer con su trabajo y ofreciendo un buen servicio. Ella vende en su miscelánea de contado y también maneja créditos; aunque el valor sus activos fijos no es elevado, su negocio presenta una buena rentabilidad sobre las ventas  y una rotación de su cartera acorde con la actividad que ejerce. Su clientela ha ido creciendo y en la actualidad se acerca la celebración del amor y de la amistad, época en la cual repuntan las ventas durante todo el mes, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para atender la gran demanda de pedidos que desde ya, han hecho sus clientes, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará mercancías bajo pedidos, papelería, detalles de amor y de amistad, sandalias, accesorios  y toda la mercancía de mayor rotación en su negocio. Elsa cuando inició su negocio era una pequeña chaza donde vendía solo dulces, por solicitud de un cliente vendió una plancha y de inmediato empezó a agregar otras mercancías que gradualmente ofreció a sus vecinos, amas de casa, familiares y amigos, que aun son sus clientes y que han referido nuevos compradores; así mismo con las ganancias productos de su disciplina y trabajo fue comprando sus vitrinas y ordenando lo que hoy es su gran variedad, con la que tiene muchos sueños por los cuales se esmera día a día.
texts.en:
Elsa is 48 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias. She has a 22-year-old son. Elsa manages her own variety store where she sells women’s accessories, household goods, cosmetics, colognes, clothing and other merchandise. Her business is located in a section of the living room of her house. Elsa started this business so that she could generate household income, but it quickly became her mission in life. She is excited about growing in her work and offering good service. Elsa sells her products for cash, but she also extends credit. Even though the value of her fixed assets has not increased, her business generates good profitability from her sales and a high product turnover. Her customer base has increased because the celebration of love and friendship (the Colombian equivalent of Valentine’s Day) is in progress. During this time, her sales rebound throughout the entire month and she acquires new customers.

For this reason, she is applying for a Kiva loan. Elsa will use the money to buy merchandise for her outstanding orders such as stationery, Valentine and friendship cards, sandals, accessories, and other products that have high turnover. When she started her business, Elsa only sold candy from a small space. She then received a request from a customer who wanted to buy an iron, so she gradually began offering other merchandise to neighbors, housewives, relatives, and friends. Her customers have even referred new buyers to her. As a result of disciplined work, Elsa used her earnings to buy display cabinets and order more goods to achieve the wide variety that she offers today. Every day she strives to achieve her many dreams.

loans.use: to buy stationery, Valentine and friendship cards, sandals, accessories, and other products that have high turnover.

loans.name: Kidindimya Tweyambe Group

texts.en: Mary is a member of the Kidindimya Tweyambe group. In this group, each member guarantees one another in accessing a loan. Mary lives in her own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is 31 years old and is charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children since her husband has no job. She dreams of educating her children. For four years she has been rearing cattle. In a day she earns 10000 from milk sales. Her hardship is low output during the dry season. Her dream is to have at least 30 cows. Mary intends to buy cows with the loan.

loans.use: to buy cows for rearing.

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es: Vilma tiene 52 años de edad es casada y tiene 6 hijos los cuales 02 de ellos dependientes ya que están en etapa escolar. Ella trabaja como enfermera en un Centro de Salud, la cual lleva más 10 años laborando en dicho rubro, poco a poco y con esfuerzo Vilma pudo iniciar su negocio propio, actualmente cuenta con una  bodega que instalo  en su vivienda, gracias a su esfuerzo Vilma a podido ayudar a sus hijos  en su educación, con la idea de superarse y de tener mayores ganancias toma cursos de repostería, con los conocimientos que adquirió atiende pedidos que le hacen sus clientes,  preparando pasteles, kekes, empanadas, tortas, entre otros postres. El deseo de Vilma es de poner una boutique donde pueda ofrecer todo tipo de ropas. Con el crédito que solicito piensa invertir en su bodega comprando azúcar, leche, fideos, arroz y golosinas. Vilma es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “La Unión hace la Fuerza” grupo que está conformado por 07 personas responsables y comprometidos con el Programa- Prosperidad.La señora Vilma es la que lleva una chalina blanca y un saco color beige.
texts.en:
Vilma is 52 years old, married, and has six children, two of which are school-age and dependent on her. She is a nurse in a health center. She has been working in this field for more than 10 years. Little by little, with effort, Vilma began her own business. She has a little grocery store in her house. Thanks to her fortitude Vilma could support her children's education. 

With the idea of getting ahead and earning better income, she took pastry making courses. With what she learned she now takes orders from customers for all sorts of pastries including cakes, pies, and other sorts of desserts. Vilma's dream is to have a boutique where she can offer all types of clothes.

With the money from the loan she will invest in her grocery store, buying sugar, milk, noodles, rice, and sweets. Vilma is a member of the communal bank "La Unión hace la Fuerza" group that was started by seven responsible and committed people with the Prosperity Program. Vilma is wearing a white scarf and a beige jacket.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, noodles, rice, and sweets

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a hardworking businesswoman aged 26. She is married and blessed with one child. For the last six years, she has been managing a salon to support her family. She has employed one person to help her to manage the business. She faces the major challenge of competition, but she has retained some of her customers because of her good customer care. 

In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair chemicals and braids for her business.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and braids.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 35 years old, married to Antony. They have two children who go to school. She runs a retail shop where she has been selling assorted household goods for the last four years for a monthly profit of KES. 30,000.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy mattresses, source pans, and slippers for sale.

With the anticipated profits, she will pay school fees for her children and save.

loans.use: to buy mattresses, source pans, and slippers for sale

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is from the village of Kisiskhevi in the Kakheti region. She is 38 years old, married, and lives with her husband (Nikoloz), and two sons (16 and 13 years old). Her children go to school. Manana and Nikoloz earn a living through family agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow and a calf. Their dairy products are sold locally. Along with the dairy, they have three pigs and sell on average 30 piglets per year. Their family's total average monthly income is 450 Georgian Laris. 

Manana requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. She will sell more dairy products in the village. It will increase her family's income, which will be used for to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kasekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 3 children. For the past 10 years, Jane has been working hard to manage her wholesale shop, which sells soap, sugar, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 3000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar and soap for resale, and will help Jane to generate greater profits she will use buy food to feed her family. Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Edgar Adrian

texts.es:
Edgar Adrian tiene 18 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con la madre en Guaranda sector Cuatro esquinas Provincia Bolívar.
LA VRC Cuatro Esquinas Central está formada por 12 socios que pertenecen al sector cuatro esquinas, los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como son agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio y otros.
Edgar se dedica a la crianza de animales (pollos), estudia y se dedica también a tocar en una amplificación de disco móvil.
Las compras y ventas de los animales los realiza en la ciudad de Guaranda. El crédito lo solicita para comprar la alimentación de los animales.
El dinero del crédito le ayudará a mejorar el peso de los animales para obtener mayor utilidad en la venta.
El sueño es poder seguir en los estudios y obtener un título profesional.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta en el negocio es el descuido por ello no tienen una buena contextura el animal y muere.
En los tiempos libres le gusta el deporte en especial el boly, futbol, basket y le gusta disfrutar de las fiestas del carnaval, navidad.
texts.en:
Edgar Adrian is 18 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his mother in the Cuatro Esquinas subdivision of Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

The Communal Bank “Cuatro Esquinas Central” (Four Corners Central) consists of 12 members who live in the Cuatro Esquinas subdivision. They engage in different business activities such as farming, raising animals, retail, and other trades.

Edgar raises animals (chickens), attends school, and also operates the sound equipment for a mobile disc jockey. He buys and sells the animals in the city of Guaranda. The loan will be used to buy feed for his animals. The money from this loan will help his animals gain weight so that they will be more profitable when they are sold. His dream is to finish his studies and earn a professional degree. The challenges in his business include being careful not to neglect his animals or else they become unhealthy and die.

In his free time, Edgar enjoys sports such as volleyball, soccer, and basketball. He also enjoys the festivities during Carnival and Christmas.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build walls.

loans.name: Fana1 Group

texts.en:
Silas is 37 years old, married, and has two children age 10 and 7. He also has two other dependents. He does not have any other source of income.

He operates from a flea market in town and fulfills his orders with purchases from Harare and South Africa. The business has been in operation for 15 years and has got one employee.

The challenges he has are defaulting customers and small premises. He wishes to increase his workforce and operate in several commercial sectors. The loan will help him to increase profits so that he can sent his children to better schools and improve the family's welfare.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married to a businessman and has eight dependents. She smokes and sells fresh fish at Ankwanda, near Elmina. She wishes to increase the quantity of fish she sells; a loan will help her to acquire additional fresh fish to resell. Any profits she realizes will be reinvested for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to resell.

loans.name: Jhoyse

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Jhoyse; tiene 31 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de venta de ropa para niños pero no le fue muy bien eb este negocio y dedicio abrir una panaderia y venta de panetones,ella tiene una panaderia donde vende panes y pasteles en esta epoca del año vende panetones y lo vende al por mayor a las diferentes tiendas que venden panetones,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local mas grande para su negocio de panaderia . La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar los panetones como harina,mantequilla,azucar y pasas al por mayor.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jhoyse is 31 years old, she is married and she has 3 children. Before, she worked selling children's clothes but the business did not do very well and she decided to open a bakery where she sells panetones. She is currently engaged in selling panetone bread: she runs a bakery where she sells bread and pastries, and in this time of the year she sells panetone bread. She works from 7 am to 6 pm, and she hopes that thanks to her activity she will be able to own a bigger place for her bakery. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to prepare panetone bread such as flour, butter, sugar and raisins at wholesale price.

She is thankful for the loan provided and she commits to comply with repaying her dues according to the planned schedule.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare panetone bread such as flour, butter, sugar and raisins at wholesale price.

loans.name: Abiar

texts.en:
